translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the unclear, which is not hidden. ‚ÄúIf it is not observed‚Äù is connected.

original: gang yin pa 'di zhes bya ba dang / snang ba dang 'di yin te zhes bya bar sbyar nas rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gang yin pa 'di zhes bya ba dang / snang ba dang 'di yin te zhes bya bar sbyar nas rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to ‚Äúthis appearance‚Äù and ‚Äúthis‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis.‚Äù

original: nang du zhugs pa'i zhes bya ba ni lan yin te gsal ba'i rnam pa snang ba nang du zhugs pa ni blo la zhes byed pa'i tshig bsgyur nas so //
analyzed: nang du zhugs pa'i zhes bya ba ni lan yin te gsal ba'i rnam pa snang ba nang du zhugs pa ni blo la zhes byed pa'i tshig bsgyur nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúEnters within‚Äù is the response. The appearance of the aspect of clarity enters within the mind.

original: rang rig pa ma yin na rjes su dpag pa bzhin du yang don gsal ba ma yin par bstan pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa ma yin na rjes su dpag pa bzhin du yang don gsal ba ma yin par bstan pa ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not reflexive awareness, then, like inference, the object is not clear. ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to this.

original: don dmigs pa'i ngo bo'i blo mngon sum ma yin na /
analyzed: don dmigs pa'i ngo bo'i blo mngon sum ma yin na /
translated: If the mind that perceives the object is not direct perception,

original: thams cad mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i rigs pa bstan pa ni bdag rig min pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur zhes bstan pa'i rigs pa bstan pa ni bdag rig min pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then everything would be direct perception. The reasoning that demonstrates this is ‚Äúif it is not self-aware.‚Äù

original: bdag rig min pa'i phyogs dag la zhes bya ba ni blo gzhan gyis blo mngon sum min pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: bdag rig min pa'i phyogs dag la zhes bya ba ni blo gzhan gyis blo mngon sum min pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In the position that it is not self-aware‚Äù means in the position that the mind is not direct perception for another mind.

original: mngon sum min ni rtag tu rjes dpag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum min ni rtag tu rjes dpag par bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not direct perception, it is always to be inferred.

original: lan btab pa zhes bya ba ni blo'i snang ba rang las ngo bo rtogs par khyad par med pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'i byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: lan btab pa zhes bya ba ni blo'i snang ba rang las ngo bo rtogs par khyad par med pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i dbang po'i byed pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äú The response‚Äù is that because the appearance of the mind is not distinguished from the realization of its own entity, it is not the entity of the function of another sense faculty.

original: rang rig par bya ba nyid du log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir dang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang lkog tu gyur pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang rig par bya ba nyid du log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir dang khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang lkog tu gyur pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no misconception that it is self-awareness, because it is not accepted, and because it is accepted as being hidden.

original: rtag tu rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid yin na blo'i longs spyod par bya ba mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid yin na blo'i longs spyod par bya ba mngon sum ma yin pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: If it is always to be inferred, then it is not a direct perception that is experienced by the mind.

original: longs spyod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de dag gi blo nyid ces bya ba ste mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de dag gi blo nyid ces bya ba ste mngon sum yin no //
translated: The author now explains that it is not experienced: ‚Äútheir mind itself‚Äù means that it is a direct perception.

original: gang yin zhe na bde sdug 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag go zhes bya ba ni ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yin zhe na bde sdug 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gang dag yin pa de dag go zhes bya ba ni ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
translated: What is it? It is the specific experiences of pleasure, pain, desire, and so on. This explains its nature.

original: 'di dag blo nyid ci @202b las yin zhes pa la bstan zhes bya ba ste blo'i tshogs pa las byung ba'i phyir yin gyi nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin te rten la sogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag blo nyid ci @202b las yin zhes pa la bstan zhes bya ba ste blo'i tshogs pa las byung ba'i phyir yin gyi nye bar len pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin te rten la sogs pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The question is raised, ‚ÄúHow is this a mind?‚Äù The answer is, ‚ÄúIt is taught to be so,‚Äù because it arises from the collection of minds, but not because it is associated with the appropriating consciousness, because it is said to be the support and so on.

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag la blo nyid dam phul du byung ba dag ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid dag la blo nyid dam phul du byung ba dag ma yin te /
translated: The mind itself or the supreme self does not have the characteristics of such a nature and so on.

original: de min pa las log pas phan tshun phan 'dogs pa dag gi rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de min pa las log pas phan tshun phan 'dogs pa dag gi rgyu nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are accepted as the causes of mutual benefit, which are not other than that.

original: rten gyi dbye ba tha dad pa ni rten gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rten gyi dbye ba tha dad pa ni rten gyi khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in the basis is the difference in the support.

original: yul nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid la'o //
analyzed: yul nyid la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu nyid la'o //
translated: In the object itself means in the effect itself.

original: dmigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag gi rkyen la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa de ma thag gi rkyen la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object, etc. means the similar immediately preceding condition, etc.

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni shin tu ldog pas zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni shin tu ldog pas zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa'o //
translated: If means if it is very much reversed.

original: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni gsal ba ste las kyi ngo bo dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni gsal ba ste las kyi ngo bo dang bral ba'o //
translated: Directly means clearly, free from the nature of action.

original: de dag las gzhan pa ni de las gzhan pa ste bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral pa'i shes pa 'dzin par byed pa de dag gi rtogs med ni las ma yin pa'i ngo bos gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa ni de las gzhan pa ste bde ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral pa'i shes pa 'dzin par byed pa de dag gi rtogs med ni las ma yin pa'i ngo bos gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Other than those means different from those, the apprehension of consciousness free from the nature of pleasure, etc. The meaning is that it is clear by the nature of non-action.

original: 'dzin pa gzhan gyis kyang lkog tu ma gyur pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan gyis kyang gzhan gyis bde ba rig pa'i phyir las dang 'bras bu ma nges pa'i ngo bo yang ma byas pa 'thob pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gal te gzhan gyis zhes
analyzed: 'dzin pa gzhan gyis kyang lkog tu ma gyur pa'i ngo bo ni gzhan gyis kyang gzhan gyis bde ba rig pa'i phyir las dang 'bras bu ma nges pa'i ngo bo yang ma byas pa 'thob pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gal te gzhan gyis zhes
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIf the other . . .‚Äù teaches this.

original: bya ba'o // gzung ba nyid du rang dang gzhan du dbye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba'o // gzung ba nyid du rang dang gzhan du dbye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni gzung bar bya ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúBecause of being the object of apprehension . . .‚Äù teaches that it is not divided into self and other in terms of being the object of apprehension.

original: rang la 'du ba dang cig shos nyid kyis khyad par yod kyang ma dmigs na longs spyod pa la dgos pa can ma yin zhes zer ba la ma yin te zhes bya ba ste tshim pa ni longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rang la 'du ba dang cig shos nyid kyis khyad par yod kyang ma dmigs na longs spyod pa la dgos pa can ma yin zhes zer ba la ma yin te zhes bya ba ste tshim pa ni longs spyod pa'o //
translated: Although there is a difference in terms of being assembled with the self and being other, if it is not observed, it is not necessary to experience it. The statement ‚ÄúNo‚Äù teaches this. Satisfaction is experience.

original: dmigs pa yin yang bdag gi ma yin pa nyid la ni longs spyod pa min zhes zer ba la yid dge zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa yin yang bdag gi ma yin pa nyid la ni longs spyod pa min zhes zer ba la yid dge zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Although it is observed, if it is not the self, it is not experienced. The statement ‚ÄúThe mind is virtuous . . .‚Äù teaches this.

original: yid dge ba min pa la ni dmigs pa nyid longs spyod yin par mthong gi bdag gi ba nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid dge ba min pa la ni dmigs pa nyid longs spyod yin par mthong gi bdag gi ba nyid la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But when the mind is not virtuous, the object itself is seen as an enjoyment, not as one‚Äôs own.üîΩBut when the mind is virtuous, it is shown that the object is one‚Äôs own, not an enjoyment, because of one‚Äôs familiarity with it.

original: yid dge ba la ni ji ltar goms pas gzhan du ba nyid yin gyi bdag gi ba nyid la sogs pas ma yin par bstan pa ni yid dge min la zhes bya ba ste grub mtha' can gyi'o //
analyzed: yid dge ba la ni ji ltar goms pas gzhan du ba nyid yin gyi bdag gi ba nyid la sogs pas ma yin par bstan pa ni yid dge min la zhes bya ba ste grub mtha' can gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the mind is not virtuous‚Äù is the conclusion.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan ne //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhan ne //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means ‚Äúif it is as you say.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi rdzas nye bar spyad pas kyang rang la bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rdzas bzhin du bde ba dmigs pa na yang 'di'i rang gi bde ba bskyed par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzas nye bar spyad pas kyang rang la bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rdzas bzhin du bde ba dmigs pa na yang 'di'i rang gi bde ba bskyed par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the enjoyment of another‚Äôs property also produces pleasure for oneself, it is shown that when one perceives another‚Äôs property as an object of enjoyment, one‚Äôs own pleasure is produced.

original: 'di lta nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi bde ba skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta nyid du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi bde ba skyes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn just the same way‚Äù means that one‚Äôs own pleasure is produced.

original: de lta yin yang bdag nyid kyi bde ba la longs spyod pa ma yin nam @203a * //üîΩsnyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de lta yin yang bdag nyid kyi bde ba la longs spyod pa ma yin nam @203a * //üîΩsnyam du sems pa la /
translated: But isn‚Äôt one‚Äôs own pleasure enjoyed?

original: bdag gir ma dmigs na longs spyod ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag gir ma dmigs na longs spyod ma yin la /
translated: If it is not perceived as mine, it is not an enjoyment.

original: nye bar dmigs pa longs spyod yin na gzhan gyi yang ci ste ma yin zhes bstan pa ni gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa longs spyod yin na gzhan gyi yang ci ste ma yin zhes bstan pa ni gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the perception of what is near is an enjoyment, why is it not so for another?üîΩThe distinction between one‚Äôs own and another‚Äôs is shown to be due to the enjoyment of the object and the non-enjoyment of the object, respectively.üîΩThe objection is stated: ‚ÄúIt is not one‚Äôs own, because it is far away.‚ÄùüîΩThe reply is: ‚ÄúIt is not far away, because it is like one‚Äôs own happiness.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa dang cig shos dag la longs spyod pa dang / cig shos nyid kyis rang dang gzhan dag gi khyad par yin par bstan pa ni ma yin rang bzhin dbyer med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang cig shos dag la longs spyod pa dang / cig shos nyid kyis rang dang gzhan dag gi khyad par yin par bstan pa ni ma yin rang bzhin dbyer med phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is: ‚ÄúIt is far away, because it is the happiness of another, existing in the domain of another.‚ÄùüîΩThe reply is: ‚ÄúIt is not far away, because it is like one‚Äôs own happiness.‚ÄùüîΩThe objection is: ‚ÄúIt is far away, because it is the happiness of another, existing in the domain of another.‚ÄùüîΩThe reply is: ‚ÄúIt is not far away, because it is like one‚Äôs own happiness.‚Äù

original: ring phyir de'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba yin te gzhan gyi yul la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: ring phyir de'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba yin te gzhan gyi yul la yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: The objection is: ‚ÄúIt is far away, because it is the happiness of another, existing in the domain of another.‚ÄùüîΩThe reply is: ‚ÄúIt is not far away, because it is like one‚Äôs own happiness.‚ÄùüîΩThe objection is: ‚ÄúIt is far away, because it is the happiness of another, existing in the domain of another.‚ÄùüîΩThe reply is: ‚ÄúIt is not far away, because it is like one‚Äôs own happiness.‚Äù

original: rang gi bde ba bzhin du gzhan gyi yang rig pa la rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ring ba nyid ma yin pa kho nar bstan pa ni rig na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi bde ba bzhin du gzhan gyi yang rig pa la rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ring ba nyid ma yin pa kho nar bstan pa ni rig na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is: ‚ÄúIt is far away, because it is the happiness of another, existing in the domain of another.‚ÄùüîΩThe reply is: ‚ÄúIt is not far away, because it is like one‚Äôs own happiness.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi bde ba ni rig pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde ba ni rig pa'i rjes su zhugs pa yin yang gzhan gyi bdag nyid la'am /
translated: The objection is: ‚ÄúIt is far away, because it is the happiness of another, existing in the domain of another.‚ÄùüîΩThe reply is: ‚ÄúIt is not far away, because it is like one‚Äôs own happiness.‚Äù

original: lus la rjes su zhugs pa ma yin pa ma yin nam de'i phyir 'di longs spyod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te ma rig phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus la rjes su zhugs pa ma yin pa ma yin nam de'i phyir 'di longs spyod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gal te ma rig phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Is it not the case that it does not enter into the body? Therefore, it is taught that it is not enjoyed: ‚ÄúIf it is not known, because of ignorance.‚Äù

original: rig pa'i bde bas ni lus la chu dang 'o ma bzhin du gcig pa nyid du 'dres pa la longs spyod na lus rig pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni rig na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i bde bas ni lus la chu dang 'o ma bzhin du gcig pa nyid du 'dres pa la longs spyod na lus rig pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni rig na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it is enjoyed by the bliss of knowledge, like water and milk, mixed as one, then the body would be of the nature of knowledge. This is taught: ‚ÄúIf it is known.‚Äù

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi rig pa yin zhing bde ba bzhin du lus kyang kun du reg pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa'i ngo bo ni rang gi rig pa yin zhing bde ba bzhin du lus kyang kun du reg pa yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The nature of the body is not hidden, but is known by itself, and like bliss, the body is also touched. This is the meaning.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyis gcig tu 'dres par gyur pas gal te lus la yod pa rig pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dres par mi byed pa de lta na rang gi bde ba nyid de ltar 'dres pa rig pa yin no
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis gcig tu 'dres par gyur pas gal te lus la yod pa rig pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba dang bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dres par mi byed pa de lta na rang gi bde ba nyid de ltar 'dres pa rig pa yin no
translated: If the knowledge that exists in the body is not mixed with the bliss of another by the whole of itself, then one‚Äôs own bliss is mixed in that way, and that is known.

original: // de ltar na rang rig pa thob par 'gyur par bstan pa ni phyogs gcig gis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: // de ltar na rang rig pa thob par 'gyur par bstan pa ni phyogs gcig gis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the teaching of the attainment of reflexive awareness is by one part.

original: gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni logs na gnas pa'i gzung bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan pa zhes bya ba ni logs na gnas pa'i gzung bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The other is the object of apprehension that exists elsewhere.

original: bde ba rig pa'am rig par bya ba'i lus la gzhan du rjes su dpag pa las /
analyzed: bde ba rig pa'am rig par bya ba'i lus la gzhan du rjes su dpag pa las /
translated: The body that is known as bliss or that which is to be known, from inference elsewhere,

original: gal te rig pa'i lus la'am rig pa la rjes su zhugs ba yin na de lta ma yin par te /
analyzed: gal te rig pa'i lus la'am rig pa la rjes su zhugs ba yin na de lta ma yin par te /
translated: if it is the body that is known or if it is known, it is not otherwise.

original: rjes su ma zhugs na rang rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su ma zhugs na rang rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: If it is not known, it is not reflexive awareness. This is the classification of the state.

original: rang gi rig pa dang de'i bskyed bya nyid kyis de'i ngo bor snang ba yang gzhan gyi bde ba la sred pa ma yin te rtags las de'i rig pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de las skyes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa dang de'i bskyed bya nyid kyis de'i ngo bor snang ba yang gzhan gyi bde ba la sred pa ma yin te rtags las de'i rig pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni de las skyes pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One's own awareness and the production of that, by the nature of appearing as that, is not craving for another's bliss, because its awareness arises from the sign. This is taught by born from that.

original: de las mi skye ba rtags nyid las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las mi skye ba rtags nyid las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not born from that, it arises from the sign itself.

original: de las mi skye ba nyid kyis de'i snang ba ma yin pa dang / @203b rang gi rig pa ma yin pa yang ji ltar de'i rig pa yin zhes zer ba la de bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba ste de'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: de las mi skye ba nyid kyis de'i snang ba ma yin pa dang / @203b rang gi rig pa ma yin pa yang ji ltar de'i rig pa yin zhes zer ba la de bskyed pa dang zhes bya ba ste de'i rnam pa can no //
translated: The response to that is ‚Äúbecause it produces that.‚Äù That is, it has the aspect of that.

original: der snang ba zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: der snang ba zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearance as that‚Äù means in the nature of that.üîΩIn the inference that makes that known, both are the case. Otherwise, it would be absurd to say that it makes that known, because it is not known to be that.

original: de rig par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la yang de gnyi ga yin te gzhan du na de rig par byed pa nyid du mi rig pa'i phyir thal ches pa yin par bstan pa ni dmigs par byed pa gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ste de rig
analyzed: de rig par byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa la yang de gnyi ga yin te gzhan du na de rig par byed pa nyid du mi rig pa'i phyir thal ches pa yin par bstan pa ni dmigs par byed pa gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ste de rig
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIn the case of another object of observation,‚Äù that is, in the case of the mind that knows that.

original: pa can gyi sems la khas len pa nyid kyis de la dmigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa can gyi sems la khas len pa nyid kyis de la dmigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: By the mere fact of accepting that, it is the observation of that.

original: de las skye ba'i rtags ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du lhan cig byed pa yin par bstan pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de las skye ba'i rtags ni mig la sogs pa bzhin du lhan cig byed pa yin par bstan pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason for its arising from that is that it is a cooperating condition, like the eye faculty, etc.

original: don gyi zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don gyi ngo bo snang ba'i shugs kyis so //
analyzed: don gyi zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don gyi ngo bo snang ba'i shugs kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn reality‚Äù means by the power of the appearance of the nature of the definitive meaning.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù is the reason.

original: khyad par med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi shes pa las gzhan gyi bde ba'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: khyad par med do zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi shes pa las gzhan gyi bde ba'i shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no difference‚Äù means that there is no difference between the cognition of another person and the cognition of the pleasure of another person.

original: khyad par yod na yang de rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par yod na yang de rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if there were a difference, it would not be cognized.

original: de min ngo bo rig min phyir //
analyzed: de min ngo bo rig min phyir //
translated: Because it is not cognized as having that nature.

original: zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: This is taught by

original: ci ste de las skyes min zhing //
analyzed: ci ste de las skyes min zhing //
translated: If it is not arisen from that,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: du ba las me bzhin de yi //
analyzed: du ba las me bzhin de yi //
translated: The idea is that just as fire is inferred from smoke,

original: de yi spyi ni rig pa yin //
analyzed: de yi spyi ni rig pa yin //
translated: the universal of that is cognized.

original: zhes bya ba yin no snyam du sems pa dgag pa byed pa ni spyi dag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no snyam du sems pa dgag pa byed pa ni spyi dag kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To refute that, it says ‚ÄúUniversals are also not apprehended.‚Äù

original: mi 'dzin de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po min pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dzin de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po min pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the non-entity.

original: de 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kho na spyi 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kho na spyi 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: The nature of apprehending that is precisely the apprehension of the universal.

original: de 'dzin pa med na mi srid pa yin gyi khyad par can de'i ngo bo las gzhan yang ma yin te de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni dngos min zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa'i zhen par khyad dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i
analyzed: de 'dzin pa med na mi srid pa yin gyi khyad par can de'i ngo bo las gzhan yang ma yin te de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni dngos min zhes bya ba ste rnam par rtog pa'i zhen par khyad dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i
translated: This is what is shown by the words ‚Äúnot a real thing.‚Äù It is not a thing that is the object of conceptual adherence.

analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo spyi yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // yul gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin byed rigs zhes bas /
translated: It is the universal of the nature of the manifest, not anything else.üîΩThe definition of an object is that which is capable of producing a cognition that has its form.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa 'jog nus pa //
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa 'jog nus pa //
translated: The form of the object is the cause of the cognition that apprehends it.

original: de la / gang dang gang la nyer gzhag pa //
analyzed: de la / gang dang gang la nyer gzhag pa //
translated: whatever is placed before it,

original: de yi gzugs brnyan thob par byed //
analyzed: de yi gzugs brnyan thob par byed //
translated: it causes the attainment of its reflection.

original: ces bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: rang gi gzhung lugs bstan pa ni goms pa'i bya ba ste rmi lam bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung lugs bstan pa ni goms pa'i bya ba ste rmi lam bzhin du'o //
translated: The teaching of one's own system is the activity of cultivation, like a dream.

original: blo ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa 'am cig shos so //
analyzed: blo ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa 'am cig shos so //
translated: The mind is non-conceptual or otherwise.

original: 'jig rten rig pa ni bcom ldan 'das so //üîΩde'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tha @204a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa ni bcom ldan 'das so // de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tha @204a * //
translated: The knower of the world is the Blessed One.

original: dad pa spyi mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pa spyi mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, means because the appearance of difference and generality does not exist.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba rig pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba rig pa las so //
translated: From that means from the knowledge of others' minds.

original: mngon sum gyi lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa dang / bdag rig kyang ste de dag grub pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba'i blo la'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa dang / bdag rig kyang ste de dag grub pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba'i blo la'o //
translated: It is not hidden from direct perception, and it is self-aware. The establishment of those is in the cognition of others' minds.

original: phyi rol gyi phyogs su lhung ba'i phyir zhen pa dang cig shos kyang phyi rol nyid yin par bstan pa ni gal te na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi phyogs su lhung ba'i phyir zhen pa dang cig shos kyang phyi rol nyid yin par bstan pa ni gal te na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to show that attachment and the other are also external because they fall into the externalist position, it says if..., etc.

original: rang dbang ma yin zhes zer ba ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang dbang ma yin zhes zer ba ni de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Not independent refers to that also.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gang gi bde ba de'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni gang gi bde ba de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù means by one whose pleasure it is.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis rtogs bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis rtogs bzhin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy nature‚Äù means as it is understood by another.

original: de la ni bde ba de gang gi yin pa de la'o //
analyzed: de la ni bde ba de gang gi yin pa de la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the case of one whose pleasure it is.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd that‚Äù means the other.üîΩThe other, like the manifestation related to itself, would also be understood as that nature, but that is not the case.

original: gzhan ni rang dang 'brel pa'i gsal ba bzhin du ngo bo de yang rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na de med pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni ma yin te gzhan la zhes bya ba ste gang gi bde ba de'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni rang dang 'brel pa'i gsal ba bzhin du ngo bo de yang rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na de med pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni ma yin te gzhan la zhes bya ba ste gang gi bde ba de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other‚Äù means one whose pleasure it is.

original: brjod pa de zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: brjod pa de zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat expression‚Äù means the other.

original: steng du gnas pa yin ba ni rgol ba thams cad kyi yin gyi rigs pas ni ma yin no //üîΩgzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni de gang gi ma yin ba'o //
analyzed: steng du gnas pa yin ba ni rgol ba thams cad kyi yin gyi rigs pas ni ma yin no // gzhan dag kyang zhes bya ba ni de gang gi ma yin ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is established by another‚Äù means that it is not the case that it is established by all opponents, but not by reasoning.üîΩ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù means those for whom it is not.

original: 'on te gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni de gang gi rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyis kyang zhes bya ba ni de gang gi rjes su dpog par byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is by another‚Äù means even if it is not inferred by that.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba'i ngo bo ste rjes su dpag ba yang rang nyid rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi bde ba'i ngo bo ste rjes su dpag ba yang rang nyid rig pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means the nature of the pleasure of another. The meaning is that even inference is not self-awareness.

original: bde ba la longs spyod pas bde ba la longs spyod pa can zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bde ba la longs spyod pas bde ba la longs spyod pa can zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe experiencer of pleasure‚Äù is to be connected with ‚Äúthe experiencer of pleasure.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpog pa po gzhan bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi blo gal te 'dzin na mngon sum du byed pa khyad par can gyi mngon sum ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i longs spyod pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa po gzhan bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi blo gal te 'dzin na mngon sum du byed pa khyad par can gyi mngon sum ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i longs spyod pa can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if the mind of the nature of pleasure of another, the inferrer, apprehends, it is not a special kind of perception that makes it manifest. Therefore it is not its experiencer.

original: don mtshungs pa dag ni rang dang gzhan gyi rig pa dag la don gyi ngo bo snang bar khyad par med pa la tha dad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: don mtshungs pa dag ni rang dang gzhan gyi rig pa dag la don gyi ngo bo snang bar khyad par med pa la tha dad ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSimilar objects‚Äù are those that are not different in the appearance of the nature of the object in terms of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô awarenesses.

original: longs spyod pa dang cig shos nyid kyi khyad par nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: longs spyod pa dang cig shos nyid kyi khyad par nyid du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The difference between the experiencer and the other is not a difference in terms of the object.

original: rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa la yang yin no zhes zer ba la rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa ni rjes su dpag pa la yang yin no zhes zer ba la rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nature of the object is manifested in inference as well.

original: rnam pa mtshungs pa dag na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa mtshungs pa dag na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag go //
translated: When the forms are similar, there is perception and inference.

original: tshogs pa tha dad pa las 'di dag gi snang ba tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshogs pa tha dad pa las 'di dag gi snang ba tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: The difference in their appearance is due to the difference in the collection of conditions,

original: yul tha dad pa las ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa las ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: not to the difference in the object.

original: thag ring ba dang cig shos nyid kyis gcig la yang gsal ba dang cig shos la gsal ba dang cig shos kyi snang ba lta bu'o zhes zer ba ni snang ba'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thag ring ba dang cig shos nyid kyis gcig la yang gsal ba dang cig shos la gsal ba dang cig shos kyi snang ba lta bu'o zhes zer ba ni snang ba'i dbye bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The appearance of one object as clear and another as unclear is due to the difference in distance, etc.

original: thag ring ba nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid du snang ba ni don byed pa yin @204b gyi de las 'di gzhan yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: thag ring ba nyid la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dbye bas tha dad pa nyid du snang ba ni don byed pa yin @204b gyi de las 'di gzhan yang ma yin zhing /
translated: The difference in appearance due to the difference in the cause, such as distance, etc., is the functioning of the object, and it is not different from that.

original: 'dres par byed kyang zhes pa ma yin te de ltar snang bas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dres par byed kyang zhes pa ma yin te de ltar snang bas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not mixed, because it is contradicted by the appearance.

original: don gcig gi yul gyi tshang ma dang cig shos kyi snang ba dag 'ba' zhig yin te ser po dang cig shos lta bu yin par bstan pa ni rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gcig gi yul gyi tshang ma dang cig shos kyi snang ba dag 'ba' zhig yin te ser po dang cig shos lta bu yin par bstan pa ni rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that the object of one is the appearance of the other, like yellow and the other.

original: de yang rang gi ngo bo snang ba yin na mi rigs ngar bstan pa ni gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rang gi ngo bo snang ba yin na mi rigs ngar bstan pa ni gnyi ga'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúabiding in its own nature‚Äù is that it is not reasonable for it to appear in its own nature.üîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúboth‚Äù is that it is not reasonable for it to be a different cause.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa ni mi rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ste rtags nye ba yin zhes bya bas mngon du byed pa la dbye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyu tha dad pa ma yin par bstan pa ni mi rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ste rtags nye ba yin zhes bya bas mngon du byed pa la dbye ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe sign is close‚Äù is that there is no difference in manifestation.

original: mngon du byed pa'i byed pa po nyid tha dad pa yin yang 'bras bu yang tha dad par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i byed pa po nyid tha dad pa yin yang 'bras bu yang tha dad par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Even though the agent of manifestation is different, the effect is also different.

original: rang gi ngo bo tha dad kyang //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tha dad kyang //
translated: This is shown by ‚Äúeven though there is a difference in nature.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ste gsal ba dang cig shos nyid du mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste gsal ba dang cig shos nyid du mi rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be reasonable for it to be a manifestation and something else.

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa'i khyad par ma yin pa'o //üîΩgang gi ma mthong bas drangs pa'i bde ba de nyid longs spyod par byed pa la gang dang 'brel pa de dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i shes pa gang gi mig la sogs pa la skyes pa de nyid rig pa yin no snyam du sems pa rjes su brjod
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ces bya ba ni rnam pa'i khyad par ma yin pa'o // gang gi ma mthong bas drangs pa'i bde ba de nyid longs spyod par byed pa la gang dang 'brel pa de dang ldan pa'i shes pa'i shes pa gang gi mig la sogs pa la skyes pa de nyid rig pa yin no snyam du sems pa rjes su brjod
translated: The nature of the cognition itself is not a particular aspect.üîΩWhen one experiences the pleasure that is produced by the absence of the non-apprehension of something, the cognition that is associated with that is the cognition of the eye, etc. that has arisen. That itself is the awareness.

original: pa ni ma mthong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa ni ma mthong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought that this is so is what is referred to by the phrase ‚Äúthe non-apprehension of something.

original: rnam kun du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: rnam kun du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas kyang ngo //
translated: ‚Äù In every way means that it is not even by direct perception or inference.

original: rang gi ngo bo snang ba yin na de lta bu'i dbye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni myong ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo snang ba yin na de lta bu'i dbye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni myong ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were the appearance of its own form, it would not be of that kind. This is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúthe experience of something.

original: nges pa'i khyad par bshad pa ni ci ste 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i khyad par bshad pa ni ci ste 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù The explanation of the specific determination is ‚Äúeven if it were to occur.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i mngon sum la yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa'i mngon sum la yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äù At that time means even in the case of the direct perception of blue, etc.

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //

original: 'gyur mod ces bya ba ni rgol ba khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur mod ces bya ba ni rgol ba khas blangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGranted‚Äù means that the opponent accepts this.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi rig pa la sogs ba yang ma mthong ba kho na yin zhes zer ba la rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa bzhin du rang gi rig pa la sogs ba yang ma mthong ba kho na yin zhes zer ba la rang rig pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as with pleasure and pain, etc., self-awareness is not seen at all.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir ni rang rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ni rang rig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: myong ba tha dad pa ni gsal ba dang cig shos nyid du snang pa'i ngo bo la'o //üîΩgsal bar snang ba nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa'i mig kyang ci'i phyir ma yin zhes zer ba la mig la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba tha dad pa ni gsal ba dang cig shos nyid du snang pa'i ngo bo la'o // gsal bar snang ba nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa'i mig kyang ci'i phyir ma yin zhes zer ba la mig la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent experiences‚Äù means that the object appears as different from the subject.üîΩ‚ÄúWhy not infer the eye, etc. from the mere appearance of the object?‚Äù

original: mig la sogs pa med kyang rang rig pa bzhin du gsal ba nyid tsam las mngon sum yin par bstan pa ni dang po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa med kyang rang rig pa bzhin du gsal ba nyid tsam las mngon sum yin par bstan pa ni dang po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe eye, etc. are not different from the object‚Äù means that, like self-awareness, the eye, etc. are direct perception from the mere appearance of the object, even without the eye, etc.

original: ma gtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid du zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma gtogs pa na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid du zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf they are not excluded‚Äù means that they are direct perception.

original: de lta na ci zhig rtogs pa yin zhe na 'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ci zhig rtogs pa yin zhe na 'ga' zhig kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is realized in that way? ‚ÄúNothing at all.‚Äù

original: 'di gnyis med pa ni @205a * //
analyzed: 'di gnyis med pa ni @205a * //
translated: The absence of those two is

original: gsal ba'i dbang po las skyes pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i dbang po las skyes pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: the nature of what is produced from the sense faculty of a clear [image].

original: nye ba yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo ni gnyi ga nye ba ni mngon sum nyid la rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo ni gnyi ga nye ba ni mngon sum nyid la rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'o //
translated: The nature of what is known through analogy is the presence of both. Direct perception is not a reason.

original: gzhan du yod pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni nye ba dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du yod pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni nye ba dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it exists elsewhere‚Äù is ‚Äúbecause of the presence of that.‚Äù

original: gsal ba nyid kyi phyir thag ring ba'i phyir mngon sum nyid yin na de nyid la de kho na rgyu mtshan yin gyi /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid kyi phyir thag ring ba'i phyir mngon sum nyid yin na de nyid la de kho na rgyu mtshan yin gyi /
translated: Because of clarity, it is direct perception due to the absence of distance. That itself is the reason.

original: nye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni de'i gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni de'i gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúthe clarity of that‚Äù teaches that it is not present.

original: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni nye ba med na yang ngo //
analyzed: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni nye ba med na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven without that‚Äù means even without the presence.

original: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin par zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid kho na yin gyi mngon sum dang cig shos kyang yin ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang mngon sum ma yin par zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid kho na yin gyi mngon sum dang cig shos kyang yin ba ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception and not direct perception‚Äù means it is only direct perception, not direct perception and something else.

original: de 'di ltar ngo bo rig pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la dbye ba med par bstan pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de 'di ltar ngo bo rig pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa la dbye ba med par bstan pa ni gzhan gyi bde ba rnal 'byor pa'i mngon sum nyid yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the essence of awareness is taught to be without the division of direct perception and inference. The bliss of others is the direct perception of the yogin.

original: rang rig pa ma yin par 'di la khyad par med par bstan pa ni gang dag gis zhes bya ba ste 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa ma yin par 'di la khyad par med par bstan pa ni gang dag gis zhes bya ba ste 'dod pa'o //

original: de bzhin du ni gzhan bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni gzhan bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust like that‚Äù is like the other.

original: gdung ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa sems pa las 'khor ba can dag go //
analyzed: gdung ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa sems pa las 'khor ba can dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúTormented‚Äù is those who are in cyclic existence due to the mind of desire and so on.

original: spros zin pa ni /üîΩma mthong don gcig ldan sogs kyi //
analyzed: spros zin pa ni / ma mthong don gcig ldan sogs kyi //
translated: The one who is free of proliferation

original: zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas so //
translated: is endowed with the single meaning of nonseeing, and so on.

original: rnal 'byor pas ni gzhan la gnas pa shes pa yin gyi de las skye ba ni ma yin te rgyu med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni gzhan la gnas pa shes pa yin gyi de las skye ba ni ma yin te rgyu med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa ni /
translated: The yogin knows the state of others but is not born from that, because there is no cause.

original: gal te yul dbang dus med pas //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gal te yul dbang dus med pas // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If the three do not exist,

original: gsum 'dus pa ni rig pa yin la gzhan gyi rgyu yin gyi rnal 'byor pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa ni rig pa yin la gzhan gyi rgyu yin gyi rnal 'byor pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: the three are awareness, and the cause of others, but not of the yogin.

original: skye ba tsam ni longs spyod pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba tsam ni longs spyod pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Mere production is not experience. What is it, then?üîΩThe yogi's experience is taught:

original: myong ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i yang yin par bstan pa ni sdug bsngal skyes par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i yang yin par bstan pa ni sdug bsngal skyes par zhes bya ba'o //

original: skye ba nyid longs spyod pa cis ma yin zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: skye ba nyid longs spyod pa cis ma yin zhes zer ba la /

original: sdug bsngal la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Suffering, etc.üîΩIf it is not understood, it is not taken as an object, etc. This is taught:

original: ma rtogs na rjes su 'dzin pa la sogs par mi byed par bstan pa ni 'di ltar phan tshun zhes bya ba ste gnyi ga'i bskyed bya'i de nyid ni byed pa po gnyi ga nyed gzhi nyid yin pas sgrub par byed pa las mtshungs par rjes su 'dzin
analyzed: ma rtogs na rjes su 'dzin pa la sogs par mi byed par bstan pa ni 'di ltar phan tshun zhes bya ba ste gnyi ga'i bskyed bya'i de nyid ni byed pa po gnyi ga nyed gzhi nyid yin pas sgrub par byed pa las mtshungs par rjes su 'dzin
translated: Thus, the reality of both... The reality of both is the basis of both agents. Therefore, the producer is not taken as an object in the same way.

original: pa skyed par mi byed de /
analyzed: pa skyed par mi byed de /

original: de rig pa po'i rjes su 'dzin pa yin gyi de mi rig pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de rig pa po'i rjes su 'dzin pa yin gyi de mi rig pa'i ni ma yin te /

original: de'i 'bras bu spu ldang ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu spu ldang ba la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba la yin gyi thal 'gyur la ni ma yin no //

translated: When generating the common result, it is also the common bliss of both, so it is taught that there is no unequal joy, greater joy, or lesser joy.

analyzed: ba spu ldang ba la sogs pa thun mong ba bskyed pa na'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir ni rnam par dbye ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: myong ba yod pa dang med pa dag de'i rgyu yin par bstan pa ni rang rig pa yin na zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ma myong na'o //

analyzed: skyes pa tsam ni bde ba can nyid ma yin ba'o //

analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i phrad pa yod //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde ba can nyid ma yin no //

analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam ma yin pa la'o //

analyzed: bde pa mtshungs pa nyid ces bya ba ni skyes pa dang bud med gnyi ga'o //

analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni de dag las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù means in those two.

analyzed: der ni bde ba la'o //

original: khyed la yang rnal 'byor pa yod pa'i phyir gzhan gyi bde ba rig pa na de kho na bzhin du gdung pa ci'i phyir ma yin zhes zer ba la gang tshe rang nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyed la yang rnal 'byor pa yod pa'i phyir gzhan gyi bde ba rig pa na de kho na bzhin du gdung pa ci'i phyir ma yin zhes zer ba la gang tshe rang nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: You say that the yogi does not feel the pain of others, but you do not explain why.

original: snang ba ni ma myong ba dgag pa las dang rang gi ngo bos ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan gyi ngo bo dgag pa dang / rang nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyis gzung ba nyid dgag ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyis gsal bar byas pa ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal ni gdung ba yin zhes bstan pa yin na'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni ma myong ba dgag pa las dang rang gi ngo bos ni rjes su dpag pa las gzhan gyi ngo bo dgag pa dang / rang nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin par byed pa gzhan gyis gzung ba nyid dgag ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyis gsal bar byas pa ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal ni gdung ba yin zhes bstan pa yin na'o //
translated: ‚Äú When one does not experience‚Äù means that the yogi does not experience the pain of others, because he does not see it, and because he has no pain of his own. ‚Äú By its own nature‚Äù means that the yogi does not infer the pain of others from his own pain. ‚Äú By itself‚Äù means that the pain of others is not manifested by another, that is, by a perceiver.

original: gzhan gyi gdung ba'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi gdung ba'i 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes dgag pa nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The pain of others is not the result of the yogi‚Äôs pain.

original: de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal te dmigs pa shes pa gang gi yin pa de gdung ba ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal te dmigs pa shes pa gang gi yin pa de gdung ba ma zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to suffering, and that which has that as its object is called ‚Äúone who is tormented.‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor ba ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rig pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rig pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The yogi is not aware of the suffering of others.

original: 'on kyang shes pa gzhan gyis sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa gzhan gyis sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: However, by another cognition, like blue and so on,

original: de de'i rnam pa can de ni de la dmigs pa can yin te /
analyzed: de de'i rnam pa can de ni de la dmigs pa can yin te /
translated: that has the aspect of that, he is one who has that as his object.

original: rang la yod pa'i bde ba khyad par can gyi rang gi rig pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rang la yod pa'i bde ba khyad par can gyi rang gi rig pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He has a special bliss that is self-awareness.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa ni de gnyis su med pa'i rig par ro gcig pa rtog pa spangs ba rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa ni de gnyis su med pa'i rig par ro gcig pa rtog pa spangs ba rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa ni dga' ba skyed par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The yogi who is one taste with nondual awareness, free from conceptual thought, and ultimate self-awareness, generates joy.

original: 'di gzhan la gnas pa nyid na kho bo cag la brten nas de lta de ltar tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di gzhan la gnas pa nyid na kho bo cag la brten nas de lta de ltar tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: When he abides in that, we impute the conventional term ‚Äúhe is aware of the suffering of others.‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor pa gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rang yang dag par rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gzhan gyi sdug bsngal rang yang dag par rig pa ma yin te /
translated: The yogi is not aware of the suffering of others.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa 'di'i 'dzin byed ma yin te de med na de lta bu ji ltar yin zhes zer ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa 'di'i 'dzin byed ma yin te de med na de lta bu ji ltar yin zhes zer ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not the apprehender of such an aspect, because if it did not exist, how could it be like that? This is the meaning of the statement.

original: rang rig pa ma yin pa yang me la sogs pa bzhin du gtogs pa gdung bar byed pa cis ma yin zhes zer ba ni me la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa ma yin pa yang me la sogs pa bzhin du gtogs pa gdung bar byed pa cis ma yin zhes zer ba ni me la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And why is it not self-awareness, like fire and so on, which is the burner of what is to be burned? This is what is said.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa ste'u dang tsan dan 'dra ba nyid du yod pa'i phyir @206a * //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa ste'u dang tsan dan 'dra ba nyid du yod pa'i phyir @206a * //
translated: Because it does not exist is the meditation. Because it exists like a pestle and sandalwood.

original: ro de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa gdung bar byed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ro de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa gdung bar byed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: In that way means by the nature of being a separate burner.

original: tha dad pa'i sdug bsngal ni de ltar gdung bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i sdug bsngal ni de ltar gdung bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Separate suffering is not like that, which is to be burned.

original: rang nyid de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rig pas byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rig pas byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is itself of that nature. This is taught by the awareness-maker.

original: thams cad ni de ldan pa dang de las gzhan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad ni de ldan pa dang de las gzhan pa yang ngo //
translated: All means both that which possesses it and that which is other than it.

original: gzhan gyi bde bas sgro btags pa rtsig pas bzhin du rig pa nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin no //üîΩde'i dngos min rig min phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde bas sgro btags pa rtsig pas bzhin du rig pa nyid kyi ngo bo ma yin no // de'i dngos min rig min phyir /
translated: The superimposition of the happiness of others is not the essence of awareness itself, like a wall.

original: zhes zer ba la /üîΩdes na shes pa zhes bya ba //
analyzed: zhes zer ba la / des na shes pa zhes bya ba //
translated: It is not the entity of that, because it is not awareness.

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdes byas pa yang des phyogs su lhung ba yin te gzhan du na de las de'i rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // des byas pa yang des phyogs su lhung ba yin te gzhan du na de las de'i rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, what is called ‚Äúconsciousness‚ÄùüîΩis not the entity of that.

original: rang nyid rig pa tsam las lta bu ste bdag tu byed pa'i yul dang cig shos kyi rgyu mtshan yang 'di dag la tha dad pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang nyid rig pa tsam las lta bu ste bdag tu byed pa'i yul dang cig shos kyi rgyu mtshan yang 'di dag la tha dad pa yod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is produced by that is also biased by that, because otherwise it would not be the awareness of that, like the mere awareness of itself. The object that is made into a self and the other that is the basis of that are also different from each other. This is the meaning.

original: thams cad kyi rnal 'byor pa dang gzhan gyis yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad kyi rnal 'byor pa dang gzhan gyis yang ngo //
translated: All yogis and others also.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa dang cig shos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa dang cig shos nyid kyis so //
translated: Thus means by itself and by the other.

original: dmigs pa ni rang nyid kyi myong ba ma yin pa dang / myong ba yang cig shos kyis ste de dag ni don 'dra ba nyid yin te dmigs pa'i chos kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni rang nyid kyi myong ba ma yin pa dang / myong ba yang cig shos kyis ste de dag ni don 'dra ba nyid yin te dmigs pa'i chos kyi rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object is not one‚Äôs own experience, and experience is the other, and they are similar in meaning, because they conform to the object-referent.

original: myong ba ni rig pa ste bdag ces bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi yul lo //
analyzed: myong ba ni rig pa ste bdag ces bya ba ni nga rgyal gyi yul lo //
translated: Experience is awareness, and the object of the pride ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the self.

original: rang nyid gsal ba rtag tu rjes su 'gro ba yin pa des na de ltar thal mi 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te gzung ba dang cig shos bsnyen pa'i rang bzhin dang rang bzhin ma yin pa dag gi rig pa'i cha dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: rang nyid gsal ba rtag tu rjes su 'gro ba yin pa des na de ltar thal mi 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te gzung ba dang cig shos bsnyen pa'i rang bzhin dang rang bzhin ma yin pa dag gi rig pa'i cha dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don
translated: Since it is always concomitant with the clarity of itself, therefore, in the same way, it is not the case that there is no overextension, because the aspects of awareness of the apprehended and the other are natures and nonnatures.

original: to // dmigs ba'i chos kyi rjes su byed pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du bstan pa ni de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: to // dmigs ba'i chos kyi rjes su byed pa ni res 'ga' ba nyid du bstan pa ni de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conformity to the object-referent is taught to be occasional, and the aspect of that is called the aspect of the object.

original: myong ba'i ni rang rig pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi chos kyi rjes su byed pa bstan pa ni bdag gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba'i ni rang rig pa nyid kyis phyi rol gyi chos kyi rjes su byed pa bstan pa ni bdag gi ngo bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conformity to the object-referent of experience by means of reflexive awareness is taught to be the nature of the self, and the aspect of that is called the aspect of the self.

original: rnam pa med pa la yang yul du byed pa ni rang rig pa nyid yin pas ci'i phyir gdung bar ma byed ces zer ba la de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ste logs na gnas pa nyid ni rnam pa dang bcas pa la mi mthun pa ma yin
analyzed: rnam pa med pa la yang yul du byed pa ni rang rig pa nyid yin pas ci'i phyir gdung bar ma byed ces zer ba la de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ste logs na gnas pa nyid ni rnam pa dang bcas pa la mi mthun pa ma yin
translated: The so-called aspect that exists separately is not incompatible with the view that has an aspect.

original: zhing cig shos rnam pa med pa la yang ma yin te rig pa la bdag nyid rig par khyad bar med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhing cig shos rnam pa med pa la yang ma yin te rig pa la bdag nyid rig par khyad bar med pa'i phyir /
translated: Nor is it incompatible with the view that has no aspect, because there is no difference between awareness and reflexive awareness.

original: gzung ba nyid kyis kyang de la kun du reg pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gzung ba nyid kyis kyang de la kun du reg pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because it is the object that touches it,

original: ma reg na yang mi rig pa'i rnam pa la mngon du byed pa yin la /
analyzed: ma reg na yang mi rig pa'i rnam pa la mngon du byed pa yin la /
translated: it is the aspect that is made manifest even if it does not touch it.

original: gzhan la ni dngos de kho nar de reg par byed pa'i phyir ches shin tu gdung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni dngos de kho nar de reg par byed pa'i phyir ches shin tu gdung ba nyid yin no //
translated: But in the other case, it is the object itself that touches it, so it is very much more reasonable.

original: rang rig pa la rjes su zhugs pa ni gzhan gyi rnam pa dang de'i bde ba dag la khyad par can ma @206b yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: rang rig pa la rjes su zhugs pa ni gzhan gyi rnam pa dang de'i bde ba dag la khyad par can ma @206b yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni /
translated: But if it is accepted that reflexive awareness exists, is it not the case that the aspect of another and its pleasure are not distinct?

original: de gnyis la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThose two are not distinct.‚Äù

original: don dam par ni zhen pa ma gtogs par ro //
analyzed: don dam par ni zhen pa ma gtogs par ro //
translated: ultimately, however, there is no difference between them except for the conceptualization.

original: ji ltar ma gdung ba dang cig shos nyid yin zhe na 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar ma gdung ba dang cig shos nyid yin zhe na 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it that they are not different? He says, ‚Äúbut‚Äù and so on.

original: de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin du ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pas zhes bya ba gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin du ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not different, they are of one taste, just like the non-duality.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par bde ba zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang cig shos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam par bde ba zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang cig shos nyid kyis so //
translated: The statement, ‚Äúthe aspect of pleasure, etc., is pleasure‚Äù means that pleasure and the rest are not different from the aspect of pleasure, etc.üîΩIf they are without aspects, then the fault that is incurred in the position that they are not different is the same as that incurred in the position that they are different.

original: rnam pa med pa dag cig shos kyi phyogs dag la skyon dang cig shos mtshungs pa yin yang ji ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa la rjes su chags pa yin zhes zer ba ni zhes rab la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ste 'dod chags la sogs pa
analyzed: rnam pa med pa dag cig shos kyi phyogs dag la skyon dang cig shos mtshungs pa yin yang ji ltar rnam pa dang bcas pa la rjes su chags pa yin zhes zer ba ni zhes rab la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ste 'dod chags la sogs pa
translated: How is it that there is attachment to the position that they have aspects? He says, ‚Äúbecause of the statement in the s≈´tras, etc., that desire, etc.,üîΩare mental factors.‚Äù

original: yang ngo // mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid ni rnam pa'i dbye ba las rang gi rig pa'i dbye ba yod pa yin gyi de rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ngo // mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid ni rnam pa'i dbye ba las rang gi rig pa'i dbye ba yod pa yin gyi de rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The difference in characteristics is due to the difference in the aspects of the object, not due to the difference in the nature of the consciousness itself.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzegs zan no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzegs zan no //
translated: The one called ‚Äúconsciousness‚Äù is the one who is the atom.

original: re zhig rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub par bstan pa ni shes rab de nyid ces bya ba ste gzung bar snang ba nyid de'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: re zhig rnam pa dang bcas pa nyid du bsgrub par bstan pa ni shes rab de nyid ces bya ba ste gzung bar snang ba nyid de'i rnam pa nyid du snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The proof of the existence of the form of consciousness is stated: ‚ÄúThat very wisdom . . .‚Äù The appearance as the object is the form of that very consciousness.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba mngon sum mo //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba mngon sum mo //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù is the direct perception.

original: bstan cing zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: bstan cing zhes bya ba ni //
translated: ‚ÄúIs taught‚Äù is the inference.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad nyid //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad nyid //
translated: ‚ÄúAll consciousnesses‚Äù

original: yul rnams las ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: yul rnams las ni 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: ‚Äúarise from the objects‚Äù

original: de las gzhan rgyu yod na yang //
analyzed: de las gzhan rgyu yod na yang //
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is a cause other than that,

original: rnam 'gas yul du byas pa yin //
analyzed: rnam 'gas yul du byas pa yin //
translated: how is it that the object is grasped?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: and so on.

original: rang gi rig pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa yang ngo zhes bya bar gnas skabs las yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa dang bcas pa yang ngo zhes bya bar gnas skabs las yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSelf-awareness‚Äù is the form of consciousness.

original: gnyis ka med na 'ga' yang rtogs pa med pa ni don gyi 'brel pa med pa can no //
analyzed: gnyis ka med na 'ga' yang rtogs pa med pa ni don gyi 'brel pa med pa can no //
translated: If neither of the two is the case, there is no understanding of anything at all, and there is no connection with the object.

original: des na tha snyad ni don dang shes pa dang rtogs so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des na tha snyad ni don dang shes pa dang rtogs so zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the convention would not be ‚Äúthe object, consciousness, and understanding.‚Äù

original: rtags med pa'i phyir blo rtag tu rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtags med pa'i phyir blo rtag tu rjes su dpag par bya ba ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the mind is not always to be inferred because of the absence of a reason, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover, . . . ‚Äù

original: mngon sum nyid ni bdag nyid rig pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ni bdag nyid rig pa'o //
translated: Direct perception is the awareness of itself.

original: blo dang don dang de las snga ma'i ste 'bras bu las rtogs par bya ba 'das pa'i don can gyi blo'am /
analyzed: blo dang don dang de las snga ma'i ste 'bras bu las rtogs par bya ba 'das pa'i don can gyi blo'am /
translated: The mind, the object, and the prior effect of that are to be understood from the effect, the mind that has the past object.

original: rgyu 'bras tshogs pa ni 'dus pa la 'brel pa can no //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras tshogs pa ni 'dus pa la 'brel pa can no //
translated: The collection of cause and effect is the related.

original: gnas skabs pa ste gzhan 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs pa ste gzhan 'brel ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is momentary, because it is related to another, and because it is not related to another.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin pa ni rtogs par byed pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu yang ma yin la 'bras bu yang ma yin pa ni rtogs par byed pa ma yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is neither cause nor effect is not the revealer, because it is mistaken.

original: dbang po yod pa zhes bya ba de dag tsam gyis ni shes pa ma yin te gzhan du na blo med kyang 'thad pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba'o //üîΩnus dang ldan pa med @207a * //
analyzed: dbang po yod pa zhes bya ba de dag tsam gyis ni shes pa ma yin te gzhan du na blo med kyang 'thad pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la rgyu nyid du zhes bya ba'o // nus dang ldan pa med @207a * //
translated: It is not known by the mere presence of the sense faculty, otherwise, how could it be tenable that there is cognition in the absence of mind?üîΩThe response is: ‚ÄúIf there is no potentiality, it is not tenable.‚Äù

original: na 'thad pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni nus pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: na 'thad pa nyid ma yin par bstan pa ni nus pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúIf there is no potentiality, it is not tenable.‚Äù

original: rgyu dbang po la sogs pa ni rtags ma yin te 'bras bu la ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dbang po la sogs pa ni rtags ma yin te 'bras bu la ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause, the sense faculty, etc., is not a reason, because it is not ascertained in the effect.

original: lhan cig tu khas blangs nas mthong bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig tu khas blangs nas mthong bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: It is said that the effect is seen by accepting it together.

original: 'bras bu ni de'i yul can nyid kyis de ma 'dzin na de dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin pas lkog tu gyur pa nyams su myong ba'i shes bya yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir rtags ma yin te ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de'i yul can nyid kyis de ma 'dzin na de dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa ma yin pas lkog tu gyur pa nyams su myong ba'i shes bya yang de lta bu yin pa'i phyir rtags ma yin te ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni
translated: The effect is not a reason because it is not established, since the object of cognition that is an experience of the hidden is like that, since if the subject does not apprehend it, it does not apprehend that which is related to it.

original: ma grub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma grub pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation is: ‚ÄúIf it is not established, it is not a reason.‚Äù

original: mngon sum du grub pa nyid ni rang rig pas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du grub pa nyid ni rang rig pas rtogs pa'o //
translated: The establishment of direct perception is understood by reflexive awareness.

original: don ni de lta bu'i gsal ba'i ngo bo na yin par bstan pa ni don yod pa tsam las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ni de lta bu'i gsal ba'i ngo bo na yin par bstan pa ni don yod pa tsam las kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the above is that the nature of manifestation is taught to be the existence of the object.

original: gang kho na don gsal ba nyid kyi rtags lkog tu gyur pa de kho na yin pa'i phyir de kho na 'grel par bstan pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang kho na don gsal ba nyid kyi rtags lkog tu gyur pa de kho na yin pa'i phyir de kho na 'grel par bstan pa ni de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The very same is the reason for the manifestation of the object, since it is not hidden. Therefore, it is taught to be the commentary.

original: de nyid ces bya ba gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni len no //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni len no //
translated: The very same is the manifestation.

original: lkog tu ma gyur pa'i gsal ba ni dbang po la sogs pa tsam las byung ba'i blo yin la blo gzhan shugs kyis thob par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu ma gyur pa'i gsal ba ni dbang po la sogs pa tsam las byung ba'i blo yin la blo gzhan shugs kyis thob par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The manifestation that is not hidden is the cognition that arises from the mere sense faculty, etc., and the other cognition is not obtained by implication.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba shes pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni gsal ba shes pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: By this, the manifestation is the cognition itself.

original: gsal ba nyid kyi don ni lkog tu ma gyur pa'i shes pa yin te thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba nyid kyi don ni lkog tu ma gyur pa'i shes pa yin te thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the manifestation is the cognition that is not hidden, because it is not common.

original: gzhan yang de nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not the realization of that.

original: de'i dbang po la sogs pa la ltos ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang po la sogs pa la ltos ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it would not depend on its sense faculty, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don las gsal ba gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don las gsal ba gzhan yin no //
translated: Therefore, the manifestation is different from the object.

original: gsal ba nyams su myong ba yin pa de lta na des non pa'i don gsal ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: gsal ba nyams su myong ba yin pa de lta na des non pa'i don gsal ba yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: If the manifestation is experienced, then the object that is manifested by it is manifested, but not otherwise.

original: gsal ba nyams su myong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba nyams su myong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The manifestation is experienced.üîΩAt one time, when it is the time of the reason.

original: dus gcig gi tshe ni de nyid gang gi tshe rtags yin pa'i dus na'o//
analyzed: dus gcig gi tshe ni de nyid gang gi tshe rtags yin pa'i dus na'o//
translated: At another time, it is the time of the object.

original: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni don las tha mi dad pa 'gegs par byed pa nyid kyis dbyug pa can bzhin du khyad par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe zhes bya ba ni don las tha mi dad pa 'gegs par byed pa nyid kyis dbyug pa can bzhin du khyad par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúotherwise‚Äù is used to express the difference, like a club, by the very negation of non-difference from the object.

original: mngon sum gyis ni rang gis so //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni rang gis so //
translated: By direct perception, it is by itself.

original: thug pa med pa ni rtags de yang gzhan las yin la /
analyzed: thug pa med pa ni rtags de yang gzhan las yin la /
translated: There would be an infinite regress, because that reason would also be from another,

original: de yang gzhan rjes su dpag pa las yin gyi mi shes pa ni rtags su mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de yang gzhan rjes su dpag pa las yin gyi mi shes pa ni rtags su mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: and that would also be from another inference, but what is not known would not be a reason.

original: snang ba ni sngon po rig go zhes bya ba'i nges pas so //
analyzed: snang ba ni sngon po rig go zhes bya ba'i nges pas so //
translated: The manifestation is known as blue, by the ascertainment.

original: bya ba ni byed pa po'i bdag nyid kyi bya ba shes pa po nyid kyi ngo bo rnam par 'gyur ba'i las nyid du shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni byed pa po'i bdag nyid kyi bya ba shes pa po nyid kyi ngo bo rnam par 'gyur ba'i las nyid du shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The action is the action of the nature of the agent, which is the nature of the knower, which is known as the action itself.

original: nye bar dmigs pa'i las nyid du nye bar dmigs pa'i blo nyid kyis blo gzhan thob ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa'i las nyid du nye bar dmigs pa'i blo nyid kyis blo gzhan thob ba ma yin no //
translated: The action of being perceived is not obtained by the cognition itself, which is the cognition of being perceived.

original: las tsam la bya pa tsam ni dbang po @207b la sogs pa'i bya ba yin gyi blo ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las tsam la bya pa tsam ni dbang po @207b la sogs pa'i bya ba yin gyi blo ni ma yin no //
translated: The mere action in the mere object is the action of the sense faculties, etc., but not of cognition.

original: de'i blo nyid du yang rang rig pa la rtsod pa'i ma yin par bstan pa ni bya bas byas pa ste yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i blo nyid du yang rang rig pa la rtsod pa'i ma yin par bstan pa ni bya bas byas pa ste yin na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mere cognition itself is not taught to be the object of dispute in the self-awareness argument.

original: la las med ces bya ba ni gzhan min zhes bya ba dang sbyar te rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rtog pas dmigs kyis bsal ba'i bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: la las med ces bya ba ni gzhan min zhes bya ba dang sbyar te rjes su 'gro ba la sogs pa'i rtog pas dmigs kyis bsal ba'i bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of not in another is connected with not in something else, and the action is excluded by the conception of concomitance, etc.

original: don dam pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not ultimate.

original: gzhan las kyang ste mthong ba po las 'dzin pa'i las nyid ni de tsam ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang ste mthong ba po las 'dzin pa'i las nyid ni de tsam ma yin no //
translated: Also from another, the action of apprehending is not merely that of the seer.

original: des ni 'bras bu khyad par las bya ba'i khyad par ni blo nyid yin par zer ba ni /
analyzed: des ni 'bras bu khyad par las bya ba'i khyad par ni blo nyid yin par zer ba ni /
translated: Therefore, the difference in the effect is due to the difference in the cognition itself.

original: 'on te don ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te don ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if the object is the cognition itself,

original: de nyid ni 'dzin pa nyid yin du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'dzin pa nyid yin du zin kyang ngo //
translated: then it is the cognition itself that is apprehended.

original: blo ste gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid ni blo dang 'dzin pa yin gyi tha dad pa'i gsal bas bsgribs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo ste gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid ni blo dang 'dzin pa yin gyi tha dad pa'i gsal bas bsgribs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of both the cognition and the object is the cognition and the object, not obscured by the manifestation of something different.

original: 'di ni don gyi bdag nyid kyi khyad par dbang po la sogs pa'i bskyed bya yin no zhes zer ba ni /üîΩ'on te gsal de don nyid kyi //
analyzed: 'di ni don gyi bdag nyid kyi khyad par dbang po la sogs pa'i bskyed bya yin no zhes zer ba ni / 'on te gsal de don nyid kyi //
translated: If it is said that the difference in the nature of the object is produced by the sense faculty, etc.,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúBut if the manifestation is the object itself,üîΩthen the object is not different from the cognition.

original: de'i phyir bdag gi rnam pa 'gyur ba'i ngo bo'i blo gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gi rnam pa 'gyur ba'i ngo bo'i blo gzhan nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the cognition that has the form of the object is itself different.

original: skad cig re re zhing khyad par don gyi dbye bas ma yin par bstan pa ni skye ba dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig re re zhing khyad par don gyi dbye bas ma yin par bstan pa ni skye ba dang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is shown that it is not due to the difference in the object at each moment, with ‚Äúarising‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar tha dad pa med ce na blos 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad pa med ce na blos 'dzin pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it not different? ‚ÄúThe apprehension by the cognition‚Äù and so on.

original: tha dad pa yin na don nyid de ltar skye ba ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na don nyid de ltar skye ba ni mngon sum mo //
translated: If they were different, the object itself would be produced in that way, and that is directly perceived.

original: gang gi phyir grub pa la blos 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir grub pa la blos 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Because the mind apprehends what is already established.

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa ji ltar gnas pa'i blo'i bdag nyid yin par bstan pa ni ji ltar gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par 'dzin pa ji ltar gnas pa'i blo'i bdag nyid yin par bstan pa ni ji ltar gnas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the mind is the nature of the apprehension of different distinctions as they exist is ‚Äúas they exist.‚Äù

original: ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du ma yin pa ni nya phyis la dngul lta bu ma yin par bstan pa ni rang bzhin gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du ma yin pa ni nya phyis la dngul lta bu ma yin par bstan pa ni rang bzhin gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is not as they exist, like silver in a shell, is ‚Äúa different nature.‚Äù

original: rang dus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni don no //
analyzed: rang dus dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni don no //
translated: ‚Äú Related to its own time‚Äù means the object.

original: de la'ang zhes bya ba ni len no //
analyzed: de la'ang zhes bya ba ni len no //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù means ‚Äúin the object.‚Äù
