original: tha mi dad pa'i khyad par khas len na don nyid skad cig re re zhing skye bar bstan pa ni de 'dod na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i khyad par khas len na don nyid skad cig re re zhing skye bar bstan pa ni de 'dod na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that if one accepts the non-difference of distinctions, the object itself is produced in each moment is ‚Äúif that is accepted.‚Äù

original: tha mi dad pa'i khyad par khas len na yang shes pa re re zhing khyad bar re re la ste shes ba'i khyad par don las tha mi dang pa yin na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i khyad par khas len na yang shes pa re re zhing khyad bar re re la ste shes ba'i khyad par don las tha mi dang pa yin na /
translated: Even if one accepts the non-difference of distinctions, each distinction in each cognition, that is, the distinction of cognition, is not different from the object.

original: don dang ldan pa'i blo gzhan med par bstan pa ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i blo gzhan med par bstan pa ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that there is no other cognition that has an object is ‚Äúif this . . .

original: don brtags pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni phyi rol dang bems po dang skad cig ma dang rang rig pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: don brtags pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni phyi rol dang bems po dang skad cig ma dang rang rig pa ma yin pas so //
translated: ‚Äù What is the use of investigating an object? Because it is external, material, momentary, and not reflexive awareness.

original: rang rig pa nyid kyi sngon po de ma yin pa las log pas sngon po rig go zhes bya ba las yin par bstan pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ste rtog pa ni tha mi dad pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid kyi sngon po de ma yin pa las log pas sngon po rig go zhes bya ba las yin par bstan pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ste rtog pa ni tha mi dad pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don
translated: Since blue is reflexive awareness, it is said that ‚Äúblue is cognized because it is the opposite of what is not blue.‚Äù The statement that it is so is ‚Äúwhen . . . ‚Äù The meaning is that conceptualization is not contradictory with being undifferentiated.

original: to // don ni phyi rol lo //
analyzed: to // don ni phyi rol lo //
translated: ‚Äú Object‚Äù is external.

original: rtogs pa ni @208a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni @208a * //
translated: ‚Äú Realization‚Äù is

original: gzhan las log pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las log pa'o //
translated: the opposite of other.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Arising‚Äù is production.

original: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni snga ma nyid las da ltar ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i zhes bya ba ni snga ma nyid las da ltar ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù is the present from the past.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù is the reason.

original: long ba zhes bya ba ni brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: long ba zhes bya ba ni brtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Blind‚Äù is because of the investigation itself.

original: tha mi dad pa la yang shes pa'i ngo bo khyad par med do zhe na de yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa la yang shes pa'i ngo bo khyad par med do zhe na de yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIn the case of non-difference, is there not a difference in the nature of consciousness?‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúThat also is . . .‚Äù

original: shes pa'i shes pa nyid khyad par gyi shes pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid thal 'gyur yin par bstan pa ni gal te shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i shes pa nyid khyad par gyi shes pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid thal 'gyur yin par bstan pa ni gal te shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the nature of consciousness is the cognition of difference, he shows that it is a reductio argument: ‚ÄúIf it is called consciousness . . .‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cognition.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni lkog tu ma gyur pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIts nature‚Äù is the nature that is not hidden.

original: don med ni de ltar rab tu brjod ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: don med ni de ltar rab tu brjod ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object does not exist‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: de mi shes na shes pa mi shes pa'i phyir shes bya yang de ltar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni shes gyur nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de mi shes na shes pa mi shes pa'i phyir shes bya yang de ltar 'gyur bar bstan pa ni shes gyur nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If that is not known, consciousness is not known, so he shows that the object also is like that: ‚ÄúIf it is known . . .‚Äù

original: don rtogs so zhes bya bas don shes na de nyid kyi tshe don gyi go ba las blo shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: don rtogs so zhes bya bas don shes na de nyid kyi tshe don gyi go ba las blo shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the object is cognized, then at that time is not the mind that knows the understanding of the object?

original: dran pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa ni ma yin no snyam du sems pa ni don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought that it is not memory is expressed by ‚Äúthe object . . .‚Äù

original: sngon po dang ser po'i zhes bya ba shes pas shes pa'i shes pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po'i zhes bya ba shes pas shes pa'i shes pa yin no zhes zer ba ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe cognition of blue and the cognition of yellow are cognitions of cognition‚Äù

original: don shes tsam du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don shes tsam du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: means ‚Äúthe mere cognition of an object.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe yang ma shes na de'i tshe yang don rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang ma shes na de'i tshe yang don rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is not known, then at that time it is the object of awareness,

original: rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi don yin no zhes bya bar lan 'debs pa ni de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i bdag nyid can gyi don yin no zhes bya bar lan 'debs pa ni de'i ngo bor zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and the reply is ‚Äúthe nature of that.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo ni rig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo ni rig pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is the nature of awareness.

original: blo dang des byas pa'i khyad par yang mi shes pa nyid ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /üîΩmthong ba mthong gyur min gzhan gyi //
analyzed: blo dang des byas pa'i khyad par yang mi shes pa nyid ma yin nam zhes zer ba la / mthong ba mthong gyur min gzhan gyi //
translated: But isn‚Äôt the difference between the mind and what it produces not known?üîΩThe reply is:üîΩThe seen is not the seer,üîΩbut the seen is seen.

original: mthong gyur te rang nyid kyis ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mthong gyur te rang nyid kyis ma mthong ba'o //
translated: It is not the case that it is not seen by itself.

original: de bzhin du rang gis mthong ba yang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang gis mthong ba yang ste /
translated: In the same way, it is seen by itself.

original: shes pa mi shes na don yang bems po nyid yin pa'i phyir shes par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: shes pa mi shes na don yang bems po nyid yin pa'i phyir shes par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If cognition is not known, then the object is also insentient, and therefore it is not known.

original: mthong ba mngon sum nyid kho na snang du rung ba nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to; ;
analyzed: mthong ba mngon sum nyid kho na snang du rung ba nyid yin zhes bya ba'i don to; ;
translated: The meaning is that what is seen is only direct perception, and it is suitable to appear.

original: de bstan pa ni gal te mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni gal te mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is taught: ‚ÄúIf it is said to be seen.‚Äù

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan pa'am gzhan ma yin pa yang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni gzhan pa'am gzhan ma yin pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù means different or not different.

original: mthong ba tsam las zhes bya ba ni mthong ba las so //
analyzed: mthong ba tsam las zhes bya ba ni mthong ba las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom mere seeing‚Äù means from seeing.

original: don gyi khyad par na mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par na mthong ba nyid do //
translated: The difference in meaning is just seeing.

original: mthong ba las ni rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba las ni rtogs pa'o //
translated: From seeing, there is understanding.

original: de ci las she na de'i zhes bya ba ste khyad par gyi'o //
analyzed: de ci las she na de'i zhes bya ba ste khyad par gyi'o //
translated: From what is that? ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the difference.

original: mthong bas zhe sa bya ba ni rtog pa med pas so //
analyzed: mthong bas zhe sa bya ba ni rtog pa med pas so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúby seeing‚Äù is because there is no conception.

original: gzhan gyis mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bla la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi bla la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the seeing of others‚Äù means in the mind of others.

original: gcig nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skyes bu re re zhing tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni skyes bu re re zhing tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the same‚Äù means that each person is different.

original: don la gnas pa'i khyad par la don bzhin du ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi blo la yang rang gi ngo bo yin par go bar 'gyur @208b pa bstan pa ni khyad par de zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don la gnas pa'i khyad par la don bzhin du ngo bo la khyad par med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi blo la yang rang gi ngo bo yin par go bar 'gyur @208b pa bstan pa ni khyad par de zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The special point is that, in reality, there is no difference in the nature of things, as they are. Therefore, it is shown that even in the awareness of others, one‚Äôs own nature is understood. This is what is meant by ‚Äúthat difference.‚Äù

original: rang gis mthong ba la yang gzhan gyi ngo bo yin par go bar 'gyur zhes bya bar yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba la yang gzhan gyi ngo bo yin par go bar 'gyur zhes bya bar yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that even in one‚Äôs own perception, the nature of others is understood.

original: 'grel pa'i rim pa ni thams cad du tha dad pas rjes su bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa'i rim pa ni thams cad du tha dad pas rjes su bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The order of the commentary should be understood as different in every case.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mthong ba la dpyod pas rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mthong ba la dpyod pas rtogs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù is what is understood through the analysis of one‚Äôs own perception.üîΩ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù means one‚Äôs own perception.

original: rang nyid kyang ni bdag nyid byed pa po can no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyang ni bdag nyid byed pa po can no //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own‚Äù also means oneself, the agent.

original: bdag ma rtogs na de yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni rang gis mthong ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ma rtogs na de yod pa ma yin par bstan pa ni rang gis mthong ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the self is not understood, it is shown that it does not exist. This is what is meant by ‚Äúone‚Äôs own perception.‚Äù

original: gzhan ltos na gzhan gyis mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ltos na gzhan gyis mthong ba'o //
translated: If it depends on others, it is the perception of others.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba mthong gyur min //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba mthong gyur min //
translated: Because what is seen is not seen.

original: zhes bya ba ma grub pa nyid dang / khyad par de zhes bya ba 'di 'gal ba nyid yin ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o//
analyzed: zhes bya ba ma grub pa nyid dang / khyad par de zhes bya ba 'di 'gal ba nyid yin ba de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o//
translated: The phrase because of that means that the reason is not established and that the qualifier is contradictory.

original: don chos zhes bya ba ni blos byas pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: don chos zhes bya ba ni blos byas pa las kyang ngo //
translated: The phrase the property of the object means that the object is not created by the mind.

original: du ba yang blo'i chos can la khyad par med pa ni rtags ma yin no //üîΩthun mong ma yin pa de'i chos rang gi rig pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: du ba yang blo'i chos can la khyad par med pa ni rtags ma yin no // thun mong ma yin pa de'i chos rang gi rig pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The phrase the absence of a difference in the property of smoke means that smoke is not a logical reason.üîΩThe phrase the property of that which is not shared means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.

original: dngos po nyid la sogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni rang blo zhes bya ba rang gi rig pa las te /
analyzed: dngos po nyid la sogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni rang blo zhes bya ba rang gi rig pa las te /
translated: The phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is not a real entity, etc. The phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.

original: du ba yang rtogs pa na rtags yin pa'i rig pa ni rang rig pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩgang zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba ste /üîΩgtan tshigs kyi chos lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: du ba yang rtogs pa na rtags yin pa'i rig pa ni rang rig pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // gang zhes bya ba ni gang yang rung ba ste / gtan tshigs kyi chos lkog tu ma gyur pa kho na rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rang rig pa kho na'o //
translated: The phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.

original: blo nyid ces bya ba ni rtogs ba'i ngo bo ste rang gi rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: blo nyid ces bya ba ni rtogs ba'i ngo bo ste rang gi rig pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.üîΩThe phrase from the awareness of that means that the property of the object is known by the mind alone.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi blo'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni chos can gyi blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cognition of the subject.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni chos kyi ngo bo blo'i tshogs pa las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa yang blo nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni chos kyi ngo bo blo'i tshogs pa las skyes pa'i bde ba la sogs pa yang blo nyid du sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as‚Äù refers to the establishment of pleasure, etc., which are born from the collection of cognitions of the nature of the object, as cognition itself.

original: de kho na bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rgyu mtshungs pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rgyu mtshungs pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration is ‚Äúbecause of the similarity of the cause.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to pleasure, etc.

original: gzhan skyes zhes bya ba ni blo'i bskyed bya ma yin zhes de'i tshogs pa las byung ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan skyes zhes bya ba ni blo'i bskyed bya ma yin zhes de'i tshogs pa las byung ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBorn from another‚Äù means not born from the collection of cognitions.

original: mthong bar gyur pa ni nye bar dmigs pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bar gyur pa ni nye bar dmigs pa'i yul gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeen‚Äù refers to the object of perception, such as form, etc.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni rang gi rig pa med na rang gzhan du rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni rang gi rig pa med na rang gzhan du rnam par dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom which‚Äù refers to the fact that if there is no self-awareness, there is no distinction between self and other.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rang nga ma gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rang nga ma gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the self and the other.

original: bdag 'brel pa can rnams yin pas skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir 'brel pa can yin no zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: bdag 'brel pa can rnams yin pas skyed par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir 'brel pa can yin no zhes zer ba la /
translated: Since they are related to the self, they are the cause of its pleasure, etc. Therefore, they are related to the self.

original: rang gi bde bas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rang gi bde bas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In response, Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúBy its pleasure, etc.‚Äù

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa rnams 'byung ba mtshungs par bstan nas /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa rnams 'byung ba mtshungs par bstan nas /
translated: Having shown that they arise in dependence on a single collection,

original: blo'i 'bras bu med par bstan pa ni gzugs la sogs zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgzugs la sogs @209a * //
analyzed: blo'i 'bras bu med par bstan pa ni gzugs la sogs zhes bya ba'o // gzugs la sogs @209a * //
translated: he shows that the result of cognition does not exist: ‚ÄúApart from form, etc.‚Äù

original: pa nas dmigs pa dag ces bya ba'i bar ma gtogs pa gzhan mi dmigs na //
analyzed: pa nas dmigs pa dag ces bya ba'i bar ma gtogs pa gzhan mi dmigs na //
translated: Apart from form, etc., up to and not apprehending the object of observation,

original: gang zhig de'i 'bras bur 'gyur te 'di rnams ni 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i 'bras bur 'gyur te 'di rnams ni 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: what else is there that would be its result? The point is that these are not its result.

original: 'grel par blo dang tshogs pa mtshungs par zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa snga ma las phyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'grel par blo dang tshogs pa mtshungs par zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa snga ma las phyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the commentary, ‚Äúsimilar to the collection of cognition‚Äù means that the later one is from the earlier collection.

original: dbang po'i blo'i rgyu yin zhing 'bras bu yang dmigs pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la de la gnyis ni zhes bya ba ste dbang po las 'das pa la 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i blo'i rgyu yin zhing 'bras bu yang dmigs pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la de la gnyis ni zhes bya ba ste dbang po las 'das pa la 'bras bu nyid la sogs pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúOf these two,‚Äù because the effect, etc. are not cognized in the transcendent.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang blo'i rang gi ngo bo mthong ba las so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang blo'i rang gi ngo bo mthong ba las so //
translated: And form, etc. are seen in the nature of the cognition.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni blo med pa na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni blo med pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù when there is no cognition.

original: sred bral zhes bya ba ni mi 'byung bas rtogs pa med ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sred bral zhes bya ba ni mi 'byung bas rtogs pa med ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from craving‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúwithout cognition.‚Äù

original: de nyid du yul kho nar ro //
analyzed: de nyid du yul kho nar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that very object‚Äù means in the object alone.

original: blo nyid yin na yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: blo nyid yin na yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur par bstan pa ni /
translated: To show that even if it is cognition, it would not be unique,

original: gzugs mthong zhes bya ba ste rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gzugs mthong zhes bya ba ste rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúSeeing form,‚Äù its own nature.

original: thams cad kyi ni srog chags kyi'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi ni srog chags kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means all living beings.

original: don rnams ni gzugs mthong ba ni srog chags so so la yod pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: don rnams ni gzugs mthong ba ni srog chags so so la yod pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin no //
translated: The objects, seeing form, are different because they exist in each living being.

original: don yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du ste de las skyes pa'i phyir gzugs mthong ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don yang zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du ste de las skyes pa'i phyir gzugs mthong ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object‚Äù is just that, and ‚Äújust that‚Äù is just that, because it arises from that, because it arises from seeing form.

original: shes pa nyid yin na ni thams cad kyis thams cad nye bar dmigs par bstan pa ni thams cad kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa nyid yin na ni thams cad kyis thams cad nye bar dmigs par bstan pa ni thams cad kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were consciousness itself, it would be demonstrated that everything is perceived by everything. ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù is stated.

original: nges pa dmigs pa la ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir re zhig rang nyid kyi rig pa nyams pa ma yin pas bstan pa ni so sor rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: nges pa dmigs pa la ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir re zhig rang nyid kyi rig pa nyams pa ma yin pas bstan pa ni so sor rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: In the case of a definite perception, because it is not shared, it is not the case that one‚Äôs own awareness is impaired. ‚ÄúEach for itself‚Äù is stated.

original: thug pa med pa la khyad par mthar thug pa med pas thun mong ba nyid du gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni de ste gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thug pa med pa la khyad par mthar thug pa med pas thun mong ba nyid du gnas par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni de ste gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no end, because there is no final limit, it would not be the case that it abides as shared. ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is stated. ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù is stated.

original: rang rig pa nyid du khas mi len ba'i phyir gzhan gyi rig pas thams cad ma dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa ma yin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste ma grub pa rtags ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid du khas mi len ba'i phyir gzhan gyi rig pas thams cad ma dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa ma yin pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste ma grub pa rtags ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not accepted that the object is known by itself, it follows that everything would be unperceived by other cognitions. Therefore, the non-worldly is not supramundane, because an unestablished reason is not a reason.

original: rjes su 'gro ba mi shes pa yin na blo mngon sum nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba mi shes pa yin na blo mngon sum nyid ma yin na /
translated: If it is not known to be invariably concomitant, then cognition is not direct perception.

original: rtags ma yin par bstan pa ni rtags yod na yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtags ma yin par bstan pa ni rtags yod na yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that it is not a reason is that even when there is a reason,

original: 'di de med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yin par mi shes na de lta na don gyis go ba'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di de med na mi 'byung ba'i 'brel pa yin par mi shes na de lta na don gyis go ba'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: if the connection of that is not known, then it is not an inference by the power of the fact.

original: rtags dag ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rtags dag ni zhes bya ba ni gzhan du mthong ba'o //
translated: The reasons, etc. are seen elsewhere.

original: dbang po ni rang nye ba las 'brel pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po ni rang nye ba las 'brel pa'am /
translated: The sense faculty is not related to its own object by proximity,

original: rang nyid mthong ba las ltos pa ma yin zhing de dang gzhan bsgrub pa ma yin te thal @209b ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid mthong ba las ltos pa ma yin zhing de dang gzhan bsgrub pa ma yin te thal @209b ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: nor does it depend on seeing itself, nor does it establish itself and others, because that would be absurd.

original: ma mthong ba la rjes su dpog par byed pa'i mthong ba ni ma mthong ba zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba la rjes su dpog par byed pa'i mthong ba ni ma mthong ba zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The seeing that infers what is not seen is connected to what is called ‚Äúnot seen.‚Äù

original: 'brel tsam tshad ma nyid gnas pa'am //
analyzed: 'brel tsam tshad ma nyid gnas pa'am //
translated: Is mere connection the basis of valid cognition?

original: 'on te dbang phyug bka' yin na //
analyzed: 'on te dbang phyug bka' yin na //
translated: Or is it the word of God?

original: 'brel pa med bzhin mngon sum ni //
analyzed: 'brel pa med bzhin mngon sum ni //
translated: If direct perception is without connection,

original: chad ma nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: chad ma nyid du ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could it be valid cognition?

original: zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang cig shos kyi shes pa la ltos pa dang / cig shos kyi ngo bor rig pa'i phyir me 'brel pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang cig shos kyi shes pa la ltos pa dang / cig shos kyi ngo bor rig pa'i phyir me 'brel pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that fire is connected because it is known in the nature of itself and the other, i.e., smoke.

original: ma mthong ba'i dbang po la sogs pa ni ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gi 'brel pa las dbang po las 'das pa yin yang rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i dbang po la sogs pa ni ma mthong ba 'ga' zhig gi 'brel pa las dbang po las 'das pa yin yang rtogs pa nyid ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: One might say, ‚ÄúThe unseen sense faculties, etc., are not known through the connection of something unseen. Even though they are beyond the senses, are they not known?‚Äù

original: rtags de nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtags de nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúFrom that very evidence.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu ni res 'ga' ba yin pas 'brel pa mthong ba ni dmigs pa la sogs pa yang rgyu rnams kyi go byed yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni res 'ga' ba yin pas 'brel pa mthong ba ni dmigs pa la sogs pa yang rgyu rnams kyi go byed yin no //
translated: Since the effect is occasional, seeing the connection is also the cause of understanding the object, etc.

original: chos can de nyid dam gzhan la rjes su 'gro ba ma shes pa ni rtags ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos can de nyid dam gzhan la rjes su 'gro ba ma shes pa ni rtags ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that a reason is not a reason if one does not know whether it is concomitant with the property of the position or with something else.

original: dpe ni rjes su 'gro ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: dpe ni rjes su 'gro ba'i yul lo //
translated: An example is the domain of concomitance.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par mngon par 'dod pa'i ste rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin par mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par mngon par 'dod pa'i ste rjes su dpag pa nyid ma yin par mtshungs pa'o //
translated: Here, too, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the object of inference is not different from the object of perception, since it is similar in not being a direct perception.

original: mtshan nyid gzhan pa de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan pa de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That difference in definition does not exist,

original: rang gi ngo bo mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo mi mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because one does not see its own nature.

original: dpe la khyab pa'i sgrub byed ni de med na mi 'byung bar ma rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba ma yin yang rtogs na yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dpe la khyab pa'i sgrub byed ni de med na mi 'byung bar ma rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba ma yin yang rtogs na yang rjes su dpag pa nyid yin te /
translated: The proof of the pervasion in the example is not understood if one does not understand the invariable concomitance. Even if it is understood, it is still an inference,üîΩbecause it follows what was seen before.

original: sngar mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no zhes zer ba la rtogs pa zhes bya ba ste mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba yin no zhes zer ba la rtogs pa zhes bya ba ste mngon sum ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it is not a direct perception.

original: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa las sam /üîΩshes pa ma yin pa las so //
analyzed: ji ltar yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa las sam /üîΩshes pa ma yin pa las so //
translated: How is it known that the object of inference is not a direct perception?

original: don grub kyang blo'i grub pa rjes su dpag pa ma yin bar bstan ba ni de ma grub par zhes bya ba ste blo ma grub na'o //
analyzed: don grub kyang blo'i grub pa rjes su dpag pa ma yin bar bstan ba ni de ma grub par zhes bya ba ste blo ma grub na'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIf it is not established‚Äù teaches that the establishment of the mind is not an inference.

original: sngar bshad pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid dang ma grub pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i zhes bya ba ni ma nges pa nyid dang ma grub pa nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú As previously explained‚Äù refers to the fallacies of inconclusiveness, nonestablishment, and lack of pervasion.

original: blo mngon sum nyid ma yin na phyi rol gyi don ma grub pa bzhin du gzhan gyi sems ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir tha snyad ma lus pa grub par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni brjod dang g-yo 'gul la sogs mthong nas /
analyzed: blo mngon sum nyid ma yin na phyi rol gyi don ma grub pa bzhin du gzhan gyi sems ma grub pa nyid kyi phyir tha snyad ma lus pa grub par 'gyur bar bstan pa ni brjod dang g-yo 'gul la sogs mthong nas /
translated: If the mind is not a direct perception, then just as external objects are not established, other minds are not established. This is the point demonstrated by the statement ‚ÄúAll conventions would be established.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpog pa de khyod la mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpog pa de khyod la mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba'o //
translated: The connection is that ‚Äúyou would not infer from seeing speech, movement, and so on.‚Äù

original: sems dang 'brel pa g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid mngon sum ma yin pa la mi 'grub pa'i phyir rang la mthong ba nyid kyis khyab par mthong ba ni gzhan la @210a * //
analyzed: sems dang 'brel pa g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid mngon sum ma yin pa la mi 'grub pa'i phyir rang la mthong ba nyid kyis khyab par mthong ba ni gzhan la @210a * //
translated: The point demonstrated by the statement ‚ÄúThe effect of the mind, such as movement, is not established for you‚Äù is that the effect of the mind, such as movement, is not established for you as being related to the mind.

original: yang de go par byed pa yin par zer ba ni rang nyid kyis mthong ba ci las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang de go par byed pa yin par zer ba ni rang nyid kyis mthong ba ci las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And if it is said that it is the cause of understanding that, then it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of your seeing it?‚Äù

original: dpe dang bsgrub bya'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa tshad ma gzhan gyis yin na thug pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: dpe dang bsgrub bya'i 'brel pa 'dzin pa tshad ma gzhan gyis yin na thug pa med pa yin te /
translated: If the connection between the example and the probandum is apprehended by another valid cognition, there is an infinite regress,

original: shes pa de nyid gzhal bya'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa de nyid gzhal bya'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that cognition itself is the cognition of the object.

original: de la yang rang nyid dang 'brel pa yin na de las dang por don mthong ba dang / de las rtogs pa dang mthong ba la sogs pa yin pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang rang nyid dang 'brel pa yin na de las dang por don mthong ba dang / de las rtogs pa dang mthong ba la sogs pa yin pas thug pa med do //
translated: If it is connected to itself, then there is an infinite regress, because the object is seen first, and from that there is understanding, seeing, and so on.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni thug pa med pa'i phyir yul rtogs pa rang nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni thug pa med pa'i phyir yul rtogs pa rang nyid rtogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because there is an infinite regress, the understanding of the object is the nature of the understanding of itself.

original: yul tsam zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: yul tsam zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis khas blangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMere object‚Äù is accepted by others.

original: yid kyi blo la rtags nyid kyi don grub pas rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs las so //
analyzed: yid kyi blo la rtags nyid kyi don grub pas rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs las so //
translated: Since the mind is established as the object of inference, it is not an inference, due to the context.

original: don nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don nyid ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúObject itself‚Äù is its own characteristic.

original: rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa'i ngo bos so //
translated: ‚ÄúType‚Äù and so on means by the nature of type and so on.

original: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo rigs ma yin te de 'dzin pas ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan btab zin to zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo rigs ma yin te de 'dzin pas ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready answered‚Äù means that the nature of manifestation is not type, because it is not apprehended by that.

original: khra bo la sogs pa nang gi khyad par mi 'dzin pa ni thag ring ba la sogs pa nyid kyis mig ser la sogs pas don la ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni don gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa nang gi khyad par mi 'dzin pa ni thag ring ba la sogs pa nyid kyis mig ser la sogs pas don la ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni don gyis ma yin te /
translated: As for not apprehending the internal distinctions of variegated and so on, it is due to distance and so on, and the aspect of yellow and so on of the object is due to jaundice and so on, not due to the object.

original: shes pa yin pa ni 'di mi gsal ba shing la sogs par myos par byed la rnam par rtog pa yang mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas yin te /
analyzed: shes pa yin pa ni 'di mi gsal ba shing la sogs par myos par byed la rnam par rtog pa yang mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas yin te /
translated: That it is consciousness is due to indistinctness, as in the case of wood and so on. It is also seen to be conceptual, following the perception.

original: gzhan du na bag chags las byung ba yin gyi phyi rol la brten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na bag chags las byung ba yin gyi phyi rol la brten pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would arise from latent propensities and not be based on external objects.

original: de bstan pa ni de tshad ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni de tshad ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is taught by ‚Äúbecause it is valid cognition.‚Äù

original: snang ba las tha dad pa ma yin na shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir bden pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni 'di ci zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba las tha dad pa ma yin na shes pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir bden pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni 'di ci zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not different from appearance, it is shown that it is real because it is the nature of consciousness. What is this?

original: tshad mas zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba ma yin ba la bden pa nyid du rtogs par byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba ma yin ba la bden pa nyid du rtogs par byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By valid cognition means that it is not reasonable to cognize what is not to be cognized as real.

original: rang rig par zhes bya ba ni bde ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rang rig par zhes bya ba ni bde ba bzhin du'o //
translated: By self-awareness means like pleasure.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni mthun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni mthun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By other means it is not a common object because it is not an object of common experience.

original: ma rig pa nyid na mthong ba nyid kyi yul du rnam par rtog pa yin gyi phyir rol gyi yul du ni ma yin pa'i thun mong ba'i yul can ma yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te dran pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa nyid na mthong ba nyid kyi yul du rnam par rtog pa yin gyi phyir rol gyi yul du ni ma yin pa'i thun mong ba'i yul can ma yin par bstan pa ni ma yin te dran pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not taught that it is not a common object because it is a conceptual object of seeing itself, not an external object. By memory means that it is not a common object because it is not an object of common experience.

original: snga ma 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa ni phyir rol rig pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la 'di la snga ma'i rang bzhin nyid ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma 'di yin no zhes bya ba'i shes pa ni phyir rol rig pa ma yin nam snyam du sems pa la 'di la snga ma'i rang bzhin nyid ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBecause the nature of the former does not exist.‚Äù

original: phyir rol ma yin pa'i yul can @210b yin pa'i phyir phyi rol la ltos nas rtogs pa mi bden pa'i tha snyad kyis yul yin par bstan pa ni gzhal bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir rol ma yin pa'i yul can @210b yin pa'i phyir phyi rol la ltos nas rtogs pa mi bden pa'i tha snyad kyis yul yin par bstan pa ni gzhal bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBecause it is not an external object, it is taught to be an object by the convention of the false cognition that depends on the external.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa'i don no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa 'di yang shes pa'i don rtogs pa yin gyi blo ma yin par bstan pa ni khyed kyi blo ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i don no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa 'di yang shes pa'i don rtogs pa yin gyi blo ma yin par bstan pa ni khyed kyi blo ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúThe object of cognition is the object of consciousness, not the object of the intellect.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba med na tshad mar rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba med na tshad mar rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIf there is no experience, there is no cognition of valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba ma yin na yang rang gi rig pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni gsal min bdag tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ma yin na yang rang gi rig pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni gsal min bdag tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúEven if there is no experience, it is reflexive awareness.‚Äù

original: rang rig pa yin na phyi rol rig pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la yul ni ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /üîΩgsal ba la ni rang rig pa la'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa yin na phyi rol rig pa ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la yul ni ji ltar zhes bya ba ste / gsal ba la ni rang rig pa la'o //
translated: The object is as it is.

original: ngo bo ni yul gyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ngo bo ni yul gyi bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature is the essence of the object.

original: 'pho phyir ni 'dra ba skyed pa'i phyir yin gyi rang nyid gsal bas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'pho phyir ni 'dra ba skyed pa'i phyir yin gyi rang nyid gsal bas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is transferred because it produces a similar subsequent cognition, not because it is itself manifest,

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no connection.

original: 'brel na yang de'i bdag nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'brel na yang de'i bdag nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if there were a connection, it would acquire the nature of that object,

original: yul bzhin du ngo bo'i yang ngo bo 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul bzhin du ngo bo'i yang ngo bo 'pho ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of the object would be transferred, just as the object itself would be.

original: gsal ba de yang de las gzhan pa 'pho ba'i phyir thug pa med pa yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba de'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba de yang de las gzhan pa 'pho ba'i phyir thug pa med pa yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba de'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And that manifestation would be transferred to something else, and so there would be an infinite regress. This is demonstrated by the words, ‚ÄúAnd that manifestation would be transferred to something else.‚Äù

original: de ste yul bzhin pa'i ngo bo gang gi yin pa de'i ngo bo yang gsal ba las tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ste yul bzhin pa'i ngo bo gang gi yin pa de'i ngo bo yang gsal ba las tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: If the nature of the object is not different from the manifestation, then the nature of that object would not be different from the manifestation.

original: rang gi rig pa nyid du skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa nyid du skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It would be born as self-cognition. This is the meaning of the words.

original: phyir rol ni gsal ba la ngo bo 'phyi bas gsal ba na phyi rol du smra bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyir rol ni gsal ba la ngo bo 'phyi bas gsal ba na phyi rol du smra bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni 'o na ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since the external object is later than the manifestation, it is called external when the manifestation is present. This is what is said in the phrase if it is said that....

original: phyi rol khas blangs pas de'i ngo bo'i rig pa rang rig par brjod do zhes bstan pa ni de lta yin mod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol khas blangs pas de'i ngo bo'i rig pa rang rig par brjod do zhes bstan pa ni de lta yin mod ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since the external object is accepted, the awareness of its nature is called awareness of itself. This is taught in the phrase this may be so....

original: de nyid bzhin du na sgron ma nyid bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de nyid bzhin du na sgron ma nyid bzhin du'o //
translated: Just like that, just like a lamp.

original: sngon po la sogs pa phyir rol nyid kyang gzung ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni gal te rang las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa phyir rol nyid kyang gzung ba kho na yin par bstan pa ni gal te rang las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that external objects such as blue are only apprehended. This is stated in the phrase if it is said that....

original: de dang chos mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni sgron ma dang chos mtshungs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de dang chos mtshungs pa nyid kyis ni sgron ma dang chos mtshungs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: By the similarity to that, by the similarity to a lamp.

original: 'di'i ni shes pa'i 'brel pa can gyi gsal ba'i rig pa'i'o //üîΩ'on te rig pa 'di rang gi rig pa las gzhan pa phyir rol nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di'i ni shes pa'i 'brel pa can gyi gsal ba'i rig pa'i'o // 'on te rig pa 'di rang gi rig pa las gzhan pa phyir rol nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the awareness of the manifestation that is related to consciousness.üîΩ But if this awareness is not external, different from the awareness of itself, then it is said, if it is said that....

original: rang rig nyid du zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rang rig nyid du zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The word itself is used.

original: sgron ma bzhin du gsal bar bya ba nyid gsal par byed pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni de yang snang ba gzhan gyis ni zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde yang zhes bya ba ni sgron ma'i yang ngo //
analyzed: sgron ma bzhin du gsal bar bya ba nyid gsal par byed pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni de yang snang ba gzhan gyis ni zhes bya ba ste / de yang zhes bya ba ni sgron ma'i yang ngo //
translated: The lamp is the illuminator, since it illuminates itself.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo gsal ba la 'pho gsal ba bzung ba yin pa de bzhin du blo la yang yin par bstan pa ni de ltar blo la zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde lta na yang 'dzin par byed pa'i blo @211a * //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo gsal ba la 'pho gsal ba bzung ba yin pa de bzhin du blo la yang yin par bstan pa ni de ltar blo la zhes bya ba'o // de lta na yang 'dzin par byed pa'i blo @211a * //
translated: Just as the essence of blue, etc. is apprehended as the illuminator of the manifestation, so also is the cognition.

original: rang gi rig pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rig pa yin te /
translated: Even so, the cognition that apprehends the manifestation is self-awareness,

original: gzhan du na rig par bya ba ma rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni blo la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na rig par bya ba ma rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni blo la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: otherwise, since it would not be aware of itself, it would not be aware of anything else.

original: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta min na zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rig pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were not so, i.e. if it were not self-aware,

original: chos mtshungs pa nyid ni gsal bar byed pa nyid kyi ngo bo gnas skabs las gang gi yin pa de'o //
analyzed: chos mtshungs pa nyid ni gsal bar byed pa nyid kyi ngo bo gnas skabs las gang gi yin pa de'o //
translated: the similarity would be that the essence of the illuminator is the same as that of the manifestation.

original: de yang 'dra nyid thams cad phan tshun du //
analyzed: de yang 'dra nyid thams cad phan tshun du //
translated: And that is the similarity of all things with each other.

original: myong ba nyid ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: myong ba nyid ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: but the experience itself is obtained.

original: zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: yul ni ji ltar gsal ba yin //
analyzed: yul ni ji ltar gsal ba yin //
translated: How is the object clear?

original: gsal ba ngo bo 'pho phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ngo bo 'pho phyir ro //
translated: Because the clear nature is transferred.

original: zhes bya ba bstan nas yul dang dbang po la sogs pas bsgrubs pa'i rang gi snang ba'i blo'i ngo bo la 'pho ba yin bar bstan pa ni de phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bstan nas yul dang dbang po la sogs pas bsgrubs pa'i rang gi snang ba'i blo'i ngo bo la 'pho ba yin bar bstan pa ni de phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having taught this, he teaches that the nature of the cognition that is produced by the object, sense faculty, etc. is transferred: therefore.

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo ni yul la 'pho ba yin la /
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo ni yul la 'pho ba yin la /
translated: The clear nature is transferred to the object.

original: yul yang bdag nyid la 'pho ba'i blo'i bdag nyid yin pas de rig pas rig pa yin par bstan pa ni gzhan 'dir zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgcig gis de ltar rtogs kyang gzhan gyis ma yin te /
analyzed: yul yang bdag nyid la 'pho ba'i blo'i bdag nyid yin pas de rig pas rig pa yin par bstan pa ni gzhan 'dir zhes bya ba'o // gcig gis de ltar rtogs kyang gzhan gyis ma yin te /
translated: And the object is the nature of the cognition that is transferred to itself. Therefore, it is taught that it is cognized by the cognition of that: in this other.

original: rig pa thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'dra ba yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'dra ba yin yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though one cognizes it in this way, the other does not, because the cognition is not common. This is taught: even though similar.

original: yul gyi bdag nyid yin na rang rig blo bzhin du gzhan gyi blo yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul gyi bdag nyid yin na rang rig blo bzhin du gzhan gyi blo yang 'gyur te /
translated: If it has the nature of an object, the cognition of another would be like the cognition of oneself,

original: yul thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul thun mong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is common.

original: de'i phyir rang gsal bar gyur pa nyid gzhan gyi gsal bar gyur pa yin gyi /üîΩrang nyid rig pa nyid de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gsal bar gyur pa nyid gzhan gyi gsal bar gyur pa yin gyi / rang nyid rig pa nyid de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the very fact that it is self-illuminating is the fact that it illuminates another.üîΩBut it is not that it is self-illuminating in that way, because it is not a common cognition.

original: blo thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rang nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is demonstrated by the words ‚Äúitself‚Äù and ‚Äúitself.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir yul ni gzhan gyis rig na gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bstan pa ni don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir yul ni gzhan gyis rig na gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bstan pa ni don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For this very reason, if an object is illuminated by another, then another is also illuminated. This is what is demonstrated by the words ‚Äúobject‚Äù and ‚Äúobject.‚Äù

original: de'i ngo bos zhes bya ba ni thun mong bas yin gyi thun mong ma yin pa gsal ba'i nyid du gyur pa gzhan gyi blo'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bos zhes bya ba ni thun mong bas yin gyi thun mong ma yin pa gsal ba'i nyid du gyur pa gzhan gyi blo'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: By the word ‚Äúessence,‚Äù he means that it is a common essence, not the essence of another cognition, which is the uncommon essence of illumination.

original: blo gzhan zhes bya ba 'di la dpe bstan pa ni dper sgron zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: blo gzhan zhes bya ba 'di la dpe bstan pa ni dper sgron zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the example for the words ‚Äúanother cognition,‚Äù he says, ‚Äúfor example, a lamp.‚Äù

original: sgron gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gsal ba yin na gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
analyzed: sgron gnyis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gsal ba yin na gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba 'di la'o //
translated: The words ‚Äútwo lamps‚Äù refer to the fact that if one is illuminated by another, then another is also illuminated.

original: mar me dang bum pa dag ces bya ba ni tha dad pa dag la'o //
analyzed: mar me dang bum pa dag ces bya ba ni tha dad pa dag la'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúa lamp and a pot‚Äù refer to different things.

original: yod med dag tu 'dzin pa yis //
analyzed: yod med dag tu 'dzin pa yis //
translated: Because of the apprehension of existence and nonexistence,

original: nga rgyal bag med phrag dog las //
analyzed: nga rgyal bag med phrag dog las //
translated: From pride, heedlessness, and envy,

original: rgyal ba can min na su zhig //
analyzed: rgyal ba can min na su zhig //
translated: Who else is there who is not victorious?

original: 'gro na cho 'phrul ston nam ci /
analyzed: 'gro na cho 'phrul ston nam ci /
translated: If he goes, does he display miracles?üîΩThe author of the commentary

original: 'grel pa byed pas /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pas /
translated: says,

original: de lta min na yul yang ni //
analyzed: de lta min na yul yang ni //
translated: Otherwise, the object

original: blo dang lhan cig chos mtshungs nyid //
analyzed: blo dang lhan cig chos mtshungs nyid //
translated: would be the same as the cognition.üîΩThus, he shows that the opponent‚Äôs position is absurd.üîΩAs for our own position,

original: ces bya bas gzhan gyi ni thal ches pa yin par bstan nas rang gi phyogs la ni /
analyzed: ces bya bas gzhan gyi ni thal ches pa yin par bstan nas rang gi phyogs la ni /
translated: he says,

original: de'i phyir nged kyi blo rang nyid //
analyzed: de'i phyir nged kyi blo rang nyid //
translated: Therefore, our cognition

original: gsal ba'i ngo bos rab gsal zhing //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bos rab gsal zhing //
translated: is clearly manifest by virtue of its own nature.

original: zhes bya bas de gsal ba yin no //üîΩ@211b de bshad pa ni gzugs dang blo'i //
analyzed: zhes bya bas de gsal ba yin no // @211b de bshad pa ni gzugs dang blo'i //
translated: Thus, it is clear.üîΩThe explanation of that is

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúform and cognition.‚Äù

original: de ltar blo la blor 'dod na //
analyzed: de ltar blo la blor 'dod na //
translated: If you assert that cognition is cognition,üîΩthen the error of being the object itself is asserted to be the same as our own position, so he shows that this is eliminated by saying,

original: zhes bya bas gzung ba nyid kyi skyon gzhan du 'dod pa ni rang gi 'dod pa'i 'dra ba nyid la yang yin pas de sel ba yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis gsal gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas gzung ba nyid kyi skyon gzhan du 'dod pa ni rang gi 'dod pa'i 'dra ba nyid la yang yin pas de sel ba yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyis gsal gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is not clear is not clear by another.‚Äù

original: de ni de ltar nyams su myong bas blo yod pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang / mya ngan gyi ngo bo nyid la blo nyid med pa yin gyi mngon sum pa'i don med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bsal nas des bas bsal ba ni /
analyzed: de ni de ltar nyams su myong bas blo yod pa'i phyir 'dod pa dang / mya ngan gyi ngo bo nyid la blo nyid med pa yin gyi mngon sum pa'i don med pa ma yin no zhes bya ba bsal nas des bas bsal ba ni /
translated: Having refuted that, he refutes the other:

original: yul dang dbang po tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po tsam gyis ni //
translated: By the object and sense faculty alone,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the mind does not see.

original: nges pa las kyang blo mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa las kyang blo mthong ba yin no //
translated: The mind is seen from ascertainment.

original: nyams myong rnam shes de yang ni //
analyzed: nyams myong rnam shes de yang ni //
translated: And that experience is consciousness.

original: cha gnyis dmigs pa can gyi ni //
analyzed: cha gnyis dmigs pa can gyi ni //
translated: That also has two aspects,

original: rnam pa gcig las khyad par can //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig las khyad par can //
translated: and the object of the one is distinguished from the other.

original: shes de yis ni dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: shes de yis ni dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: That consciousness is the object of the mind.

original: zhes bya bas rnam pa gnyis nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas rnam pa gnyis nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, it is twofold.

original: ji ltar rtogs zhes bya ba ni ro la sogs pa yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs zhes bya ba ni ro la sogs pa yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: How is it understood? It follows that taste and so on are also understood.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni mngon du phyogs pa'i mig la'am gzugs la'o //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni mngon du phyogs pa'i mig la'am gzugs la'o //
translated: In that, the mind is directed to the eye or form.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni thal ches pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni thal ches pa nyid do //
translated: How? It is absurd.

original: de'i bdag nyid myong ba la //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid myong ba la //
translated: The experience of that is the mind.

original: brtsad pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: brtsad pa 'ga' yang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no dispute at all.

original: de'i don ngo bo nyid ma grub //
analyzed: de'i don ngo bo nyid ma grub //
translated: The meaning of that is not established by way of its own entity.

original: de yang dran pa las grub 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya bas don blo'i rnam pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de yang dran pa las grub 'gyur // zhes bya bas don blo'i rnam pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: And that is also established from memory.üîΩBy this it is taught that the meaning is the aspect of the mind itself.

original: dran las zhes bya ba rang rig pa yin par bstan pa ni rang rig pa grub par ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran las zhes bya ba rang rig pa yin par bstan pa ni rang rig pa grub par ma zad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: From memory means that it is taught to be reflexive awareness.

original: nyams myong ma lus ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: nyams myong ma lus ldog par 'gyur //
translated: All experience is eliminated.

original: zhes bya bas nyams su myong ba las dran pa ma yin nam /üîΩnyams su myong ba yang sngon por rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya bas nyams su myong ba las dran pa ma yin nam / nyams su myong ba yang sngon por rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: By this it is taught that memory is not from experience.

original: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ma yin zhes bya ba la nges pa ci yod //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ma yin zhes bya ba la nges pa ci yod //
translated: And experience is the experience of blue by itself, but what certainty is there that it is not the experience of another?

original: rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ni nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ni nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: The experience of oneself is experience,

original: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ni ma yin te thug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /üîΩrim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba ni ma yin te thug pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni / rim bzhin skye ba can dag ni //
translated: but the experience of another is not, because it would be endless.üîΩThose that arise in sequence

original: rtag las skye rim rung phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag las skye rim rung phyir ro //
translated: are suitable to arise from a permanent thing.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is taught by the above verses.

original: de lta yin na dus ni ring ba'i dngos po skad cig re re zhing nyams su myong bas tha dad pa la /
analyzed: de lta yin na dus ni ring ba'i dngos po skad cig re re zhing nyams su myong bas tha dad pa la /
translated: If that is so, then time is a long thing, and it is experienced as different in each moment.

original: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin na ring ba nyid du nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir dran pa ma yin la /üîΩrang gis nyams su myong ba la ni bar du ma chod par nyams su myong bas sna tshogs pa nyid du ma mtshon nas de ring ba nyid du dra na par byed la ring po gcig ni rim gyis 'jug pa rim pa ma yin pa'i bdag @212a *
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin na ring ba nyid du nyams su myong ba ma yin pa'i phyir dran pa ma yin la / rang gis nyams su myong ba la ni bar du ma chod par nyams su myong bas sna tshogs pa nyid du ma mtshon nas de ring ba nyid du dra na par byed la ring po gcig ni rim gyis 'jug pa rim pa ma yin pa'i bdag @212a *
translated: If it is experienced by another, it is not experienced as long.

original: // nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: // nyid kyi rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is experienced by itself, it is experienced without interruption, so it is not indicated as various. It is remembered as long. But one long thing does not produce a cognition that has a nonsequential nature.

original: rim gyis skye bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis skye bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: It does not produce a cognition in sequence.

original: dran pa'i dus kyi 'og tu yang //
analyzed: dran pa'i dus kyi 'og tu yang //
translated: Even after the time of memory,

original: 'di ni nges pa med la min //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa med la min //
translated: it is not indeterminate.

original: rim pa can ma yin pa yang ba dag nyid kyi rnam par sgro btags nas rim pa can gcig gis byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rim pa can ma yin pa yang ba dag nyid kyi rnam par sgro btags nas rim pa can gcig gis byed pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that a permanent, single, partless, and subtle entity is the agent, having superimposed a sequence on what is not sequential.

original: rnam 'ga' phan gdags bya min phyir //
analyzed: rnam 'ga' phan gdags bya min phyir //
translated: Because it is never helpful.

original: mi rtag pa la'ang tshad ma med //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la'ang tshad ma med //
translated: And impermanent things are not valid cognitions.

original: de mi rtag pa'i rim pa'i 'bras bu la yang tshad ma med ba la rtag pa byed pa po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de mi rtag pa'i rim pa'i 'bras bu la yang tshad ma med ba la rtag pa byed pa po nyid ma yin te /
translated: And the result of the sequence of impermanent things is not a valid cognition. Therefore a permanent thing is not the agent.

original: rim pa dang mi ldan pa ni rnam pa 'gas kyang skad cig ma dang po ma bskyed la gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang de dag tsam yin pa'i phyir dang po nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa dang mi ldan pa ni rnam pa 'gas kyang skad cig ma dang po ma bskyed la gnyis pa la sogs pa la yang de dag tsam yin pa'i phyir dang po nyid las ma 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a nonsequential thing does not generate the first moment in any way, and because the second moment and so on are just that, it does not go beyond the first.

original: rim pa dang ldan pa'i mi rtag pa yang rim pa ma yin pa skyed par byed pa ni /
analyzed: rim pa dang ldan pa'i mi rtag pa yang rim pa ma yin pa skyed par byed pa ni /
translated: And an impermanent thing that has a sequence is not the agent of a nonsequential result.

original: phan tshun 'dra ba med pa yi //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dra ba med pa yi //
translated: Because it is not mutually similar.

original: yig cha rim ldan ji ltar na //
analyzed: yig cha rim ldan ji ltar na //
translated: How can a sequence of letters

original: rim med pa la phan 'dogs byed //
analyzed: rim med pa la phan 'dogs byed //
translated: help a nonsequential result?

original: ces bya bas bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya bas bsal ba yin no //
translated: This is refuted by the line:üîΩ‚ÄúHow can a sequence of letters help a nonsequential result?‚Äù

original: de rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang dran pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa yang dran pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i slob dpon gyi dgongs pa ni shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The master‚Äôs intention is that the memory is the same as the cognition that has the aspect of the letter.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used because the cognition does not remain for a long time.üîΩThe word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used because the cognition does not remain for a long time.üîΩThe cognition does not remain for the time of many parts of the letter.

original: rang dbang yang phyi mo mang por mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha mang po'i dus na shes pa mi gnas pa'i phyir gcig de ltar gnas pa yin na gnas nyams su myong ba yang dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang dbang yang phyi mo mang por mi gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yi ge'i cha mang po'i dus na shes pa mi gnas pa'i phyir gcig de ltar gnas pa yin na gnas nyams su myong ba yang dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it remained in that way, the experience of the remaining would be remembered.

original: de mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa mi gnas na'o //
analyzed: de mi gnas pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa mi gnas na'o //
translated: If the cognition does not remain, it is not a cognition.

original: mi gnas pa ni yi ge'i cha snga ma'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa ni yi ge'i cha snga ma'o //
translated: The earlier part of the letter does not remain.

original: gnas pa dang ni mtha'i ste rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang ni mtha'i ste rtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The later part is not cognized.

original: shes pa'i dus na rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ba la 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i dus na rtogs pa yin no zhes zer ba la 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that the cognition is cognized at the time of the cognition, then the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is used.

original: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig rig pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can gyi blo gcig rig pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: The cognition that has the aspect of the letter is cognized, and so on. This is to be analyzed.

original: rig bya nyid phyir rig bya ni //
analyzed: rig bya nyid phyir rig bya ni //
translated: The rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgol ba'o // lan ni gang gi zhes bya ba nas bstan zin to zhes bya ba'i bar te /

original: bstan zin pa ni brjod pa ste de'i don dpyad zin pa'o //üîΩlhag ma ni rtsom pa nyid ni phyi mo mang po dang / ring po la sogs pa rnams mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: bstan zin pa ni brjod pa ste de'i don dpyad zin pa'o // lhag ma ni rtsom pa nyid ni phyi mo mang po dang / ring po la sogs pa rnams mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas so //
translated: The rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-evident.

analyzed: 'grel par ni phyi mo rnams mi gnas pa nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir na ring po la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig las shes pa ni gzhan gyis rig pa yin na gnas par rtogs pa ring por 'dzin pa yin gyi

original: shes bya gnas pa ni de'i de ma thag pa yin la des kyang @212b de nyid 'phang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shes bya gnas pa ni de'i de ma thag pa yin la des kyang @212b de nyid 'phang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The rest is self-evident.üîΩThe rest is self-

original: de ltar na shes pa'am yi ge yang mi gnas pa yin na gnas pa med pa yin gyi ring por 'dzin pa ni ma yin no gnas pa yin na 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na shes pa'am yi ge yang mi gnas pa yin na gnas pa med pa yin gyi ring por 'dzin pa ni ma yin no gnas pa yin na 'gyur bar bstan pa ni /
translated: Thus, if consciousness or the letter is not enduring, it is not enduring, and it is not apprehended as long.üîΩThe explanation that if it endures, it would be a transformation is:

original: gnas na go rims med par ni //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas na go rims med par ni // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it endures, there is no order.

original: go rims med pas zhes bya ba ni ngo bo med pas de nyid kyi tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir skad cig tsam nyid ji ltar ring ba yin /
analyzed: go rims med pas zhes bya ba ni ngo bo med pas de nyid kyi tshe yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir skad cig tsam nyid ji ltar ring ba yin /
translated: Without order means without essence. How could it be long, just for an instant, because it is completely perfect at that time?

original: gang gi phyir gnas pa'i shes pa'am shes bya yang ma yin pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas pa'i shes pa'am shes bya yang ma yin pas so //
translated: Because it is neither the enduring consciousness nor the object of consciousness.

original: phyi mo rnams zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i yang nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: phyi mo rnams zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i yang nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúpreceding‚Äù also illustrates consciousness.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni yod pa nyid dgag pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means negating existence.

original: de'i tshe ci'i phyir med ces zer ba la blo de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ci'i phyir med ces zer ba la blo de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: At that time, why is it said to be nonexistent? The mind is like that.

original: blo'i rtogs bya yang nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'o //
analyzed: blo'i rtogs bya yang nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang phyi ma'o //
translated: The object of the mind is also illustrated, so ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the preceding and subsequent.

original: de yang gcig yin te /
analyzed: de yang gcig yin te /
translated: And that is one.

original: skad cig ma tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is momentary.

original: de'i yod pa skad cig gzhan la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i yod pa skad cig gzhan la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Its existence does not exist in another moment.

original: rim pa ma yin pa ni rim pa dang ldan pa la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rim pa ma yin pa ni rim pa dang ldan pa la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is not gradual is not observed in that which is gradual,

original: skad cig ma gzhan na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it does not exist in another moment.üîΩThe mutual exclusion of the moments of consciousness is established by the fact that the production of the aspects is mutually exclusive.

original: phan 'dogs byed ces bya ba ni rnam pa skyed par byed par dmigs byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs byed ces bya ba ni rnam pa skyed par byed par dmigs byar 'gyur ro //
translated: The exclusion of the object is established by the fact that the object is mutually exclusive.üîΩIf the object appears as different, there is not one cognition.

original: yul tha dad par snang ba yin na blo gcig ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par byed pa yin zhes zer ba la ji ltar de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul tha dad par snang ba yin na blo gcig ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar rtogs par byed pa yin zhes zer ba la ji ltar de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is this understood?üîΩAt the time of the end, the part of the previous cognition also operates at that time, and at that time it is grasped as long.

original: mtha'i cha'i dus na snga ma'i blo'i cha'i yang de'i dus su rjes su 'jug pa yin la de'i tshe yang ring bar 'dzin pa yin no zhes zer ba la snga ma'i mtha'i bar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mtha'i cha'i dus na snga ma'i blo'i cha'i yang de'i dus su rjes su 'jug pa yin la de'i tshe yang ring bar 'dzin pa yin no zhes zer ba la snga ma'i mtha'i bar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The part of the previous end is the part of the previous cognition at the end.

original: grong khyer pa ta li pu tra'i bar du zhes bya ba bzhin du khyab pa la'o //
analyzed: grong khyer pa ta li pu tra'i bar du zhes bya ba bzhin du khyab pa la'o //
translated: up to the city of Pataliputra.

original: snga ma ni sngar thos pa'i cha gnas par khas len thos pa snga ma dang mtha'i thos pa yang yin pa'i phyir 'phel ba nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: snga ma ni sngar thos pa'i cha gnas par khas len thos pa snga ma dang mtha'i thos pa yang yin pa'i phyir 'phel ba nyid du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The former is the increase of the former, because it is the former hearing and also the final hearing that is accepted as the basis of the portion of what was heard previously.

original: dang por brjod pa'i yi ge a'a de'i 'og tu gzhan yin pa de'i dus na snga ma yang yod pa'i phyir gzhan snga ma ni mtha'i dus na snga ma'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa yin pa'am de las kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang por brjod pa'i yi ge a'a de'i 'og tu gzhan yin pa de'i dus na snga ma yang yod pa'i phyir gzhan snga ma ni mtha'i dus na snga ma'i ngo bo nyid du yod pa yin pa'am de las kyang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the letter a that is first uttered is later different, at that time the former exists, therefore the former is different. At the time of the end, the former exists as the nature of the former, or it is like that from that.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of following means because of engaging.

original: snga ma ni snga ma'i ngo bos rjes su 'gro ba ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na ngo bo gzhan gyis so zhes zer ba 'di la bstan pa ni rim pa med par gzung bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni snga ma'i ngo bos rjes su 'gro ba ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na ngo bo gzhan gyis so zhes zer ba 'di la bstan pa ni rim pa med par gzung bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The former does not follow by the nature of the former, but rather by another nature. This is taught by the phrase without apprehending a sequence.

original: rim pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma yang rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma yang rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWith a sequence‚Äù means that the former does not follow the latter.

original: rjes su 'jug pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de'i 'og tu yul ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa ma yin par bstan pa ni de'i 'og tu yul ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúnot following‚Äù is ‚Äúthe object . . .‚Äù

original: blo ni rang nyid ces bya ba'i bshad pa @213a * //
analyzed: blo ni rang nyid ces bya ba'i bshad pa @213a * //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúthe cognition itself‚Äù is ‚Äúbut if . . .

original: ni 'on te dang po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ni 'on te dang po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: at first . . . .‚Äù

original: rgyas pa ma yin pa'i sgra 'byung ba'i dus su cha tsam yong bas snga ma ni phyi ma'i tshe 'phel ba yin la snga ma'i ngo bo yang 'phel ba yin pa de lta na thug pa med do //
analyzed: rgyas pa ma yin pa'i sgra 'byung ba'i dus su cha tsam yong bas snga ma ni phyi ma'i tshe 'phel ba yin la snga ma'i ngo bo yang 'phel ba yin pa de lta na thug pa med do //
translated: When the sound is produced without expansion, the former increases at the time of the latter, and the nature of the former increases. Thus there is no infinite regress.

original: snga ma'am mtha'i bla ni yul log pa yin yang mi ldog pa de'i phyir ring ba'i blo yin no zhes zer ba la rang nyid gnas na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma'am mtha'i bla ni yul log pa yin yang mi ldog pa de'i phyir ring ba'i blo yin no zhes zer ba la rang nyid gnas na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though the object is reversed, the former or final cognition is not reversed. Therefore it is the cognition of distance.

original: khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba ni yul med par ro //
analyzed: khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba ni yul med par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no difference‚Äù means without an object.

original: yul 'dzin pa'i bya ba med kyang bya ba dang ldan pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul 'dzin pa'i bya ba med kyang bya ba dang ldan pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though there is no activity of apprehending an object, it is not that there is no activity.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa de dang ldan pa'i 'dzin pa tsam ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa ma gtogs pa de dang ldan pa'i 'dzin pa tsam ma mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time means that it is not indicated by mere apprehension that is associated with that, except for the apprehension of the self.

original: bdag go zhes bya ba'i rang rig pa'i dbye ba med pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag go zhes bya ba'i rang rig pa'i dbye ba med pa nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is not indicated by the part of self-awareness that is without differentiation.

original: rnam par dbye ba ni lan cig skyes pa'i mngon sum gyi blo gnas pa bzhin du yi ge gnas na yang mi 'jig pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni yi ge ri ma med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ni lan cig skyes pa'i mngon sum gyi blo gnas pa bzhin du yi ge gnas na yang mi 'jig pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni yi ge ri ma med ces bya ba'o //
translated: The differentiation is taught by the phrase ‚Äúthe letter does not exist,‚Äù which shows the error that if the letter were to remain like the cognition that arises once and remains, it would be permanent.

original: rtag par smra ba la lan cig skyes pa gnas pa la ni mi gnas pas khyab pa'i phyis kyi 'bad rtsol la ltos pa nyid ni 'gol ba khyab ba yin par bstan ba ni lan cig rtsal skyes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtag par smra ba la lan cig skyes pa gnas pa la ni mi gnas pas khyab pa'i phyis kyi 'bad rtsol la ltos pa nyid ni 'gol ba khyab ba yin par bstan ba ni lan cig rtsal skyes zhes bya ba'o //
