translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe single exertion that arises‚Äù teaches that the later reliance on effort is pervaded by the non-abiding of that which arises once and remains, which is pervaded by the assertion of permanence.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni phyi ma ste mig la sogs pa'am rkan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni phyi ma ste mig la sogs pa'am rkan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The other is the later one, which is either the eye and so on or the palate and so on.

original: glog la sogs pa skad cig ma'i snang ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo las tha dad pa nyid yin te snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni yi ge rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: glog la sogs pa skad cig ma'i snang ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo las tha dad pa nyid yin te snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni yi ge rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The appearance of momentary things such as lightning is different from the nature of illumination, because the appearance is different.

original: 'di ni 'bad pa phyi ma don med pa'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'bad pa phyi ma don med pa'i skyon yin no //
translated: This is the fault of the futility of subsequent effort.

original: rim gyis skyes pa'i blo du mas ba zung ba yang ring ba nyid ma yin te blo'i 'dzin pa ni shes bya 'dzin pa yin gyi mtha'i kho na'i 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis skyes pa'i blo du mas ba zung ba yang ring ba nyid ma yin te blo'i 'dzin pa ni shes bya 'dzin pa yin gyi mtha'i kho na'i 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Many minds arising in sequence do not grasp the distant object, because the grasping of the mind is the grasping of the object of cognition, not the grasping of the end alone.

original: gzhan ni bar du ma chod par skye bas 'grel ba nyid kyis 'dzin ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni du ma yis ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni bar du ma chod par skye bas 'grel ba nyid kyis 'dzin ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni du ma yis ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other is not grasped because it arises without interruption, and because it is impossible to grasp it by mere proximity.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig mas ma yin zhing gzhan gyis ma yin la /üîΩsnga mas ma yin zhing mtha' yis ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig mas ma yin zhing gzhan gyis ma yin la / snga mas ma yin zhing mtha' yis ma yin la /
translated: Because it is not by the momentary, not by the other,üîΩnot by the prior, not by the end,

original: snga mas ma yin zhing mtha' yis ma yin la /
analyzed: snga mas ma yin zhing mtha' yis ma yin la /
translated: not by the prior, not by the end,

original: thams cad kyis kyang ring po 'dzin pa ma yin gyi de'i phyir gzhan gyi rig pas de dran par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i nye bar bsdu ba ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis kyang ring po 'dzin pa ma yin gyi de'i phyir gzhan gyi rig pas de dran par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i nye bar bsdu ba ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary of that is stated: ‚ÄúTherefore, . . .‚Äù

original: du ma yang zhes bya ba ni rim gyis 'byung ba yang 'dzin byed ma yin /
analyzed: du ma yang zhes bya ba ni rim gyis 'byung ba yang 'dzin byed ma yin /
translated: ‚ÄúEven many‚Äù means that which arises gradually is not the apprehender.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du skad cig re re zhing rig pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du skad cig re re zhing rig pa yin te /
translated: It is the cognition of each instant, like the cognition of a pot, etc.

original: gzhan du na rig par bya ba mi rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs la ka dang tsa dang / da dang ta dang pa la sogs pa bzhin du ring po nyid du mi 'gyur bar @213b bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na rig par bya ba mi rig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i phyogs la ka dang tsa dang / da dang ta dang pa la sogs pa bzhin du ring po nyid du mi 'gyur bar @213b bstan pa ni /
translated: Otherwise, because that which is to be cognized is not cognized, it is shown that long would not be like ka, ca, ·π≠a, ta, pa, etc.

original: blo rnams so so tha dad du //
analyzed: blo rnams so so tha dad du //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe cognitions are individually distinct,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the summary.

original: 'on te chod pa'i dmigs pa yang mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du myur ba nyid kyis sbyar ba yin no zhes khas len na /
analyzed: 'on te chod pa'i dmigs pa yang mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du myur ba nyid kyis sbyar ba yin no zhes khas len na /
translated: But if you accept that the object that is interrupted is connected quickly, like the circle of a firebrand,üîΩthen the statement, ‚ÄúThe cognitions are individually distinct,‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa la yang cig car dmigs pa 'khrul pa yin par bstan pa ni sbyor bar byed pa'ang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa la yang cig car dmigs pa 'khrul pa yin par bstan pa ni sbyor bar byed pa'ang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúif you say that the stick is observed as having gaps.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the observation of a long stick.üîΩThe argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúthe observation of a gap in a stick, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam par chad pa la bar chad pa thal ches pa yin par bstan pa ni gal te chad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par chad pa la bar chad pa thal ches pa yin par bstan pa ni gal te chad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúif you say that the stick is observed as having gaps.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni ring por 'dzin pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni ring por 'dzin pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the observation of a long stick.üîΩThe argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúthe observation of a gap in a stick, etc.‚Äù

original: chad par snang bsam chad par snang ba la gnod pa ni ma chad par mthong bar mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang thal ches pa yin par bstan pa ni dbang bos rnam chad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: chad par snang bsam chad par snang ba la gnod pa ni ma chad par mthong bar mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la yang thal ches pa yin par bstan pa ni dbang bos rnam chad ces bya ba'o //
translated: The argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúif you say that the stick is observed as having gaps.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the observation of a long stick.üîΩThe argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúthe observation of a gap in a stick, etc.‚Äù

original: yang na skyon med pa'i dbang po nyid las chad par mthong ba la dbang po nyid las ma chad par mthong ba'i phyir phan tshun gnod pa na phyin ci log pa ste mi bden pa nyid ma chad pa dang cig shos kyi snang ba dang /
analyzed: yang na skyon med pa'i dbang po nyid las chad par mthong ba la dbang po nyid las ma chad par mthong ba'i phyir phan tshun gnod pa na phyin ci log pa ste mi bden pa nyid ma chad pa dang cig shos kyi snang ba dang /
translated: The argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúif you say that the stick is observed as having gaps.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the observation of a long stick.üîΩThe argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúthe observation of a gap in a stick, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúif you say that the stick is observed as having gaps.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the observation of a long stick.üîΩThe argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúthe observation of a gap in a stick, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúif you say that the stick is observed as having gaps.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the observation of a long stick.üîΩThe argument that the observation of a gap in a stick, etc. is mistaken is stated in the words ‚Äúthe observation of

original: gzhan yang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: Moreover, because of non-realization, this is the view of the Jains.

original: sgro 'dogs zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Superimposition is delusion.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam par chad par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni rnam par chad par mthong ba'o //
translated: All is seeing as discontinuous.

original: gang yang rung ba nyid mthong ba de bden pa ma yin zhes bya ba la yi ge'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ste thams cad du gnyi ga mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba nyid mthong ba de bden pa ma yin zhes bya ba la yi ge'i bdag nyid ces bya ba ste thams cad du gnyi ga mthong ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Seeing any one of them is not true, this is the meaning of the nature of letters, that is, seeing both everywhere.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni mig 'dzums pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni mig 'dzums pa'o //
translated: And that is the closing of the eyes.

original: rdzogs pa ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Completion is the culmination.

original: rim pa la yang dus tha dad pas rnam par chad pa ni yin par bstan pa ni rdul gcig 'das dus zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rim pa la yang dus tha dad pas rnam par chad pa ni yin par bstan pa ni rdul gcig 'das dus zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration that there is discontinuity even in a sequence because of the difference in time is a single atom in the past....

original: gzugs dang de'i blo dag la yang rnam par chad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang de'i blo dag la yang rnam par chad pa yin te /
translated: There is discontinuity even in form and the cognition of it.

original: de'i blo'i dus dang yul gzhan nyid yin par bstan pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i blo'i dus dang yul gzhan nyid yin par bstan pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration that the time and object of the cognition of that are different is in form, etc..

original: skye ba brten pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i dus kyi rim pa skye ba thob pa rnams kyi ji ltar yin zhes bsam par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: skye ba brten pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i dus kyi rim pa skye ba thob pa rnams kyi ji ltar yin zhes bsam par bya ba yin te /
translated: The arising of the basis is the order of the time of arising. It should be considered how it is for those who have attained arising.

original: gang gi gang du yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi gang du yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is not anything anywhere.üîΩIf it is seen as discontinuous, it should be understood as continuous. Is it not just a mistake to think that what is different in each moment is not different?

original: chad par mthong na ma chad par rig pa phyin ci log pa nyid skad cig la tha dad pa la tha mi dad par 'khrul pa nyid ma yin nam zhes zer ba la dbang po'i 'khrul pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chad par mthong na ma chad par rig pa phyin ci log pa nyid skad cig la tha dad pa la tha mi dad par 'khrul pa nyid ma yin nam zhes zer ba la dbang po'i 'khrul pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that it is due to the mistake of the sense faculties.

original: tha dad mtshon med kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dra bar mthong ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: tha dad mtshon med kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dra bar mthong ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Without the perception of difference, it is said that it is due to seeing similarity and so on.

original: de tha dad par mthong ba dang stobs mtshungs pa nyid ni rtogs pa nyid kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: de tha dad par mthong ba dang stobs mtshungs pa nyid ni rtogs pa nyid kyis yin gyi /
translated: The equality of power is due to the perception of difference.

original: mngon sum yin par bstan pa ni //
analyzed: mngon sum yin par bstan pa ni //
translated: The teaching on direct perception is

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: as stated.

original: yid kyi bzhin du gsal bar snang ba yang brjod pa dang 'brel pa can ma yin @214a * //
analyzed: yid kyi bzhin du gsal bar snang ba yang brjod pa dang 'brel pa can ma yin @214a * //
translated: The clear appearance according to the mind is not related to expression.

original: nam zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: It is said that it is not so.

original: dbang pos bzung ba zhes bya ba ste yid kyi la yang mngon sum gyi ngo bo sgra la rung ba nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbang pos bzung ba zhes bya ba ste yid kyi la yang mngon sum gyi ngo bo sgra la rung ba nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúSeized by the sense faculty‚Äù means that the nature of direct perception is not suitable for the mental faculty.

original: skad cig ma tha dad pa nyid bzhin du phyi mo mang po rnam par chad par mthong ba rnam par rtog pas sbyor bar byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni chod pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma tha dad pa nyid bzhin du phyi mo mang po rnam par chad par mthong ba rnam par rtog pas sbyor bar byed pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni chod pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The idea that the many moments are seen as interrupted, just like the difference in moments, is the imagination that connects them through conceptualization. This is called ‚Äúseeing as interrupted.‚Äù

original: bden te chad pa mthong ba la rim par snang ba la chad par rtog pa 'khrul par byed pa yin gyi ma chad par mthong ba'i shes bya dang de'i shes pa la ni ma yin te rim pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni don dang zhes
analyzed: bden te chad pa mthong ba la rim par snang ba la chad par rtog pa 'khrul par byed pa yin gyi ma chad par mthong ba'i shes bya dang de'i shes pa la ni ma yin te rim pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni don dang zhes
translated: It is true that in seeing as interrupted, the appearance in sequence gives rise to the error of conceiving the interruption. But it is not in the case of seeing without interruption, in the case of the object of knowledge and its cognition. This is because there is no sequence. This is taught by ‚Äúobject.‚Äù

original: bya ba'o // don snang ba dang de'i snang ba yang rtag tu ma chad pa de dag chad pa la gnod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba'o // don snang ba dang de'i snang ba yang rtag tu ma chad pa de dag chad pa la gnod pa byed pa ste /
translated: The appearance of the object and the appearance of that are always seen without interruption. They undermine the idea of interruption.

original: rigs pa dang bcas bas gnas pa ni dam pa yang 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: rigs pa dang bcas bas gnas pa ni dam pa yang 'di yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan no //
translated: This is the other.

original: de la ma chad par snang ba ni rgyu'i skyon 'dzin pa la gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la ma chad par snang ba ni rgyu'i skyon 'dzin pa la gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The appearance of the non-interrupted is the fault of the cause, not otherwise.

original: gzugs dang de'i rig pa'i snang ba dag la yang rang rig pa ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i rim pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang de'i rig pa'i snang ba dag la yang rang rig pa ma yin par rjes su dpag pa'i rim pa yin no zhes zer ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The appearance of form and its cognition are not self-cognition, but are the process of inference.

original: blo'i nus pa las ni gzhan gyi rig pa nyid du yin gyi /
analyzed: blo'i nus pa las ni gzhan gyi rig pa nyid du yin gyi /
translated: From the potency of the mind, there is the cognition of another,

original: rang gi rig pa la ma yin te gzhan dag cig car ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rig pa la ma yin te gzhan dag cig car ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but not of itself, because the simultaneous [cognition of itself] is impossible for others.

original: gsal bar byed pa nyid ni phyi rol gyi don la yin gyi /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa nyid ni phyi rol gyi don la yin gyi /
translated: Illumination is of external objects,

original: nus pa med pa'i phyir rang nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i phyir rang nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not of itself, because it is powerless.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni don rig pa rig pas gnyi ga rig pa'i blo mthong ba'i phyir te //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni don rig pa rig pas gnyi ga rig pa'i blo mthong ba'i phyir te //
translated: From what? From the cognition of the object, because the cognition of both is seen.

original: don gyi blo dang de'i blo mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi blo dang de'i blo mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of the object and the cognition of that are not seen.

original: gzugs nyams su myong ba ma rig na thams cad ma dmigs pa thob pa yin par bstan pa ni de nyid 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs nyams su myong ba ma rig na thams cad ma dmigs pa thob pa yin par bstan pa ni de nyid 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that when form is not experienced, all are obtained without being observed is this very thing.

original: cig car ba bzhin du mi mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba nyid rnam par chad ba skye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni 'o na ni rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: cig car ba bzhin du mi mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba nyid rnam par chad ba skye ba ma yin par bstan pa ni 'o na ni rnam pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that the arising of the very seeing that is interrupted is not like the instantaneous is not seen is just the aspect.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni cig car ba 'ga' zhig la ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni cig car ba 'ga' zhig la ma yin no //
translated: In that, the statement that it is not in some instantaneous is not.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni mthong ba rnam par gcad pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni mthong ba rnam par gcad pa la'o //
translated: In that, the statement that it is in the interruption of seeing is not.

original: blo ni rnam chad skye ba dag gi 'brel pa can med pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni rnam chad skye ba dag gi 'brel pa can med pa'o //
translated: The cognition is not related to the arising of the interruption.

original: cig car la zhes bya ba ni cig car ba'i 'brel ba can la'o /
analyzed: cig car la zhes bya ba ni cig car ba'i 'brel ba can la'o /
translated: In the instantaneous, the statement that it is related to the instantaneous is not.

original: rnam par ma chad par mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i blo rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par ma chad par mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i blo rnams kyi'o //
translated: Because of the seeing without interruption, the statement that it is of the cognitions of different types is not.

original: cig car skye ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi shes pa dang de'i shes pa dag go //
analyzed: cig car skye ba zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi shes pa dang de'i shes pa dag go //
translated: Simultaneous arising means the form cognition and the cognition of that.

original: 'on te cig car mthong ba'i phyir rigs mthun pa rnams las rigs mthun pa rnams yin na /
analyzed: 'on te cig car mthong ba'i phyir rigs mthun pa rnams las rigs mthun pa rnams yin na /
translated: But if it is from those of the same type, because they are seen simultaneously,üîΩwhy is it not from those of a different type, because they are seen gradually?

original: rim gyis mthong ba las rigs mi mthun pa las cis mi 'gyur @214b zhes bstan pa ni de rnams zhes bya ba ste rim pa bzhin du rim pa ma yin pa yang rtogs pas grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rim gyis mthong ba las rigs mi mthun pa las cis mi 'gyur @214b zhes bstan pa ni de rnams zhes bya ba ste rim pa bzhin du rim pa ma yin pa yang rtogs pas grub pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not established that those are gradually understood, because they are not understood in sequence.

original: rnam par rtogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa rnams cig car skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtogs pa rnams zhes bya ba ni rigs mthun pa rnams cig car skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of those is not simultaneous arising of those of the same type.

original: thams cad nyid ni rigs mi mthun pa yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad nyid ni rigs mi mthun pa yang ngo //
translated: All are of a different type.

original: shes pa cig car ba nyid la yang de'i shes pa la sogs pa yang yin pas thug pa med pa'i phyir gcig gi yang rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa cig car ba nyid la yang de'i shes pa la sogs pa yang yin pas thug pa med pa'i phyir gcig gi yang rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: And because there is no end to the cognition of that cognition and so on, even one is not understood.

original: de bdag nyid byed don rig la //
analyzed: de bdag nyid byed don rig la //
translated: The meaning of that is understood by oneself.

original: bdag nyid shes par mi 'dod de //
analyzed: bdag nyid shes par mi 'dod de //
translated: One does not assert that it is understood by itself.

original: de phyir gsal bar byed nyid la'ang //
analyzed: de phyir gsal bar byed nyid la'ang //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that the mind is the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is perceived.

original: rtogs phyir gzhan la sdod par byed //
analyzed: rtogs phyir gzhan la sdod par byed //
translated: And it is not reasonable to say that the mind is the apprehender of itself, because the agent and the action are not the same.

original: ces bya ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di ni rigs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is the argument.üîΩ‚Äú This‚Äù refers to the fact that if the experience of the object is discontinuous, the experience of the mind is also discontinuous, because all experience of the senses is meaningless.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is perceived.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of itself, because the agent and the action are not the same.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par chad par nyams su myong ba la ma chad par nyams su myong ba ni dbang po'i nyams su myong ba thams cad don med pas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par chad par nyams su myong ba la ma chad par nyams su myong ba ni dbang po'i nyams su myong ba thams cad don med pas so //
translated: The mind is not the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is perceived.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of itself, because the agent and the action are not the same.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is perceived.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of itself, because the agent and the action are not the same.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is perceived.

original: rnam par chad pa goms pa'i dbang po'i bya ba las dang po nyid du nyams su myong bar 'du byed ba grogs su gyur ba las /
analyzed: rnam par chad pa goms pa'i dbang po'i bya ba las dang po nyid du nyams su myong bar 'du byed ba grogs su gyur ba las /
translated: The mind is not the apprehender of itself, because the agent and the action are not the same.

original: rtog pa med pa'am cig shos kyang rung ba ma chad par na 'dzin pa yin zhes bya ba rgyal dpog pa'i 'dod pa bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'am cig shos kyang rung ba ma chad par na 'dzin pa yin zhes bya ba rgyal dpog pa'i 'dod pa bsal ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The mind is not the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is perceived.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of itself, because the agent and the action are not the same.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is perceived.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of itself, because the agent and the action are not the same.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is perceived.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of itself, because the agent and the action are not the same.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is perceived.üîΩThe mind is not the apprehender of itself, because the agent and the action are not the same.

original: dbang po las skyes pa'i rnam par chad pa mthong ba la de'i dus su de las skyes pa'i ma chad pa la de'i rigs te /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa'i rnam par chad pa mthong ba la de'i dus su de las skyes pa'i ma chad pa la de'i rigs te /
translated: The mind is not the apprehender of the object, because the mind is not perceived at the time the object is

original: rigs mthun pa'i nus pa'i nges pa 'dis bsal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rigs mthun pa'i nus pa'i nges pa 'dis bsal ba yang yin no //
translated: This is also the ascertainment of the capacity of a homogeneous type.

original: bsal bar snang bas zhes bya ba ni rigs dang stobs mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsal bar snang bas zhes bya ba ni rigs dang stobs mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the appearance of the exclusion‚Äù means by the similarity of type and strength.

original: rnam par chad pas nyams su myong bas gnod pa yang de yin te /
analyzed: rnam par chad pas nyams su myong bas gnod pa yang de yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is also impaired by the experience of discontinuity.‚Äù

original: bregs nas skyes pa'i skra la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: bregs nas skyes pa'i skra la sogs pa la'o //
translated: This refers to hair, etc., that has been cut.

original: 'di'i gnod pa'i rgyu mtshan rab rib bzhin du gzhan ma yin par bstan pa na skra dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di'i gnod pa'i rgyu mtshan rab rib bzhin du gzhan ma yin par bstan pa na skra dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When it is shown that the reason for the impairment is not something other than the hair, etc., as in the case of blurred vision, the text says ‚Äúhair, etc.‚Äù

original: rigs ni sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs ni sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
translated: A type is not the reason for the recognition of what was seen before,

original: khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a particular.

original: khyad par nyid du rigs min no //
analyzed: khyad par nyid du rigs min no //
translated: It is not a particular.

original: zhes bya bar ni mu cor smra ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bar ni mu cor smra ba yin no //
translated: This is just babbling.

original: rnam par chad pa rig pa po la ni de lta bu'i gnod par byed pa cung zad kyang med par bstan pa ni de 'dra'i blo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par chad pa rig pa po la ni de lta bu'i gnod par byed pa cung zad kyang med par bstan pa ni de 'dra'i blo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is shown that the knower of discontinuity is not impaired in the slightest way by this, and so the text says ‚Äúsuch a cognition.‚Äù

original: der ni zhes bya ni skra la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ni skra la sogs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù refers to hair, etc.

original: gal te rnam par ma chad pa'i shes pa nyid gnod par byed pa'am sdud par byed par cis mi 'gyur gang gi phyir dran pa dang dbang po'i mthong ba la gcig par mngon par shes pa yin na'o //üîΩmthong ba'i bag chags las byung ba dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa snang ba las khang pa'i nang du @215a * //
analyzed: gal te rnam par ma chad pa'i shes pa nyid gnod par byed pa'am sdud par byed par cis mi 'gyur gang gi phyir dran pa dang dbang po'i mthong ba la gcig par mngon par shes pa yin na'o // mthong ba'i bag chags las byung ba dbang po las skyes pa ma yin pa snang ba las khang pa'i nang du @215a * //
translated: Why would the non-divided cognition itself not be the one that is harmed or the one that gathers? Because the recollection and the seeing of the sense faculty are cognized as one.

original: zhugs pa'i mig gi nus pa yongs su smin pa las byung ba dang / mi 'gor 'ongs pa tsam gyis ji ltar bsgrun pa yin zhes bstan pa ni sngon myong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa'i mig gi nus pa yongs su smin pa las byung ba dang / mi 'gor 'ongs pa tsam gyis ji ltar bsgrun pa yin zhes bstan pa ni sngon myong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Arisen from the latent impressions of seeing, not arisen from the sense faculty, from the potential of the eye that arises from the ripening of the potential that enters the house of appearance, how is it that it is just as it was before? This is taught by ‚Äúfrom what was previously experienced.‚Äù

original: de'i chos ni de dang gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i chos ni de dang gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Its property is being the same as that.

original: bdag dbang pos grogs byas pa ni dran par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag dbang pos grogs byas pa ni dran par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The self, assisted by the sense faculty, does not cause the recollection.

original: sems can re re zhing yul ma yin pa la de ltar grogs ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can re re zhing yul ma yin pa la de ltar grogs ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because for each sentient being, it does not assist in that way with regard to what is not an object.

original: dbang po las skyes pa nyid med na bdag las skyes pa nyid med pa yin na /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa nyid med na bdag las skyes pa nyid med pa yin na /
translated: If there is no arising from the sense faculty, there is no arising from the self.

original: bdag las skyes pa nyid ni yin gyi mthu'i shes pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag las skyes pa nyid ni yin gyi mthu'i shes pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin te /
translated: It is born from itself, not from the power of consciousness.

original: skyon med pa'i dbang po las skyes pa nyid ni de las gzhan pa las khyad par du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skyon med pa'i dbang po las skyes pa nyid ni de las gzhan pa las khyad par du byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is distinguished from the other by being born from a faultless sense faculty.

original: sngar nyid 'dzin pa kho na dran pa yin par bstan pa ni dran pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sngar nyid 'dzin pa kho na dran pa yin par bstan pa ni dran pa med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is taught that memory is just the apprehension of what was previously seen.

original: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba ni shi ba nyid lang ba'i ched du dran bzhin pa la dbang po'i byed pa ltos na'o //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba ni shi ba nyid lang ba'i ched du dran bzhin pa la dbang po'i byed pa ltos na'o //
translated: If it were so, if the functioning of the sense faculty depended on the memory of the one who died,

original: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni dran bzhin pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: de nyid du zhes bya ba ni dran bzhin pa'i dngos po'i ngo bor ro //
translated: in that very place, in the state of being remembered,

original: yul der song bas ni dngos po yod pa'i yul du song bas so //
analyzed: yul der song bas ni dngos po yod pa'i yul du song bas so //
translated: it would go to the place where the thing exists.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni yul 'dir song bas rung ba'i yul nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni yul 'dir song bas rung ba'i yul nyid ma yin te /
translated: If it were so, it would not be suitable to go to that place,

original: yul gzhan zhes bya bas rung ba ma yin pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan zhes bya bas rung ba ma yin pa'i yul nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be an unsuitable place, as it is said to be another place.

original: yul dang dus de la bkag pa yul dang dus 'di la yin par bstan pa ni da lta ba kho na'i zhes bya ba ste sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul dang dus de la bkag pa yul dang dus 'di la yin par bstan pa ni da lta ba kho na'i zhes bya ba ste sngar mthong ba ngo shes pa 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúonly in the present‚Äù indicates that the negation of the object and time is in regard to this object and time, and the meaning is that the recognition of what was seen previously is mistaken.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rtogs pa ste gang gis zhes bya ba ni rim pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rtogs pa ste gang gis zhes bya ba ni rim pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That very‚Äù refers to the cognition, and ‚Äúby which‚Äù refers to the sequence.

original: ma rtogs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa la yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyis so //
translated: ‚Äú Even in the nonapprehension‚Äù refers to direct perception.

original: de zhes bya ba ni skad cig de la 'byung ba'i'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni skad cig de la 'byung ba'i'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the arising in that moment.

original: khyad par 'di zhes bya ba rgol ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par 'di zhes bya ba rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú This difference‚Äù is the objection.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni rgol ba rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni rgol ba rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Would arise‚Äù is the restatement of the objection.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba nas yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar ni lan no //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba nas yod pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äú Here also‚Äù up to ‚Äúwould exist‚Äù is the response.

original: thug pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid du phyis rtogs la sngar yang yin te de nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir de'i tshe med na tha dad par 'gyur la de nyid na phyis yod pa snga na yang yin no //
analyzed: thug pa med pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid du phyis rtogs la sngar yang yin te de nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir de'i tshe med na tha dad par 'gyur la de nyid na phyis yod pa snga na yang yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúInfinite regress‚Äù means that it is realized later, but it was also earlier, because there is no difference in that regard. If it did not exist at that time, it would be different. It exists later in that very thing, but it was also earlier.

original: de bstan pa ni de las yang zhes bya ba ste snga na yang ngo //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni de las yang zhes bya ba ste snga na yang ngo //
translated: The demonstration of that is ‚Äúfrom that, again,‚Äù that is, earlier.

original: phyis yod par bstan pa ni de la yang gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyis yod par bstan pa ni de la yang gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The demonstration of its existence later is ‚Äúin that, again,‚Äù that is, later.

original: shes pa dang de'i shes pa dag cig car ba nyid la yang de'i shes pa la sogs par yang thal bar 'gyur bas thug pa med pa'i phyir snga ma rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni don dang shes pa @215b zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang de'i shes pa dag cig car ba nyid la yang de'i shes pa la sogs par yang thal bar 'gyur bas thug pa med pa'i phyir snga ma rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni don dang shes pa @215b zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Also, with regard to the simultaneity of consciousness and the consciousness of that, the error of an infinite regress would ensue, because the consciousness of that and so on would also ensue. Therefore, the demonstration that the earlier is not realized is ‚Äúthe object and consciousness.‚Äù

original: shes pa dang de'i shes pa yang skyes pa yang yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te gzung bar mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: shes pa dang de'i shes pa yang skyes pa yang yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te gzung bar mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa la /
translated: One might think that consciousness and the consciousness of that are also produced, but not others, because they are not asserted to be apprehended.

original: shes pa gsum pa med na gnyis po de nyid rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa na don dang shes pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa gsum pa med na gnyis po de nyid rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa na don dang shes pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is no third cognition, it is shown that those two themselves are not cognized, and so it says ‚Äúof the object and cognition.‚Äù

original: skyes pa mi shes pa ni 'dzin byed ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes pa mi shes pa ni 'dzin byed ma yin no //
translated: The arising of a cognition that does not know itself is not apprehended.

original: don zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba yin la /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba yin la /
translated: ‚Äú Object‚Äù is the thesis.

original: rtogs pa zhes sgrub byed yin zhes bya ba ni 'brel par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes sgrub byed yin zhes bya ba ni 'brel par dka' ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Is cognized‚Äù is the proof. This is difficult to connect.

original: shes pa cig car zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam 'grel ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: shes pa cig car zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam 'grel ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: The commentary on ‚Äúsimultaneous cognition‚Äù and so on is clear.

original: don gyi shes pa 'dzin par byed pa ni don gsal bar byed pa ni rang gi chos su sgro 'dogs par byed pa ma yin nam ral gri la gdong lta bu'o zhes zer ba la don du snang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi shes pa 'dzin par byed pa ni don gsal bar byed pa ni rang gi chos su sgro 'dogs par byed pa ma yin nam ral gri la gdong lta bu'o zhes zer ba la don du snang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú The cognition of the object is the apprehender‚Äù means that the object is the appearance of the object, and the cognition is the appearance of the object. Is it not the case that the cognition is the superimposition of its own aspect, like a face in a sword? ‚Äú The appearance of the object‚Äù is said in response to that.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni shes pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni shes pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Alone‚Äù means without cognition.

original: rnam pa gcig nyid kyi shes pa dag gzung ba yin zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig nyid kyi shes pa dag gzung ba yin zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
translated: ‚Äú The single aspect of cognition is apprehended‚Äù is not tenable.

original: gzung zhes bya ba ni ma ning gi rtags yin te /
analyzed: gzung zhes bya ba ni ma ning gi rtags yin te /
translated: ‚Äú Apprehended‚Äù is a neuter affix.

original: ma ning gi rtags ma yin pa dang gcig nyid bzhin du gzhan gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ma ning gi rtags su byas pa yin la ma ning gi rtags ma yin pa dang lhan cig sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ma ning gi rtags ma yin pa dang gcig nyid bzhin du gzhan gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ma ning gi rtags su byas pa yin la ma ning gi rtags ma yin pa dang lhan cig sbyor ba'o //
translated: Just as a neuter is not a male, and one is not the other, so too, the neuter is made into a male sign, and one is joined with what is not a neuter sign.

original: ral gri dang gdong bzhin du so sor snang ba ma yin te tha mi dad pa la gnod pa med pa'i phyir dang snang ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni tha dad med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ral gri dang gdong bzhin du so sor snang ba ma yin te tha mi dad pa la gnod pa med pa'i phyir dang snang ba'i phyir zhes bstan pa ni tha dad med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not like a sword and a face, which appear separately, because there is no contradiction in their being not different, and because they are seen. The phrase ‚Äúwithout difference‚Äù teaches this.

original: gal te bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang de lta bu'i don can yin no //
analyzed: gal te bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang de lta bu'i don can yin no //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of the words ‚Äòpleasure,‚Äô etc.?‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba'i dbye ba yang rnam pa 'ga' tha dad par snang ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa tha dad pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la legs par rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i dbye ba yang rnam pa 'ga' tha dad par snang ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa tha dad pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la legs par rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is also said that the difference of the unseen is not the difference of the cognition of blue, etc., which appear in some way as different. The phrase ‚Äúwell understood‚Äù refers to this.

original: sngon po dang ser po bzhin du lcags gong dang me dang dngul cung zad kyi cha yod pa'i gser ni sngar dang phyis kyang dbye ba gsal ba yin gyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang rung ba de bzhin du sngon po dang de rigs pa
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po bzhin du lcags gong dang me dang dngul cung zad kyi cha yod pa'i gser ni sngar dang phyis kyang dbye ba gsal ba yin gyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa yang rung ba de bzhin du sngon po dang de rigs pa
translated: Just as blue and yellow are different, so gold and the iron and fire that are its causes are different, because they are clearly distinguished from each other before and after.

original: dag tha dad par mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dag tha dad par mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: But blue and its cause are not seen to be different.

original: de'i phyir der zhen pa ni dmag gi glang po che bzhin du de ma yin pa las ldog pa'i yul kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir der zhen pa ni dmag gi glang po che bzhin du de ma yin pa las ldog pa'i yul kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the attachment to them is like the attachment to an elephant in a dream, and the object is only the exclusion of what is not that.

original: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni so so ba nyid dgag pa'o //üîΩdon dang shes pa dag so sor 'dzin pa nyid yin na chos bzhin du tha dad pa myong ba yin par bstan pa ni don dang don gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci ltar zhes bya ba ni so so ba nyid dgag pa'o // don dang shes pa dag so sor 'dzin pa nyid yin na chos bzhin du tha dad pa myong ba yin par bstan pa ni don dang don gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How? This negates their difference.üîΩIf the object and consciousness were to apprehend each separately, they would be experienced as different, like two things.

original: don dang don gyi yid dag gi yang so so ba nyid du mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: don dang don gyi yid dag gi yang so so ba nyid du mtshon pa ste /
translated: The meaning of the verse is that the object and the consciousness of the object are also shown to be separate.

original: don dang don gyi shes par snang ba bzhin du thal bar 'gyur bar bltar bar @216a * //
analyzed: don dang don gyi shes par snang ba bzhin du thal bar 'gyur bar bltar bar @216a * //
translated: It should be seen that the consequence is that the object and the appearance of the cognition of the object are the same.

original: bya'o ; snang ba ni shes pa po don gyi shes pa dang de'i shes pa dag rnam pa med pa yin na de rig pa'am tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bya'o ; snang ba ni shes pa po don gyi shes pa dang de'i shes pa dag rnam pa med pa yin na de rig pa'am tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If the appearance and the cognition of the object and the cognition of that are without aspects, then it is not known whether they are different or not.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba tha dad par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni don rig pa ni zhes bya bas snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba tha dad par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni don rig pa ni zhes bya bas snang ba sna tshogs pa nyid kyi zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the differentiation of the various appearances is given by ‚Äúthe cognition of the object‚Äù and so on.

original: tha dad pas sam gcig gis gnyi ga rig pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na gcig nyid yin par bstan pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pas sam gcig gis gnyi ga rig pa ma yin gyi 'o na ci zhe na gcig nyid yin par bstan pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not known by a difference or by a single thing. But rather what? It is taught that it is by a single thing. ‚Äú In this way‚Äù is that.

original: gcig ces bya ba ni myong ba dang ngo //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni myong ba dang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Single‚Äù is the experience.

original: gcig nyid dam zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid dam zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú The same‚Äù is the aspect.

original: so so ba ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so so ba ma yin par bstan pa ni gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of nondifference is ‚Äúnot different.‚Äù

original: de bstan pa ni myong ba dang gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ni myong ba dang gcig pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of that is ‚Äúthe same as the experience.‚Äù

original: yang na rnam pa med pa las log pa gcig yin la mi rig pa las ldog pas rig pa yin pa'i phyir ngo bo gnyis khas blangs pa las kyang de gnyis su 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba la ni rgyal ba can
analyzed: yang na rnam pa med pa las log pa gcig yin la mi rig pa las ldog pas rig pa yin pa'i phyir ngo bo gnyis khas blangs pa las kyang de gnyis su 'gyur ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba la ni rgyal ba can
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the two natures are not accepted because of those two‚Äù is as follows:

original: gyi'o // nges pa med pa la 'di med min zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gyi'o // nges pa med pa la 'di med min zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Jaina says that it is not the case that there is no self-awareness,

original: rang rig pas so zhes bya ba'i don du bshad nas /
analyzed: rang rig pas so zhes bya ba'i don du bshad nas /
translated: and he explains the meaning of ‚Äúself-awareness‚Äù as follows.üîΩIf it is experienced by another cognition, there is an infinite regress,

original: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin na mthar thug pa med pa dang / de la'ang dran pa zhes bya ba bshad pa ni shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba yin na mthar thug pa med pa dang / de la'ang dran pa zhes bya ba bshad pa ni shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and he explains that memory is also like that.

original: yul gyi shes pa dang shes pa'i shes pa zhes bya bar ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: yul gyi shes pa dang shes pa'i shes pa zhes bya bar ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable to say that there is a cognition of the object and a cognition of the cognition.üîΩIf the object is not known, the object is not known, and therefore the cognition of the cognition is not understood by implication.

original: de ma shes na yul mi shes pa'i phyir don gyis go ba las shes pa'i shes pa ma yin te de la yang dran pa ni 'dod pa las mthong ngo //
analyzed: de ma shes na yul mi shes pa'i phyir don gyis go ba las shes pa'i shes pa ma yin te de la yang dran pa ni 'dod pa las mthong ngo //
translated: The Jaina says that memory is seen in that.

original: de'i phyir / bum pa la sogs don 'dzin na //üîΩgal te re zhig de ma thag //
analyzed: de'i phyir / bum pa la sogs don 'dzin na // gal te re zhig de ma thag //
translated: If it apprehends objects such as a pot,

original: don gyis go bas ma rtogs pa //
analyzed: don gyis go bas ma rtogs pa //
translated: If it does not understand them by the power of the object,

original: yang dang yang du shes pa dag / ji srid dub pa de las phyis //
analyzed: yang dang yang du shes pa dag / ji srid dub pa de las phyis //
translated: Then it would understand them again and again,üîΩUntil it became exhausted.

original: de srid nyid du dran par 'gyur //
analyzed: de srid nyid du dran par 'gyur //
translated: It would remember them for just that long.

original: zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni legs par smras pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not a good explanation.

original: rjes 'brel can zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe kho na skyed par byed pa de nyid kyi tshe 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes 'brel can zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe kho na skyed par byed pa de nyid kyi tshe 'dzin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúConjoined‚Äù means that when it produces, at that time it apprehends.

original: bdag dang yid phrad pa tsam yin pa'i phyir dang po bzhin du gzhan gyi tshe yang yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa med par bstan pa ni gal te sngar blo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang yid phrad pa tsam yin pa'i phyir dang po bzhin du gzhan gyi tshe yang yin pa'i phyir mthar thug pa med par bstan pa ni gal te sngar blo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is merely conjoined with the self and mind, it would be like the first moment, and it would also be like the other moments. To show that there is no final end, it says, ‚ÄúIf it does not understand them by the power of the object, then it would understand them again and again, until it became exhausted. It would remember them for just that long.‚Äù

original: gzung ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it produces the object to be apprehended,

original: yul shes pa'i ched du dang po rang gi shes pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yul shes pa'i ched du dang po rang gi shes pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: it produces its own cognition first in order to cognize the object.

original: ma shes pa ni de'i shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma shes pa ni de'i shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is not cognized is not its cognition.

original: de yang de bzhin no zhes bya bas mthar @216b thug pa med pa yin la yul gzhan skyed par byed pa nyid srid pa yin par bstan pa ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin no zhes bya bas mthar @216b thug pa med pa yin la yul gzhan skyed par byed pa nyid srid pa yin par bstan pa ni gzung ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúit is just so‚Äù indicates that there is no final end. The statement that it is possible to generate another object is ‚Äúthe characteristic of the apprehended.‚Äù

original: dang po'i shes pa rang nyid kyi shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dang po'i shes pa rang nyid kyi shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the first cognition itself the generator of cognition?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: gsal ba'i yul gyi rang la nges par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni phyi rol don ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i yul gyi rang la nges par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni phyi rol don ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that it is because the object of the clear is ascertained by itself is ‚Äúthe external object.‚Äù

original: dang po yang rang nyid skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po yang rang nyid skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The first is not itself the generator,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference.

original: des na ma lus pa mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na ma lus pa mi dmigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that there is no apprehension of anything at all.

original: mi gsal ba yang shes pa skyed par byed na rang la nges par byed pa nyid du snang ba nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni don de min pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba yang shes pa skyed par byed na rang la nges par byed pa nyid du snang ba nyid kho na yin par bstan pa ni don de min pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that if the unclear also generates cognition, it is only the appearance that is ascertained by itself is ‚Äúthat object is not.‚Äù

original: nye ba ma yin pa'i don ni gsal ba 'am cig shos blo gang gi yin pa de nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur bar mi 'gyur na blo'i rtsa ba med de snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba ma yin pa'i don ni gsal ba 'am cig shos blo gang gi yin pa de nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur bar mi 'gyur na blo'i rtsa ba med de snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot proximate‚Äù is that if the object of any cognition, whether manifest or not, were not to be experienced, then cognition would be without a root, because there would be no appearance.

original: dran pa yang med phyir zhes bya ba ni don la yang ngo //
analyzed: dran pa yang med phyir zhes bya ba ni don la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there would be no memory‚Äù means that there would be no memory of the object.

original: de'i phyir aa re mdzes zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir aa re mdzes zhes bya ba ni bzhad gad do //
translated: ‚ÄúHow beautiful!‚Äù means ‚ÄúHa! Ha!‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba dang dran pa dag med na 'gro ba ma lus pa sems pa can ma yin pa thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩnyams su myong ba la nyams su myong ba bkag pas don nyams su myong ba khas blangs pa yin no snyam du sems pa la don zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dang dran pa dag med na 'gro ba ma lus pa sems pa can ma yin pa thob par 'gyur ro // nyams su myong ba la nyams su myong ba bkag pas don nyams su myong ba khas blangs pa yin no snyam du sems pa la don zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If there were no experience and no memory, then all beings would be without minds.üîΩThinking that the refutation of experience implies the admission of the experience of the object, he says, ‚ÄúThe object . . . is always . . . experienced.‚Äù

original: rtag tu bar zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba skyed par byed pas don gyis go ba skyed par byed pa bkag pa'i phyir de'i skyed byed kyis nyams su myong ba bkag pa na de grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag tu bar zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba skyed par byed pas don gyis go ba skyed par byed pa bkag pa'i phyir de'i skyed byed kyis nyams su myong ba bkag pa na de grub pa yin no //
translated: Since the production of experience is thereby refuted, the production of understanding through the object is refuted. Therefore, when the production of experience is refuted by the production of the object, the latter is established.

original: nyams su myong ba nyams su mi myong na don nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyams su mi myong na don nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
translated: If experience does not experience itself, then the object is not experienced, as was explained earlier.

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bstan pa ni yod pa tsam las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bstan pa ni yod pa tsam las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúmere existence.‚ÄùüîΩFrom what does the existence of experience arise?

original: nyams su myong ba yod pa gang las zhes bstan pa la dbang po dang zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yod pa gang las zhes bstan pa la dbang po dang zhes zer ba'o //
translated: It is taught that it arises from the sense faculties.

original: 'dod pas bzlog par bya ba nyid ni de las byung ba don nye ba las mi ltos pa'i rtog pa rnams la dang / 'bad pa skyed pa'i dbang po las shes pa gzhan du nyams su myong ba'i phyir bdag nyid du shes par nus pa de la 'bad pa gzhan gegs byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pas bzlog par bya ba nyid ni de las byung ba don nye ba las mi ltos pa'i rtog pa rnams la dang / 'bad pa skyed pa'i dbang po las shes pa gzhan du nyams su myong ba'i phyir bdag nyid du shes par nus pa de la 'bad pa gzhan gegs byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The fact that it is to be stopped by desire is that, since the conceptual consciousnesses that do not depend on the object that arises from it and the sense faculty that generates effort are experienced in other consciousnesses, it is possible to know them as the self. Effort is not an obstruction to them.

original: rgyu med pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir dang rgyu gnyis ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'das sogs rnam rtog ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu med pas rang nyid med pa'i phyir dang rgyu gnyis ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni 'das sogs rnam rtog ces bya ba ste /
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúpast, etc., conceptualization,‚Äù since they do not exist by themselves because they have no cause, since they are not two causes, and since they are contradictory.

original: 'dod pas dbang po ldog pas de'i bskyed bya ldog pa ni rgyu med pas yin gyi 'dod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: 'dod pas dbang po ldog pas de'i bskyed bya ldog pa ni rgyu med pas yin gyi 'dod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The cessation of its effect is due to the absence of a cause, not due to desire.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i rnam rtog yin la /
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i rnam rtog yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refers to present conceptualization.

original: @217a * // de yang don nye ba yang yod pa'i phyir khyad par du byed pa ni gang dag la zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @217a * // de yang don nye ba yang yod pa'i phyir khyad par du byed pa ni gang dag la zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, since the object is present, the phrase ‚Äúthose who‚Äù is used to specify it.

original: 'pho ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba ni rigs mi mthun pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Transition is conceptualization of a different type.

original: rgyu ste 'dzin par 'dod pa'i gzhan med pa'i phyir ni rgyud med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ste 'dzin par 'dod pa'i gzhan med pa'i phyir ni rgyud med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no other cause, that is, no other continuum,

original: dang po bzhin du rang nyid kyi shes pa skyed pa nyid du nus pa'i phyir don la dpyod pa ste legs par nyan 'dod pa dang nyan pa dang 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i shes pas spong len gyi de kho na bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo'o
analyzed: dang po bzhin du rang nyid kyi shes pa skyed pa nyid du nus pa'i phyir don la dpyod pa ste legs par nyan 'dod pa dang nyan pa dang 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i shes pas spong len gyi de kho na bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i ngo bo'o
translated: it is like the first one. It is capable of producing its own cognition. Therefore, it is analyzed in terms of its object. It is the nature of manifest clinging to thatness, that is, to what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, by the cognition of one who desires to listen well, who listens, who holds, and who grasps.

original: // de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rtogs pa la yang shes pa 'pho bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: // de lta yin dang zhes bya ba ni dang po'i rtogs pa la yang shes pa 'pho bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that were so‚Äù means that even in the first cognition, the consciousness would not transfer.

original: 'dod pa dang gzhan dang 'dres bas 'pho ba bsal nas dub pa las sel bar byed pa ni gal te bdag la zhes bya ba ste rgol ba rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzhan dang 'dres bas 'pho ba bsal nas dub pa las sel bar byed pa ni gal te bdag la zhes bya ba ste rgol ba rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: Having refuted the transfer of consciousness due to mixing with other desires, he says, ‚ÄúIf I were to become tired,‚Äù which is a response to the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni yul gzhan la 'pho ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni yul gzhan la 'pho ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat very‚Äù refers to the nature of the transfer to another object.

original: dub pa ni nus pa zad pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dub pa ni nus pa zad pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTired‚Äù refers to the nature of the exhaustion of the capacity.

original: ga las yin zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa las mi skye ba ni skye ba'i phyir rang la mi nus na gzhan la nus pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: ga las yin zhes bya ba ni mi nus pa las mi skye ba ni skye ba'i phyir rang la mi nus na gzhan la nus pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù means that if something does not arise from incapacity, it does not arise from incapacity in itself, nor from incapacity in another.

original: blo snga ma snga ma'i mthong ba las de nyams na nus pa med pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni /üîΩsngar gyi blo ni nus zad na //
analyzed: blo snga ma snga ma'i mthong ba las de nyams na nus pa med pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni / sngar gyi blo ni nus zad na //
translated: The following demonstrates that if the capacity of the previous cognition is impaired due to seeing something else, it is devoid of capacity.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe previous cognition is exhausted of capacity‚Äù

original: snga ma'i shes pa ni rang nyid kyi shes pa skyes nas 'jig pa yin la /
analyzed: snga ma'i shes pa ni rang nyid kyi shes pa skyes nas 'jig pa yin la /
translated: means that the previous cognition is destroyed by the arising of its own subsequent cognition.

original: dbang po dang don nye ba tsam las don shes pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: dbang po dang don nye ba tsam las don shes pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: But is not the cognition of the object merely the proximity of the sense faculty and the object?

original: blo sngon med par zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: blo sngon med par zhes bya ba ste /
translated: [The author replies:] ‚ÄúWithout a prior cognition‚Äù [means]

original: khyad par gyi blo las khyad par du bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyad par gyi blo las khyad par du bya ba'i don to //
translated: the object is distinguished from a cognition that is not prior.

original: de lta bu nyid de bzhin gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i blo las ser po la sogs pa'i blo ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid de bzhin gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i blo las ser po la sogs pa'i blo ma yin pa ma yin nam zhes zer ba la /
translated: But is not the cognition of blue, etc. just that, and not the cognition of yellow, etc.?

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: [The author replies:] ‚ÄúA different object‚Äù [means]

original: sngon po la chags pa na dbang po la sogs pa tsam las byung ba'i ser po'i blo cis mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngon po la chags pa na dbang po la sogs pa tsam las byung ba'i ser po'i blo cis mi skye zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: why does a cognition of yellow not arise from the mere arising of the sense faculty, etc. when attached to blue?

original: ma rtogs phyir ni ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rtogs phyir ni ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not understood‚Äù [means] because it is uncertain.

original: mi mthun pa 'am zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa 'am zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe incompatible‚Äù [means] the agent.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù [means] the opponent‚Äôs.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma zhes bya ba kun gzhi las gzhan yin gyi de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma zhes bya ba kun gzhi las gzhan yin gyi de ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúA prior cognition‚Äù is different from the foundation consciousness, but not that [foundation consciousness].

original: snga ma la ltos pa yin na de nyid rgyu yin par zad kyi /
analyzed: snga ma la ltos pa yin na de nyid rgyu yin par zad kyi /
translated: If it depends on the prior [cognition], that alone is the cause.

original: kun gzhi ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The consciousness that is the basis of all experience is not.

original: gzhan la chags pa yin yang shes pa gzhan skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan la chags pa yin yang shes pa gzhan skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that other consciousnesses arise even though they are attached to other objects?

original: rtar rtog pa na yang ba lang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa na cig car zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtar rtog pa na yang ba lang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa na cig car zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When one conceives of a horse, one sees a cow.

original: cig car du ma la chags pa ni mi mthun pa @217b nyid ma yin te mi mthun pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi chags pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan la yang rigs mthun pa la ni cig car rigs mi mthun pa la ni rim gyis par 'gyur ro
analyzed: cig car du ma la chags pa ni mi mthun pa @217b nyid ma yin te mi mthun pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyi chags pa yin pa'i phyir gzhan la yang rigs mthun pa la ni cig car rigs mi mthun pa la ni rim gyis par 'gyur ro
translated: It is not contradictory for a consciousness to be attached to many objects simultaneously, because attachment is not contradictory by nature. It is reasonable that a consciousness of the same type is attached to objects of the same type simultaneously, and that a consciousness of a different type is attached to objects of a different type sequentially.

original: // yul la 'jug pa'i shes pa chags pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: // yul la 'jug pa'i shes pa chags pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that a consciousness that engages an object is attached to that object?

original: de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not the case, because it is not the cause of the object.

original: kun gzhi skyed bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ba la shin tu gsal ba'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi skyed bar byed pa yin no zhes zer ba la shin tu gsal ba'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The consciousness that is the basis of all experience is the cause of the object.

original: de la chags pa'i mi mthun pa nyid kyi kun gzhi nyid mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam shes rnams kyi bag chags kyi gzhi ste /
analyzed: de la chags pa'i mi mthun pa nyid kyi kun gzhi nyid mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i rnam shes rnams kyi bag chags kyi gzhi ste /
translated: The alaya is the basis of the habitual tendencies of the active consciousnesses because it is the alaya that is the counteragent to attachment to those.

original: der sgro gdags par bya ba'i khyad par can ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der sgro gdags par bya ba'i khyad par can ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The special object of imputation as the alaya is the alaya consciousness.

original: 'grel ba ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel ba ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: The commentary is clear on this.üîΩOtherwise, it would not depend on being similar to that.

original: gzhan du na de dang mtshungs pa nyid la ltos par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de lta min na zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi 'jug pa'i rnam shes kyi sgro gdags par bya ba'i khyad par can nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na de dang mtshungs pa nyid la ltos par mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de lta min na zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi 'jug pa'i rnam shes kyi sgro gdags par bya ba'i khyad par can nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: If the alaya were not the special object of imputation as the active consciousnesses,

original: dbang po dang don nye ba tsam rgyu yin na de med pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam shes 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dbang po dang don nye ba tsam rgyu yin na de med pa'i phyir yid kyi rnam shes 'byung bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: then mental consciousness would not arise because the mere proximity of sense faculty and object would not be a cause.

original: kun gzhi tsam la rim pa yin par bstan pa ni yid shes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi tsam la rim pa yin par bstan pa ni yid shes zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that the alaya is the basis of the order of arising is mental consciousness.

original: yid ni phra ba ma yin nam gcig la song ba na gzhan la ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa rnams kyi rim pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yid ni phra ba ma yin nam gcig la song ba na gzhan la ma yin pa'i phyir shes pa rnams kyi rim pa yin gyi /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the mental faculty subtle? It is not in one place, but in another. Therefore, the order of the consciousnesses is not due to the coarseness of their objects,üîΩbut rather to the coarseness of the consciousnesses themselves.

original: shes pa'i mi mthun pa nyid las ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni yid gcig yin phyir zhes bya ba ste rgol ba rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i mi mthun pa nyid las ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni yid gcig yin phyir zhes bya ba ste rgol ba rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: The response to this objection is that the mental faculty is one, because it is said that the mental faculty is one.

original: phra mo nyid ni rigs mthun pa la bzhin du rigs mi mthun pa la yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni res 'ga' lhan cig 'byung phyir te /
analyzed: phra mo nyid ni rigs mthun pa la bzhin du rigs mi mthun pa la yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni res 'ga' lhan cig 'byung phyir te /
translated: The response to the objection that the mental faculty is not coarse is that it is coarse, because it is sometimes simultaneous with the other faculties.

original: res 'ga' ni rigs mi mthun pa la'o //üîΩyul kha cig la chags pa'i shes pa dmigs pa yin gyi de ma rtogs par ma yin par bstan pa ni yid de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni rigs mi mthun pa la'o // yul kha cig la chags pa'i shes pa dmigs pa yin gyi de ma rtogs par ma yin par bstan pa ni yid de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Sometimes it is simultaneous with the other faculties, which are not of the same type.üîΩThe response to the objection that the mental faculty is not the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties is that the mental faculty is the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties, because it is sometimes the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties.üîΩThe response to the objection that the mental faculty is not the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties is that the mental faculty is the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties, because it is sometimes the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties.üîΩThe response to the objection that the mental faculty is not the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties is that the mental faculty is the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties, because it is sometimes the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties.üîΩThe response to the objection that the mental faculty is not the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties is that the mental faculty is the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties, because it is sometimes the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties.üîΩThe response to the objection that the mental faculty is not the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties is that the mental faculty is the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties, because it is sometimes the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties.üîΩThe response to the objection that the mental faculty is not the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties is that the mental faculty is the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties, because it is sometimes the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties.

original: yid 'jug pa mtshungs pa yin na cig car zhes bya ba mi dmigs te phra ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yid 'jug pa mtshungs pa yin na cig car zhes bya ba mi dmigs te phra ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The response to the objection that the mental faculty is not the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties is that the mental faculty is the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties, because it is sometimes the object of the consciousness of the five sense faculties.

original: 'jug pa mtshungs pa la'ang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa mtshungs pa la'ang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to the objection that the

original: gcig la nus pa med pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gcig la nus pa med pa la yang ngo //
translated: And even if one is not capable, all are.

original: thams cad tshe zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad tshe zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa dang gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: All means all the incompatible and other things.

original: gzhan ni yul gzhan la'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni yul gzhan la'o //
translated: Other means other objects.

original: rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ni nye bar 'gro ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs par mi 'gyur ba ni nye bar 'gro ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Not cognized means not approaching.

original: gzugs kyi rdzas nyid dang / yod pa la sogs pa mig dang phrad pa'i 'du bas cig car 'dzin pa yin yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni bdag nyid ldan pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrtogs pa ni nye bar @218a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdzas nyid dang / yod pa la sogs pa mig dang phrad pa'i 'du bas cig car 'dzin pa yin yang ngo zhes bstan pa ni bdag nyid ldan pa zhes bya ba'o // rtogs pa ni nye bar @218a * //
translated: Even though the substance of form and existence, etc. are grasped simultaneously by the conjunction of contact with the eye, it is taught that one's own possession is not grasped.

original: 'gro ba ste phrad pa'i khyad par ro //üîΩbyed pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa gcig las bya ba gcig ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni gcig las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ste phrad pa'i khyad par ro // byed pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir byed pa gcig las bya ba gcig ma yin nam zhes zer ba ni gcig las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Cognition is approaching, a special contact.üîΩIsn't it that from one action there is only one effect, because it is the nature of action? This is said in from one.

original: byed pa'i mar me yang bya ba du ma byed pa gcig gi tshe gcig ma yin nam zhes bstan pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i mar me yang bya ba du ma byed pa gcig gi tshe gcig ma yin nam zhes bstan pa ni ji ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Isn't it that even one action, such as a lamp, performs many actions at the time of one action? This is taught in just as....

original: du ma mthong bar byed pa'i de bzhin du yin kyang du mar mthong ba'i bya ba gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ma mthong bar byed pa'i de bzhin du yin kyang du mar mthong ba'i bya ba gcig yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as many people see it, in the same way, it is the meaning that there is a single action of seeing it as many.

original: skyes bu du mas mthong bar byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don ni 'grel pa'i'o //
analyzed: skyes bu du mas mthong bar byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i don ni 'grel pa'i'o //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is seen by many people‚Äù is the commentary‚Äôs.

original: yul dang 'brel pa can gyi yid kyang dang po gsal bar byed pa ma yin na phyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: yul dang 'brel pa can gyi yid kyang dang po gsal bar byed pa ma yin na phyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: The mind that is related to the object is not the first illuminator, nor is it the later one,

original: de khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rim gyis kyang zhes bya ba ste 'grel par ni khyad par te snga na yang yin gyi skye bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩsgro 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i yul du byung ba nyid kyi khyad par med par 'grel pas bstan pa ni rtag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni rim gyis kyang zhes bya ba ste 'grel par ni khyad par te snga na yang yin gyi skye bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // sgro 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i yul du byung ba nyid kyi khyad par med par 'grel pas bstan pa ni rtag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it is not different. This is taught by ‚Äúeven gradually.‚Äù In the commentary, ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù means that it is not the illuminator.üîΩThe commentary teaches that the object that is not the superimposer is not different.

original: de bdag khyad par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: de bdag khyad par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: The permanent one is not the illuminator.

original: zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is impermanent.

original: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa can dang 'brel par khyad par med par sgro gdags par bya ba ma yin dang 'brel par khyad par med par sgro gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i khyad par nyid kyis so //
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa can dang 'brel par khyad par med par sgro gdags par bya ba ma yin dang 'brel par khyad par med par sgro gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i khyad par nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not change‚Äù means that it is not to be imagined as being different in relation to that which is related.

original: 'grel par ni rnam par shes pa ni mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i khyad par las rim gyis byed pa yin par bstan pa ni rnam par shes pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grel par ni rnam par shes pa ni mthong ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i khyad par las rim gyis byed pa yin par bstan pa ni rnam par shes pa de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: In the commentary, it is taught that consciousness is the cause of the arising of the visual consciousness, and that it is the cause in a gradual process, due to the maturation of the latent impressions that produce the visual consciousness. This is what is meant by ‚Äúthat very consciousness.‚Äù

original: bdag byin gyis brlabs pa'i dbang po'i yul dang 'brel par khyad par med kyang shes pa snga ma snga mas bskyed pa'i 'du byed pa'i khyad par las shes pa rim pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni gal te 'du byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag byin gyis brlabs pa'i dbang po'i yul dang 'brel par khyad par med kyang shes pa snga ma snga mas bskyed pa'i 'du byed pa'i khyad par las shes pa rim pa yin no snyam du sems pa ni gal te 'du byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: The idea is that although the self-empowerment is not different in relation to the object of the sense faculties, the consciousness is gradual due to the special formative forces produced by the previous consciousnesses. This is what is meant by ‚Äúif the formative forces.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni 'du byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the formative forces.

original: blo ni blo nyid las te blo dang 'brel ba can no //
analyzed: blo ni blo nyid las te blo dang 'brel ba can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind‚Äù is the mind itself, which is related to the mind.

original: de lam gtogs pa de'i rten mthong ba'i phyir bdag go zhes bya ba yang goms pa las byung ba yin gyi nges pa'i yul can ma yin no //
