original: gzugs la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu brjod pa gnyis po rim pa ma yin par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pas yi ge gnyis pa 'di la yang 'dod pa yin no ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i de ma thag tu brjod pa gnyis po rim pa ma yin par snang bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pas yi ge gnyis pa 'di la yang 'dod pa yin no ;
translated: The two letters that were mentioned immediately after form and so on would appear in a nonsequential order.

original: / rang gis zhes bya ba ni gzung bar 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kho nas so //
analyzed: / rang gis zhes bya ba ni gzung bar 'dod pa'i bdag nyid kho nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy itself‚Äù means by the self alone, which is the object of apprehension.

original: gzhan gyis ni bdag dang yid phrad pa las skyes pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni bdag dang yid phrad pa las skyes pa'i shes pa gzhan gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another‚Äù means by another cognition that arises from the contact of the self with the mind.

original: don gyis go bas kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: don gyis go bas kyang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy implication‚Äù is the reply.

original: 'brel pa nyams su myong ba la mi ltos pa don nyams su myong ba'i shugs las byung ba'i phyir rtag tu nyams su myong ba la yang 'gyur ro zhes zer pa la gal te don gyi shugs kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyams su myong ba la mi ltos pa don nyams su myong ba'i shugs las byung ba'i phyir rtag tu nyams su myong ba la yang 'gyur ro zhes zer pa la gal te don gyi shugs kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would always be experienced‚Äù means that it would not depend on the experience of the connection, because it would arise from the force of the experience of the object.

original: brgyar zhes bya bas ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: brgyar zhes bya bas ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA hundred times‚Äù is an illustration.

original: nyams su myong ba las mthong ba'am thos pa'i don gyis phyis gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir don gzhan du rtog pa'i don gyis go ba ni tshogs pa med pa'i phyir mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de tshe'ang zhes bya bas te nyams su myong ba'i phyis kyi'o
analyzed: nyams su myong ba las mthong ba'am thos pa'i don gyis phyis gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir don gzhan du rtog pa'i don gyis go ba ni tshogs pa med pa'i phyir mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni de tshe'ang zhes bya bas te nyams su myong ba'i phyis kyi'o
translated: Because it is not tenable that the meaning of what is seen or heard is different from the meaning of experience, the meaning of understanding by the meaning of a different object does not occur because of the absence of a collection. The teaching of immutability is by the phrase ‚Äúat that time,‚Äù that is, after experience.

original: // don gyis go bas byas pa'i byed pa po'i ste don gyi shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: // don gyis go bas byas pa'i byed pa po'i ste don gyi shes pa'i'o //
translated: The meaning of understanding by the meaning of a different object is the object of the cognition of the meaning of the agent that is produced by understanding by the meaning.

original: dran pa nyid ces bya ba ni dran bzhin pa'i dran pa med na dran pa las nyams su myong ba'i rtogs pa mi 'byung la de med na dran bzhin @221a * //
analyzed: dran pa nyid ces bya ba ni dran bzhin pa'i dran pa med na dran pa las nyams su myong ba'i rtogs pa mi 'byung la de med na dran bzhin @221a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby the nature of memory‚Äù means that if there were no memory of what is being remembered, the realization of experience would not occur from memory, and if that did not exist, there would be no memory of what is being remembered.

original: pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif it were‚Äù expresses that.

original: dran pa las nyams su myong bar gyur pa nyid skyed pa nyid kyis de yul yin pa nyid kyi phyir blo rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa las nyams su myong bar gyur pa nyid skyed pa nyid kyis de yul yin pa nyid kyi phyir blo rtogs pa ma yin par bstan pa ni bdag gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that the object of the cognition of the meaning is not a realization because it is the object of the production of the experience of memory itself is expressed by the phrase ‚Äúby me.‚Äù

original: myong ba'i ngo bo'i blo la dran pa 'khrul pa 'di la yang //
analyzed: myong ba'i ngo bo'i blo la dran pa 'khrul pa 'di la yang //
translated: This is also the case with the memory of experience.

original: phyis ni shes rnams la shes 'gyur //
analyzed: phyis ni shes rnams la shes 'gyur //
translated: Later, the cognition is known from the cognition.

original: 'di ni de tshe don dran las //
analyzed: 'di ni de tshe don dran las //
translated: This is the memory of the object at that time.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi rigs par bstan pa ni de'i tshe sngar zhes bya ba ste khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi rigs par bstan pa ni de'i tshe sngar zhes bya ba ste khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, it is shown that this is illogical. At that time, previously means that it is not accepted.

original: phyis kyang zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar gyur pa dran pas de'i rgyu mtshan dbang po la sogs pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis kyang zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar gyur pa dran pas de'i rgyu mtshan dbang po la sogs pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Later also means that the memory of what was experienced is the realization of the sense faculties and so on, which are the causes of that.

original: gang gang zhig ces bya ba ni don nam shes pa'i'o //
analyzed: gang gang zhig ces bya ba ni don nam shes pa'i'o //
translated: Whatever means either the object or the cognition.

original: gang gi phyir myong pa de'i phyir myong ba yin zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir myong pa de'i phyir myong ba yin zhes bya ba ni snga ma'i'o //
translated: Because of the experience, it is called the experience of the former.

original: gang gi phyir dran pa ni dran bzhin pa'i don gyi'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dran pa ni dran bzhin pa'i don gyi'o //
translated: Because of the memory, it is called the memory of the object being remembered.

original: de las dran pa ni dran bzhin pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: de las dran pa ni dran bzhin pa'i yul la'o //
translated: From that, memory is of the object being remembered.

original: cher zhes bya ba ni dang po la dbye ba med pa'i phyir dang gnyis pa la yang blo ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cher zhes bya ba ni dang po la dbye ba med pa'i phyir dang gnyis pa la yang blo ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Greatly means that in the first case, there is no division, and in the second case, the mind is not realized.

original: dran pa las kyang bdag rig 'grub //
analyzed: dran pa las kyang bdag rig 'grub //
translated: And from memory, the self is known.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis rig na ni //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis rig na ni //
translated: If it is known by another cognition,

original: zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas slob dpon nyid kyi lan yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas slob dpon nyid kyi lan yin no //
translated: This is the reply of the Acarya himself, beginning from here.

original: de'i phyir rang nyid kyis bstan nas slob dpon gyis yul gzhan du 'pho zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang nyid kyis bstan nas slob dpon gyis yul gzhan du 'pho zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to say that after teaching by himself, the Acarya teaches that it is a transference to another object.

original: don dang ni rnam shes snga ma zhes bya ba blo gcig gis gnyi ga 'dzin pa la skyon bstan nas /
analyzed: don dang ni rnam shes snga ma zhes bya ba blo gcig gis gnyi ga 'dzin pa la skyon bstan nas /
translated: The meaning of the first line is that after showing the fault of apprehending both by one cognition,

original: blo mi 'dzin pa'i skyon bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: blo mi 'dzin pa'i skyon bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: the fault of not apprehending the cognition is shown. This is the interpretation of Jinaputra.

original: tha ma'i ni shes pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: tha ma'i ni shes pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The last line is the cognition of cognition.

original: nyams su myong min na zhes bya ba ni rig pa ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong min na zhes bya ba ni rig pa ma yin par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not experienced, it is not known.

original: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba bzhin //
translated: Like the experience of another,

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gzhan gyi nyams su myong ba nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag nyid kyis nyams su myong bar gyur pa yang yin pa'i phyir thams cad de sngar nyams su myong ba ma yin
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gzhan gyi nyams su myong ba nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de bzhin du bdag nyid kyis nyams su myong bar gyur pa yang yin pa'i phyir thams cad de sngar nyams su myong ba ma yin
translated: Just as the experience of another is not experienced by another, so too, since it is not experienced by itself, all experience is not experienced previously.

original: pa'o // ji ltar zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ba ma yin na'o //
analyzed: pa'o // ji ltar zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba nyams su myong ba ma yin na'o //
translated: How? If experience is not experienced.

original: gzhan gyi nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba'i phyir ni ma yin na 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyams su myong ba gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba'i phyir ni ma yin na 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: If the experience of another is not experienced by another, then how is it not experienced?

original: rang nyid kyis nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de bzhin du rang gi nyams su myong ba rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir nyams su myong ba ma yin pa de bzhin du rang gi nyams su myong ba rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not experienced by itself, because it is not experienced by another.

original: gzhan gyis nyams @221b su ma myong ba'i phyir ro zer ba ni gal te gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams @221b su ma myong ba'i phyir ro zer ba ni gal te gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you say that, then if another is not experienced by another, how is it experienced?

original: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba myong ba med na nyams su myong bar 'gyur bzhin pa'i gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba myong ba med na nyams su myong bar 'gyur bzhin pa'i gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba med do //
translated: If there is no experience of another‚Äôs experience, then there is no experience of another‚Äôs experience in the process of occurring.

original: de bzhin du rang la yang brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni ji ltar gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang la yang brjod pa yin par bstan pa ni ji ltar gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The same is to be stated with respect to oneself.

original: myong bar byas pa ni phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: myong bar byas pa ni phyi rol gyi dngos po'o //
translated: The experience is an external thing.

original: nyams su myong ba gzhan yin na de yang bdag nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba gzhan yin na de yang bdag nyid kyis yin no //
translated: If the experience is different, then it is of oneself.

original: bdag dang cig shos kyi nyams su myong ba bdag gis mngon sum dang cig shos dag yin gyi nyams su myong ba dag cig shos te /
analyzed: bdag dang cig shos kyi nyams su myong ba bdag gis mngon sum dang cig shos dag yin gyi nyams su myong ba dag cig shos te /
translated: The experience of oneself and the other is the direct perception of oneself and the other, but not the other‚Äôs experience.

original: nyams su myong ba dag gis ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te bdag myong zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba dag gis ni ma yin no zhes zer ba ni gal te bdag myong zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that the experience of oneself and the other is the experience of oneself and the other, then it is said that ‚Äúif oneself experiences.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: From what? Not from reflexive awareness,

original: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba la yang skyon brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / shes pa gzhan gyis nyams su myong ba la yang skyon brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not accepted and because the error has been stated with respect to the experience of another consciousness.

original: gang gis te nyams su myong ba sgrub par byed pa bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis te nyams su myong ba sgrub par byed pa bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: By what? By the self that is the experiencer, the one who accomplishes the experience.

original: de skad ces bya ba ni rang nyid nyams su myong bar gyur gyi cig shos ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni rang nyid nyams su myong bar gyur gyi cig shos ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúby oneself.‚Äù

original: rang nyid nyams su myong bar gyur pa ni rang ngam gzhan gyis kyang mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rang nyid nyams su myong bar gyur pa ni rang ngam gzhan gyis kyang mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that what is experienced by oneself is not established by either oneself or another?

original: de lta na dngos po ma grub pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba rnams kyis gsal ba nyid de'i rgyu gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta na dngos po ma grub pa ma yin par bstan pa ni gsal ba rnams kyis gsal ba nyid de'i rgyu gsal ba yin la /
translated: In that case, the teaching that things are not established is clear. The clarity of clarity is the cause of clarity.

original: de ma grub pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ba gang gi zhe na gsal bar te gsal ba las gsal bar 'dod pa'i ni gsal bar khas len pa'i'o //
analyzed: de ma grub pa'i phyir mi 'gyur ba gang gi zhe na gsal bar te gsal ba las gsal bar 'dod pa'i ni gsal bar khas len pa'i'o //
translated: But if that is not established, what would be the point of saying that clarity is the cause of clarity?

original: gsal bar gyur pa'i ngo bo bzhin du gsal ba ma grub na gsal ba nyid kyis khyab par bya ba yang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gal te gsal ba ma grub kyang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa'i ngo bo bzhin du gsal ba ma grub na gsal ba nyid kyis khyab par bya ba yang mi 'gyur bar bstan pa ni gal te gsal ba ma grub kyang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If clarity is not established, then the object pervaded by clarity would not exist either. This is taught by ‚ÄúIf clarity is not established.‚Äù

original: gsal ba'i rgyu rnams mig la sogs pa ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i rgyu rnams mig la sogs pa ma grub pa'o //
translated: The causes of clarity, such as the eyes, are not established.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu ma 'brel pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu ma 'brel pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not very incoherent to say ‚Äúillumination‚Äù?

original: gsal bar gyur pa mi 'grub pa ma yin la gnas skabs de'i rgyu ma grub pa la khas blangs pa dgos pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa mi 'grub pa ma yin la gnas skabs de'i rgyu ma grub pa la khas blangs pa dgos pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: The one who is illuminated is not unestablished, and it is necessary to accept that the cause of that state is not unestablished. This is the position of the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdin.

original: rang rig pa ma yin na ni bdag dang 'brel ba can nyid du mi 'gyur ba ste yin na'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa ma yin na ni bdag dang 'brel ba can nyid du mi 'gyur ba ste yin na'o //
translated: If it is not self-awareness, it would not be related to the self.

original: nyon mongs bcas pa'i sems kyi dri ma spangs pas bya ba byas blor ldan gyur la //
analyzed: nyon mongs bcas pa'i sems kyi dri ma spangs pas bya ba byas blor ldan gyur la //
translated: The mind with afflictions is abandoned, and the wise one becomes one who has done his duty.

original: bzod pa rgya chen byed cing lhag pa'i byams pa dang ldan tshogs pa'i dam par bcas //
analyzed: bzod pa rgya chen byed cing lhag pa'i byams pa dang ldan tshogs pa'i dam par bcas //
translated: He practices great patience, and he is endowed with special love, and he is surrounded by the best of assemblies.

original: mnyam gzhag phul du byung bas ji bzhin don rtogs gyur pa'i rgyal ba can rnams kyi //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag phul du byung bas ji bzhin don rtogs gyur pa'i rgyal ba can rnams kyi //
translated: The Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins, who have realized the meaning as it is through the excellence of their meditative equipoise,

original: @222a * // mdzes pa'i tshig gi rgyun gyis mkhas pa rnams kyi blo yi dga' ba skyed par byed //
analyzed: @222a * // mdzes pa'i tshig gi rgyun gyis mkhas pa rnams kyi blo yi dga' ba skyed par byed //
translated: produce delight in the minds of the wise through the stream of their beautiful words.

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan gyi 'grel bshad mkhan po rgyal ba can gyis mdzad pa le'u gnyis pa'o /üîΩ// / mngon sum gyis de ma thag tu gzhan gyi don gyis khyad par du byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin gyi khyad par du ma byas pa'i tshig dang rjes su dpag pa yang gzhan don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi rgyan gyi 'grel bshad mkhan po rgyal ba can gyis mdzad pa le'u gnyis pa'o / // / mngon sum gyis de ma thag tu gzhan gyi don gyis khyad par du byas pa'i rjes su dpag pa ma yin gyi khyad par du ma byas pa'i tshig dang rjes su dpag pa yang gzhan don du 'gyur ro //
translated: The second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.

original: 'brel pa'i yul rtog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir mngon sum du yang 'gyur ro //üîΩmngon sum la tshig gis ci zhig bya zhe na rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i yul rtog par byed pa nyid kyi phyir mngon sum du yang 'gyur ro // mngon sum la tshig gis ci zhig bya zhe na rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.üîΩThe second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.üîΩThe second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.üîΩThe second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.

original: gzhan la rjes su dpag pa med pa bzhin du mngon sum med pa yang ngo //üîΩrang nyid kyis tshul gsum pas rtogs nas rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan la rjes su dpag pa med pa bzhin du mngon sum med pa yang ngo // rang nyid kyis tshul gsum pas rtogs nas rtogs par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa nyid yin na /
translated: The second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.üîΩThe second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.üîΩThe second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.üîΩThe second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.

original: mngon sum las rtogs nas rtogs par byed pa 'di na yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum las rtogs nas rtogs par byed pa 'di na yang de nyid yin te /
translated: The second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.üîΩThe second chapter of the commentary on the Ornament of the Middle Way, composed by the master BhƒÅviveka, is complete.

original: de las kyang rtogs bzhin pa ni tshig gi rtags kyi rnam par rtogs pa las rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs par byed pa po'i rang gi don gzhan gyi don yin na /
analyzed: de las kyang rtogs bzhin pa ni tshig gi rtags kyi rnam par rtogs pa las rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir rtogs par byed pa po'i rang gi don gzhan gyi don yin na /
translated: Moreover, since that which is being comprehended is comprehended from the verbal sign, the object of the one who comprehends would be the object of another.

original: mngon sum yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum yang 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa la rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you think that it would be direct perception, then the response is: ‚ÄúThe object of inference for oneself is not the object of inference for another.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyis kyang rtogs nas 'di 'di la smra bar bya'o zhes bya bas brtags pa'i yul nyid rjod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis kyang rtogs nas 'di 'di la smra bar bya'o zhes bya bas brtags pa'i yul nyid rjod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Direct perception also comprehends, and it expresses the object that is ascertained by the thought ‚ÄúThis is that.‚Äù

original: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i de ma thag tu rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i yang gnas skabs snga ma la yod do zhes bya ba'i don do //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i de ma thag tu rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa'i yang gnas skabs snga ma la yod do zhes bya ba'i don do //
translated: The object of inference for oneself exists in the prior state of the non-yogin, immediately prior to inference for oneself.

original: 'di'i bar na mngon sum rang gi don yod kyang rnam par dbye ba'i ched du so sor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i bar na mngon sum rang gi don yod kyang rnam par dbye ba'i ched du so sor bstan pa yin no //
translated: Up to this point, direct perception exists for oneself, but it is taught separately for the purpose of analysis.

original: de ltar na ni smra ba po gnyis kyis bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i rgol ba sel ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ni smra ba po gnyis kyis bye brag med do zhes bya ba'i rgol ba sel ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the objection that ‚Äúthere is no difference between the two speakers‚Äù is eliminated.

original: yang na tshad ma dang cig shos kyi rnam par dpyad pa ni rjes su dpag pas yin pa'i phyir de nyid dang por rnam par bkod nas gnyis pas /
analyzed: yang na tshad ma dang cig shos kyi rnam par dpyad pa ni rjes su dpag pas yin pa'i phyir de nyid dang por rnam par bkod nas gnyis pas /
translated: verse,

original: de nyid tshad ma mi slu can //
analyzed: de nyid tshad ma mi slu can //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is valid knowledge that is nondeceptive,‚ÄùüîΩthe general is distinguished and direct perception is illustrated.

original: zhes bya bas spyis kyang rnam par phye nas mngon sum gyis mtshon te de'i 'og tu de gnyi gas nges par rtogs pa gzhan la brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya bas spyis kyang rnam par phye nas mngon sum gyis mtshon te de'i 'og tu de gnyi gas nges par rtogs pa gzhan la brjod pa ste /
translated: Then, after that, the ascertainment by both of that is stated to another.

original: smra ba po'i gzhan don dang nyan pa po'i rjes su dpag pa yang yin te /
analyzed: smra ba po'i gzhan don dang nyan pa po'i rjes su dpag pa yang yin te /
translated: Also, the inference for the sake of another is speech.

original: 'brel pa rtogs pas rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa rtogs pas rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the inference for oneself is a sign because it is the realization of the relation.

original: yang na rjes su dpag pas spyir rnam par bzhag nas bsgoms pas ni khyad par mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pas spyir rnam par bzhag nas bsgoms pas ni khyad par mngon sum yin la /
translated: Or, having set forth the general by inference, the specific is direct perception by meditation.

original: snying rjes gzhan la de ltar ston @222b pa ni rtags med na rtogs par byed pa mi nus pa de'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ni le'u dang por rnam par gzhag pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i de ma thag pa nyid yin par
analyzed: snying rjes gzhan la de ltar ston @222b pa ni rtags med na rtogs par byed pa mi nus pa de'i phyir tshul gsum pa'i rtags brjod pa ni le'u dang por rnam par gzhag pa'i rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i de ma thag pa nyid yin par
translated: Compassionately teaching others in this way is impossible without a sign. Therefore, the expression of the sign of the three modes is immediately after the inference for oneself that was presented in the first chapter.

original: 'di kho nar yin te /
analyzed: 'di kho nar yin te /
translated: This is the only way it can be.

original: gzhan gyi don ni rang gi don sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don ni rang gi don sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the purpose of others is preceded by one's own purpose.

original: rang gis mthong ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas mthong ba'o //
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas mthong ba'o //
translated: What is seen by oneself is seen by direct perception and inference.

original: 'dis rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir rab gsal byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i phyir rab gsal byed pa yin te /
translated: Because it illuminates this, it is an illuminator.

original: nges par byed pa yin gyi tshig tsam las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges par byed pa yin gyi tshig tsam las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is a determiner, not just mere words.

original: rang gis mthong don zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pas rang gis mthong ba'i don las gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes grub pa'o //
analyzed: rang gis mthong don zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'jug pas rang gis mthong ba'i don las gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes grub pa'o //
translated: By adding of the seen meaning, it is established that it illuminates the meaning seen by oneself.

original: rang gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang gis zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: By oneself means by oneself.

original: de dag rnams kyi yang zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i drug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi yang zhes bya ba ni byed pa po'i drug pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äútheir‚Äù refers to the six [terms] beginning with ‚Äúauthor.‚Äù

original: log par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang gis mthong ba'i don gyis bzlog par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: log par rtogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang gis mthong ba'i don gyis bzlog par bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMisconception‚Äù means that the meaning of what is seen is to be refuted.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the elucidator.

original: rang gis mthong ba'i don ni gsal bar byed pa'i gnas skabs las tshul gsum yin te gzhan gyis mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni tshul gsum pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba'i don ni gsal bar byed pa'i gnas skabs las tshul gsum yin te gzhan gyis mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni tshul gsum pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of what is seen is the three modes from the perspective of the elucidator, because it is not possible for others. This is indicated by ‚Äúthe three modes.‚Äù

original: bsgrub bya la ni the tshom za pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub bya la ni the tshom za pa yin la /
translated: One has doubt regarding the probandum.

original: sgrub byed ni nges pa yin gsal bar byed pa dang rjes su dpag pa'i don yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub byed ni nges pa yin gsal bar byed pa dang rjes su dpag pa'i don yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni tshul gsum pa'i rtags las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The proof is certain. The meaning of the elucidator and the inferential subject are not otherwise. This is indicated by ‚Äúfrom the evidence of the three modes.‚Äù

original: lung las grub pa don med pa'i tshig la gzhan gyi don gyis rjes su dpag pa nyid yin par log par rtogs pa sel ba'i dbang du byas pa'i ngag la ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa yin par rgol bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rgyalüîΩpa can gyi'o //
analyzed: lung las grub pa don med pa'i tshig la gzhan gyi don gyis rjes su dpag pa nyid yin par log par rtogs pa sel ba'i dbang du byas pa'i ngag la ma tshang ba nyid la sogs pa yin par rgol bar mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni rgyal pa can gyi'o //
translated: The Victor‚Äôs words are not incomplete, etc., with regard to the statement of the establishment by scripture, because it is not proper to argue that the words are meaningless and that the inference for others is mistaken.

original: tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pas rjes su dpag pa yin gyis mngon sum ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin pas rjes su dpag pa yin gyis mngon sum ni ma yin te /
translated: Since words are the cause of inference, they are inference, not perception,

original: de'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni ji ltar tshig las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ma yin no zhes bstan pa ni ji ltar tshig las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because they are not the cause of that. This is indicated by ‚Äúfrom words.‚Äù

original: tshig las dran pa yin na bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i dran pa nyid rjes su dpag pa yin par bstan pa ni tshul gsum zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshig las dran pa yin na bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba'i dran pa nyid rjes su dpag pa yin par bstan pa ni tshul gsum zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is memory from words, then just the memory that is invariably concomitant with the probandum is inference. This is indicated by ‚Äúthe trimodal.‚Äù

original: dran pa mngon sum ma yin par bstan pa ni rang rig gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa mngon sum ma yin par bstan pa ni rang rig gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Memory is not perception. This is indicated by ‚Äúby reflexive awareness.‚Äù

original: tshig las ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshig las ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not from words?

original: du ba las 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ba las 'dir yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere, too, from smoke,‚Äù etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dran par bya ba'am dran pa la brjod kyi bya ba ni tshig tu'o //üîΩdon med do zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par byed pas te rgol ba po @223a * //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dran par bya ba'am dran pa la brjod kyi bya ba ni tshig tu'o // don med do zhes bya ba ni ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par byed pas te rgol ba po @223a * //
translated: Here, it refers to what is to be remembered or to memory, but action is a verbal form.

original: yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is meaningless means that it is meaningless to understand what has not been understood, because the opponent is the one who has not understood.

original: rtogs pa byung ba ni rtogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa byung ba ni rtogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: What has arisen from understanding is what has arisen from understanding.

original: don ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni tshig las de dang 'dra ba nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum la yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te zhes bya ba ni tshig las de dang 'dra ba nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum la yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is this means that inference from that similarity is also direct perception, this is the meaning.

original: 'bras bu la de'i 'dra ba nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni rang gi don la yang yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la de'i 'dra ba nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ni rang gi don la yang yin te /
translated: The result is that the nature of inference from that similarity is also for one's own purpose,

original: de nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba ma yin pas rang gi don ma yin par bstan pa ni rang don rjes dpag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid dang rjes su 'brel ba ma yin pas rang gi don ma yin par bstan pa ni rang don rjes dpag ces bya ba'o //
translated: because it is not connected with that itself, it is taught as not for one's own purpose. Inference for one's own purpose is the term.

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: Here, it is said is the objection.

original: rang gi don la rang bzhin 'jug kyang 'bras bu nyid nyams pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni 'gal ba ci zhig yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi don la rang bzhin 'jug kyang 'bras bu nyid nyams pa ma yin no zhes zer ba ni 'gal ba ci zhig yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: But even though it is engaged in its own aim, it does not fail in its result. What is the contradiction?

original: gzhan gyi don la ni de nyams pa yin no zhes zer ba ni gzhan gyi don gyis rjes su dpag par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la ni de nyams pa yin no zhes zer ba ni gzhan gyi don gyis rjes su dpag par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it does fail in the aim of others.üîΩHow is it possible?

original: ji ltar srid pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du rang bzhin kho na yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi don du rang bzhin kho na yin pa'o //
translated: It is only for the sake of others that it is natural.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la'o //
translated: In others, i.e., in the result.

original: ji ltar srid pa ni gtan tshigs grub pa la 'brel pa'i don du dang / 'di ma grub na gtan tshigs kyi don du dang gnyi ga ma grub na gnyi ga'i don du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar srid pa ni gtan tshigs grub pa la 'brel pa'i don du dang / 'di ma grub na gtan tshigs kyi don du dang gnyi ga ma grub na gnyi ga'i don du'o //
translated: How is it possible? It is the reason for the establishment of the connection, and if that is not established, it is the reason for the reason, and if neither is established, it is the reason for both.

original: tshig ni rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid yin pas tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas par 'dir ma yin par bstan pa ni tshig la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshig ni rjes su dpag pa nyid kyis tshad ma nyid yin pas tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas par 'dir ma yin par bstan pa ni tshig la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The word is valid cognition itself by means of inference, so it is valid, not otherwise. This is the meaning in brief.

original: rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa'i tshig kyang tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa'i tshig kyang tshad ma yin te /
translated: Also, a statement that is not an inference is a means of valid cognition.

original: rgol ba bstan pa ni ji skad du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba bstan pa ni ji skad du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent's position is stated means as follows.

original: med par 'gyur ram ci zhes bya ba ni dran nas kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ram ci zhes bya ba ni dran nas kyang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: What is the point of saying it would not exist? Because it arises even when remembered.

original: de lta bu'i don can zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs par rtogs pa'i don can no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don can zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs par rtogs pa'i don can no //
translated: Having such a meaning means having the meaning of being understood as perception, etc.

original: mngon sum ltar zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi tshig las mngon sum gyi shes pa yin no zhes zer bas so //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi tshig las mngon sum gyi shes pa yin no zhes zer bas so //
translated: Like perception means that from the words of the Vedas, it is said to be the knowledge of perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa yid ches pa'i gnas ji ltar yin zhe na 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa pa ni rjes su 'gro dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yid ches pa'i gnas ji ltar yin zhe na 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa pa ni rjes su 'gro dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is inference a reliable means of knowledge? It is taught that because of the connection, meaning because of the invariable relation.

original: rjes su dpag pa bzhin du rig byed kyang 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la yang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bzhin du rig byed kyang 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la yang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as with inference, the Vedas would also be so. This is stated by or.

original: ngag la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don nyid bstan pa ni gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngag la log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i don nyid bstan pa ni gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The very purpose of removing misconceptions about speech is taught by to others.

original: gzhan dag gis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni lung las so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis mthong ba zhes bya ba ni lung las so //
translated: The phrase seen by others refers to scriptural statements.

original: bdag mthong ba'i tshig ni rang gis mthong ba'i tshig go //üîΩrang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba dang bcas pas gzhan gyis mthong ba thams cad rnam par bcad na rang nyid kyis lung @223b las grub pa'i rtags nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag mthong ba'i tshig ni rang gis mthong ba'i tshig go // rang nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni nges par gzung ba dang bcas pas gzhan gyis mthong ba thams cad rnam par bcad na rang nyid kyis lung @223b las grub pa'i rtags nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba ni gal te de ltar na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase seen by oneself refers to direct perception.üîΩIf you claim that the phrase by oneself is meant to exclude all other means of knowledge, then the phrase by oneself would be redundant, since inference would be established as a means of knowledge only through scriptural statements.

original: gzhan kho nas zhes bya ba'i nges pa yin na rang gi mthong ba bkag pas gnyi ga la grub pa nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni ma yin te gnyi gas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan kho nas zhes bya ba'i nges pa yin na rang gi mthong ba bkag pas gnyi ga la grub pa nyid du 'gyur bar bstan pa ni ma yin te gnyi gas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the phrase by oneself is meant to exclude other means of knowledge, then the phrase by oneself would be redundant, since inference would be established as a means of knowledge only through scriptural statements. The phrase by oneself is meant to exclude the possibility that the object is known by some other means of knowledge.

original: rang gi brjod bya las ni sgra'i nus pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi brjod bya las ni sgra'i nus pa yin la /
translated: The power of a word to express its meaning is exhausted by the expression of that meaning.

original: gzhan la 'jug pa ni de'i shugs kyis yin par bstan pa ni ji ltar gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la 'jug pa ni de'i shugs kyis yin par bstan pa ni ji ltar gnas pa nyid do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression of other meanings is due to the force of that expression. The phrase just as it is indicates that the expression of other meanings is due to the force of that expression.

original: de'i don zhes bya ba ni log par rtogs ba bsal ba'i don yin par mi rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i don zhes bya ba ni log par rtogs ba bsal ba'i don yin par mi rigs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of that is not tenable as the meaning of the removal of wrong understanding.

original: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni rang gi brjod bya'i don du'o //
analyzed: gang gi don du zhes bya ba ni rang gi brjod bya'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of what? For the sake of one‚Äôs own object of expression.

original: gzhan nyid kyis zhes bya ba bkag pas de thob pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyis zhes bya ba bkag pas de thob pa'i phyir gzhan gyis ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: Since it is refuted by the statement ‚ÄúBy another,‚Äù the opponent‚Äôs response is ‚ÄúBy another.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis ni rgol ba pos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni rgol ba pos so //
translated: By another is by the opponent.

original: yongs su shes pa ni phyir rgol ba'i'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni phyir rgol ba'i'o //
translated: Complete understanding is by the opponent.

original: gzhan la ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: To another is to the opponent.

original: rang gis ni rgol ba pos so //
analyzed: rang gis ni rgol ba pos so //
translated: By oneself is by the proponent.

original: gzhan la ni phyir rgol ba la grub pas so //
analyzed: gzhan la ni phyir rgol ba la grub pas so //
translated: To another is to the opponent, by way of establishing.

original: de nyid du ni rgol ba pos yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid du ni rgol ba pos yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: To that very is by the proponent, by way of complete understanding.

original: gang gis de lta yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gis de lta yin pa des na'o //
translated: Since that is so, then.

original: don la rang gi rtogs pa med kyang rjod par byed pa bzhin du gzhan gyis rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: don la rang gi rtogs pa med kyang rjod par byed pa bzhin du gzhan gyis rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even though there is no understanding of the meaning by oneself, is there not understanding by another, just as there is expression?

original: rtogs pa yod na tshig 'byung bar bstan pa ni tshu rol mthong bas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa yod na tshig 'byung bar bstan pa ni tshu rol mthong bas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The teaching that the arising of words is when there is understanding is ‚ÄúBy those with limited vision.‚Äù

original: rjod par byed pa nyid la sogs pa yang rang nyid kyis ma shes pa gzhan gyis shes so zhes bya ba ni tha snyad la sogs pas shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa nyid la sogs pa yang rang nyid kyis ma shes pa gzhan gyis shes so zhes bya ba ni tha snyad la sogs pas shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Also, the one who expresses and so on are not known by the one who does not know himself, and the other is not known by the one who knows. The meaning is that they are not known by convention and so on.

original: rang gis kyang zhes bya ba ni de rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gis kyang zhes bya ba ni de rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Also, by oneself means by that cognition.

original: lung zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lung zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: It is connected with scripture.

original: rang gis mthong ba gzhan nyid kyis mthong zhes bya bas lung las gzhan gyis mthong ba'i lung khas blangs pa ni ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la yongs brtags zhes bya ba ste /üîΩrjes su dpag pa'i yul te gnas la sgrub pa'i rtogs par bya ba la tshig tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gis mthong ba gzhan nyid kyis mthong zhes bya bas lung las gzhan gyis mthong ba'i lung khas blangs pa ni ji ltar yin zhes zer ba la yongs brtags zhes bya ba ste / rjes su dpag pa'i yul te gnas la sgrub pa'i rtogs par bya ba la tshig tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since what is seen by oneself is seen by another is said, how is it that what is seen by another is accepted as scripture? Imagined is said.

original: stobs mi mtshungs pa'i phyir dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs mi mtshungs pa'i phyir dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of inference is not accepted as a valid means of knowledge in the proof of what is to be known, because it is not equal in strength and there is no connection.

original: de lta na gang gi tshe de tshad ma yin zhes zer ba la tshad ma dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i yul khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa'i ngo bo'i tshad ma nyid yin gyi lkog tu gyur ba'i dus na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na gang gi tshe de tshad ma yin zhes zer ba la tshad ma dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i yul khas blangs pa'i phyir khas blangs pa'i ngo bo'i tshad ma nyid yin gyi lkog tu gyur ba'i dus na ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when it is said, ‚ÄúAt what time is it a valid cognition?,‚Äù it is a valid cognition in the sense of being accepted, because the object that is investigated by valid cognitions is accepted. It is not [a valid cognition] at the time when it is hidden.

original: de lta bur 'di tshad ma nyid yin na sgrub par byed pa bzhin du bsgrub bya la yang 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa thams cad tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bur 'di tshad ma nyid yin na sgrub par byed pa bzhin du bsgrub bya la yang 'gyur ba'i rjes su dpag pa thams cad tshad ma yin te /
translated: If it were a valid cognition in that way, then all inferences would be valid cognitions, just like the proof.

original: lung yang lung las rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur ba @224a * //
analyzed: lung yang lung las rjes su dpog par mi 'gyur ba @224a * //
translated: Also, scripture would not be an inference from scripture.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de yang 'brel pa 'dzin par grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de yang 'brel pa 'dzin par grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is only established as holding a connection.

original: ma grub na de'i tshe tshig tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ma grub na de'i tshe tshig tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is not established, then at that time it is not a valid statement, this is the meaning.

original: 'ga' la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'ga' la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba la yang ngo //
translated: It is not for anyone, meaning not even for the opponent.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtags pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni yongs su brtags pa'i dus na'o //
translated: In the domain of inference, meaning at the time of investigation.

original: 'di'i yongs su brtags pa yang rang gi yul kho na la ma yin nam ma yin te de mngon sum dang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i yongs su brtags pa yang rang gi yul kho na la ma yin nam ma yin te de mngon sum dang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: And is its investigation also not only with respect to its own object? No, he says, it is also with respect to the object of direct perception.

original: tshad ma yin pa ni yongs su brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa ni yongs su brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a valid means of knowledge, it investigates.

original: de'i yul la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lung gi yul la'o //
analyzed: de'i yul la ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lung gi yul la'o //
translated: It is not with respect to its own object, but with respect to the object of scripture.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul las gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pa'i yul las gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: Everywhere means also with respect to objects other than those of direct perception, etc.

original: grangs can gyi tshig ces bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: grangs can gyi tshig ces bya ba ni bde ba la sogs pa sems pa can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya are that pleasure, etc. are not mental.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni tshad ma'o //
translated: Proof is a valid means of knowledge.

original: gzhan la yang de ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la yang de ma grub pa yin te /
translated: It is not established for others.

original: phyin ci log pa'i bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pas de'i tshe lung de bor ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni lung la gnod phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pas de'i tshe lung de bor ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni lung la gnod phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the object to be established is understood in a distorted way, at that time that scripture is abandoned. The statement that it is because scripture is invalid is to explain that.

original: blo la brten pa'i chos dang chos can gyi rigs pas thams cad mi dmigs pas med par rtogs na /
analyzed: blo la brten pa'i chos dang chos can gyi rigs pas thams cad mi dmigs pas med par rtogs na /
translated: When one realizes the non-existence of everything through the reasoning of the subject and predicate being based on the mind,

original: tshad mas grub pas gnod pa yin na yang chu lon gyis ci zhig dgos zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshad mas grub pas gnod pa yin na yang chu lon gyis ci zhig dgos zhes bya ba lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: If it is invalidated by valid cognition, then what is the use of a dike?

original: sems pa can ma yin pa la brtags pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sems pa can ma yin pa la brtags pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no valid cognition other than the examination of non-mental entities.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed las bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni sgrub byed las bsgrub bya rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: At that time means when the probandum is understood from the proof.

original: tshad ma min pa ni snga ma yang yin te dus gzhan na yang gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma min pa ni snga ma yang yin te dus gzhan na yang gnod pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a valid cognition even before, because even at another time, there is invalidation.

original: bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba nyid rtogs na yang ngo //
analyzed: bsgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba nyid rtogs na yang ngo //
translated: Even if the invariable concomitance with the absence of the probandum is understood,

original: de bas na ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not a valid cognition because it is not a valid cognition.

original: des ni lung gis so //
analyzed: des ni lung gis so //
translated: By that, it is scripture.

original: ma lus grub ma yin zhes bya ba ni grub byed kyang ngo //
analyzed: ma lus grub ma yin zhes bya ba ni grub byed kyang ngo //
translated: Not established in its entirety means also not established by the proof.

original: khas blangs pas byas pa yang de yin la //
analyzed: khas blangs pas byas pa yang de yin la //
translated: It is also made by assertion,

original: tshad ma'i dngos po yang de la yin pa de ni lung gi tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma'i dngos po yang de la yin pa de ni lung gi tshad ma yin la /
translated: and the nature of valid cognition is also in that, that is scriptural valid cognition.

original: de zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa'o //
translated: That refers to the assertion.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni lung gi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni lung gi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the scripture.

original: de la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa la rag las pa'o //
analyzed: de la rag las pa zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa la rag las pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDependent on that‚Äù means dependent on the assertion.

original: bdag nyid thams cad ni tshad ma cig shos nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad ni tshad ma cig shos nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll of itself‚Äù means the other valid cognition, etc.

original: mtshang ni sba bar bya ba ste mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshang ni sba bar bya ba ste mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúFlaw‚Äù means something to be concealed, i.e., something unknown.

original: de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa mi shes kyang ngo //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa mi shes kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúNevertheless‚Äù means even though the proof is unknown.

original: skyon ci yod ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon ci yod ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the flaw?‚Äù means because the probandum is known.

original: rtogs par bya pa'i skyon @224b yang med do zhes zer ba ni rang la grub pa'i zhes bya ba ste phyir rgol ba la grub pas so //
analyzed: rtogs par bya pa'i skyon @224b yang med do zhes zer ba ni rang la grub pa'i zhes bya ba ste phyir rgol ba la grub pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no flaw in what is to be understood‚Äù means ‚Äúestablished for oneself‚Äù and so on, i.e., established for the opponent.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po'am rtags kyis so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rgol ba po'am rtags kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means by the opponent or the reason.

original: ji ste 'di zhes bya ba ni grangs can no //
analyzed: ji ste 'di zhes bya ba ni grangs can no //
translated: ‚ÄúIf this‚Äù refers to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: rgol ba rtag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ngo zlog par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba rtag pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ngo zlog par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe opponent is not permanent‚Äù means ‚Äúthe reversal.‚Äù

original: gzhan kho bo'i sgrub byed la rtogs par mi shes na ji ltar rjod par byed ces bstan pa ni gang zhig gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o //üîΩma rtogs par ni ma rtogs pa las so //
analyzed: gzhan kho bo'i sgrub byed la rtogs par mi shes na ji ltar rjod par byed ces bstan pa ni gang zhig gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'o // ma rtogs par ni ma rtogs pa las so //
translated: He shows that: ‚ÄúIf you do not understand it, you do not understand it because of the opponent.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa ni phyir rgol bas so //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa ni phyir rgol bas so //
translated: If you do understand it, you understand it because of the opponent.üîΩHe shows that mere understanding is not the means of understanding: ‚ÄúI will understand your understanding.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.

original: rtogs pa tsam las rtogs par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni nga yis khyod kyi zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa tsam las rtogs par byed pa ma yin par bstan pa ni nga yis khyod kyi zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.

original: bslus nas kyang zhes bya ba 'brel pa med par smras pas so //üîΩrtogs par byed pa 'di la rtogs pa med pa de'o //
analyzed: bslus nas kyang zhes bya ba 'brel pa med par smras pas so // rtogs par byed pa 'di la rtogs pa med pa de'o //
translated: ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.

original: rang gis rtogs pa med pa ni rgol ba stan par byed par mi 'gyur te /üîΩgal te phyir rgol ba gzhan khas mi len pa ste //üîΩsgrub par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gis rtogs pa med pa ni rgol ba stan par byed par mi 'gyur te / gal te phyir rgol ba gzhan khas mi len pa ste // sgrub par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.

original: pa rgyal khas len par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la bdag nyid nyams par byed pa su yod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa rgyal khas len par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba la bdag nyid nyams par byed pa su yod ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù He shows that the means of understanding is not understood: ‚ÄúI will deceive you.üîΩ‚Äù He

original: rang nyid tshad mas zhes bya ba ni rgol bas rtogs na'o //
analyzed: rang nyid tshad mas zhes bya ba ni rgol bas rtogs na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy oneself through valid cognition‚Äù means by the proponent.

original: khas mi len pas zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: khas mi len pas zhes bya ba ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy not accepting‚Äù means by the opponent.

original: gzhan mi bden par smra ba ni rtogs nas khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan mi bden par smra ba ni rtogs nas khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the opponent does not accept the other‚Äôs words as true, he does not accept them after understanding them.

original: nus pa las 'das nas ma byas pas zhes bya ba ni nus pa med pas ma byas nas snying rjes med pa'i bdag nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: nus pa las 'das nas ma byas pas zhes bya ba ni nus pa med pas ma byas nas snying rjes med pa'i bdag nyid mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving exceeded one‚Äôs ability, not doing it‚Äù means that one does not do it because one is not able to do it, and one does not become a person who lacks compassion.

original: phyogs su lhung ba dang bral ba'i nyan pa po yin no zhes zer ba la thams cad rtsod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyogs su lhung ba dang bral ba'i nyan pa po yin no zhes zer ba la thams cad rtsod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe listener is free from bias‚Äù means that all is disputed.

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of mutual dependence‚Äù means that it is not a dispute.

original: nyan pa po gcig ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan pa po gcig ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: There is not a single listener, he thinks.

original: de lta na ni gtan la bab pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni gtan la bab pa kho na yin par bstan pa ni de lta na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case, it is settled‚Äù is taught.

original: bsgrub bya'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sgrub byed rtogs bzhin pa yang lung las khas blangs pa ma bor ba yin no zhes zer ba la /üîΩgal te lung de ldan la grub //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i rjes su 'gro ba'i sgrub byed rtogs bzhin pa yang lung las khas blangs pa ma bor ba yin no zhes zer ba la / gal te lung de ldan la grub //
translated: And the reason that follows the probandum is recognized, and one does not abandon the acceptance of scripture.

original: ces bya ba'o //üîΩde bor na rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhes zer ba la gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o // de bor na rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no zhes zer ba la gang gi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one has that scripture, one is established.üîΩIf one abandons that, it is not a reason that follows.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i don du de bor phan ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba la tshad mas gnod la zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdes zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pas sam /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i don du de bor phan ma grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba la tshad mas gnod la zhes bya ba'o // des zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pas sam /
translated: If one abandons that for the sake of following, it is not established.

original: rgol bas so //
analyzed: rgol bas so //
translated: By that means by the proof, or by the opponent.

original: snang ba mi shes na zhes bya ba ni lung la gnod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsgrub par byed pa'i ngag tshad mar khas @225a * //
analyzed: snang ba mi shes na zhes bya ba ni lung la gnod pa'i phyir ro // sgrub par byed pa'i ngag tshad mar khas @225a * //
translated: If one does not understand the appearance, means because of the harm to scripture.

original: blangs nas de dang 'gal ba'i ngag gzhan lung ma yin pa bor ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: blangs nas de dang 'gal ba'i ngag gzhan lung ma yin pa bor ba ma yin nam /
translated: Having accepted the words of the proof as valid, is not another statement that contradicts that, which is not scripture, to be abandoned?

original: dper na skye dgu'i bdag pos chu lha la rta byin pa ster ba po'i nye bar rtsom pas rta len pa'i chu lha gang yin pa des gnod pa blangs pa'i phyir len pa po nyams par gyur pa zhes zer ba la de dang 'gal ba khas len pa
analyzed: dper na skye dgu'i bdag pos chu lha la rta byin pa ster ba po'i nye bar rtsom pas rta len pa'i chu lha gang yin pa des gnod pa blangs pa'i phyir len pa po nyams par gyur pa zhes zer ba la de dang 'gal ba khas len pa
translated: For example, the Lord of Beings gave a horse to the god of water. The god of water who received the horse, because of the giver's effort to give, took the horse.

original: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'i dus na'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'i dus na'o //
translated: The word then is at the time of the probandum.

original: de nyid kyis ni sgrub par byed pa'i dus kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni sgrub par byed pa'i dus kyis so //
translated: The word by that is by the time of the proof.

original: nyams pa mi bden nyid ni rtsom pa po la yang nus pa mtshungs pa'i phyir 'dis ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tshig brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams pa mi bden nyid ni rtsom pa po la yang nus pa mtshungs pa'i phyir 'dis ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'i tshig brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word then is at the time of the probandum. The word by that is by the time of the proof. Because the fault of the one who undertakes is the same as the fault of the one who undertakes, this expresses the statement of the inferendum.

original: 'on te bye brag pa'i lung las gnyi ga grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba la de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te bye brag pa'i lung las gnyi ga grub pa nyid yin no zhes zer ba la de las gzhan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: But if it is said that both are established from the Vai≈õe·π£ika scriptures, then from that other means

original: sangs rgyas pa las gzhan pa bye brag pa dang grangs can la sogs pa'i bsgrub byar khas len na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa las gzhan pa bye brag pa dang grangs can la sogs pa'i bsgrub byar khas len na /
translated: that if one accepts the probandum from the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, and so on, who are other than Buddhists,

original: de zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa dor ba'i yan lag khyad par gang gi yin pa de dor bar bya ba ni tshad ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba sangs rgyas pa dor ba'i yan lag khyad par gang gi yin pa de dor bar bya ba ni tshad ma yin te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That which is called ‚Äúthat‚Äù is the object of rejection, which is the valid cognition, that is, the special property of the one who rejects.

original: gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo dang rjes su 'gro ba dag mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi ngo bo dang rjes su 'gro ba dag mi 'grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nature of the reason and its pervasion are not established.

original: 'grel pa ni gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni gsal ba yin no //
translated: The commentary is clear.

original: rtogs min na zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i sgrub byed ma brjod na'o //
analyzed: rtogs min na zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i sgrub byed ma brjod na'o //
translated: If it is not understood, if the correct proof is not stated.

original: skal ldan yang ni nus pa can yang ngo //
analyzed: skal ldan yang ni nus pa can yang ngo //
translated: Fortunate also means capable.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni lan yin no //
translated: This is the reply.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid gzhan gyi yang sgrub par byed pa bstan pa ni rang rtogs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa nyid gzhan gyi yang sgrub par byed pa bstan pa ni rang rtogs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the teaching that the proof of one‚Äôs own understanding is also the proof of another‚Äôs is ‚Äúone‚Äôs own understanding.‚Äù

original: de lung las gzhan pa gang zhig yin zhes zer ba la rig pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lung las gzhan pa gang zhig yin zhes zer ba la rig pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: What is it that is other than scripture? It is called ‚Äúreasoning.‚Äù

original: lung gi tshad ma nyid khas blangs pas byas pa yin te rang nyid don dang 'brel pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir khas blangs pa'i rtsa ba can gyi tshad ma nyid ni de med na khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lung gi tshad ma nyid khas blangs pas byas pa yin te rang nyid don dang 'brel pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir khas blangs pa'i rtsa ba can gyi tshad ma nyid ni de med na khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The reason is because of the acceptance of the valid cognition of scripture, because it is devoid of connection with the object, etc. The meaning is that if that is not the case, then the valid cognition is based on the acceptance.

original: 'di'i yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'i ste de 'dzin na de'i yul can gyi lung yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya'i ste de 'dzin na de'i yul can gyi lung yang tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The also here is with regard to the probandum, because if it is apprehended, then the scripture that has it as its object is also not a valid cognition.

original: 'grel par ni 'di'i yang zhes bya ba ste sangs rgyas pa'i bsgrub bya 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'grel par ni 'di'i yang zhes bya ba ste sangs rgyas pa'i bsgrub bya 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: In the commentary, also means that it is the apprehension of the Buddhist probandum.

original: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i sems pa can rnal 'byor pa'i rtogs bya nyid la yang tshad ma gzhan rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gi bsgrub par bya ba'i sems pa can rnal 'byor pa'i rtogs bya nyid la yang tshad ma gzhan rtsa ba yin te /
translated: The cognition of the yogi who has the intention to establish his own probandum also has another valid cognition as its basis.

original: gang gis 'grub pa bsgoms pas rnal 'byor pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni sngar ni sgrub byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'grub pa bsgoms pas rnal 'byor pa nyid yin par bstan pa ni sngar ni sgrub byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching that it is established by the cultivation of meditation is the proof mentioned earlier.

original: sngar rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa na gang dag gis zhes bya ba sems pa can dang cig shos sgrub par byed pa bsgoms pa rnams kyis dbang po phul du byung ba @225b dang rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngar rnal 'byor pa ma yin pa na gang dag gis zhes bya ba sems pa can dang cig shos sgrub par byed pa bsgoms pa rnams kyis dbang po phul du byung ba @225b dang rtogs pa ste /
translated: Those who previously were not yogis, but who are intelligent and who practice the other, i.e., meditation, have the best of faculties and understanding.

original: khong du chud pa de las de dag skye ba'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa de las de dag skye ba'o //
translated: From that, they are born.

original: yang ni rtogs pa ni nges pa brjod pa ste /
analyzed: yang ni rtogs pa ni nges pa brjod pa ste /
translated: Or, understanding is said to be ascertainment.

original: khong du chud pa nan tan du byed pa'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa nan tan du byed pa'o //
translated: Realization is the practice of ascertainment.

original: gzhan dag ni mngon sum yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mngon sum yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that the other is direct perception.

original: de'i ni sangs rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ni sangs rgyas pa'o //
translated: That is the Buddhist.

original: don nus ni sems pa can dang cig shos bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don nus ni sems pa can dang cig shos bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The capacity of the object is the intelligent and the other, i.e., action, etc.

original: gzhan dag ni bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi nus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi nus pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it is the capacity of the probandum and the probans.

original: bsgrub bya ni sems pa can yin na de la ci'i phyir nus pa med ces bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya ni sems pa can yin na de la ci'i phyir nus pa med ces bya ba ni rgyal ba can gyi'o //
translated: If the probandum is the intelligent, why is there no capacity in that? This is the Vaisesika view.

original: dbang po ni bsgrub bya yin la de sgrub par byed pa ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: dbang po ni bsgrub bya yin la de sgrub par byed pa ni thabs yin no //
translated: The faculty is the probandum, and the means of establishing that is the method.

original: de'i nus pa'i shes pa la nus pa yang zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i nus pa'i shes pa la nus pa yang zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs ma yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúthe cognition of its capacity, also‚Äù does not refer to the state of being a cause.

original: tshad mas mthong ba bsgoms pas mngon du byed pa ni rnal 'byor pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba bsgoms pas mngon du byed pa ni rnal 'byor pa nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the yogi/nƒ´ alone, not anyone else, realizes through meditation what is seen by means of valid cognition.

original: me'i spyin sreg gis mtho ris sgrub par byed pa nyid bzhin du sems can ma mthong ba dang 'brel pa nyid kyis shes so zhes zer ba la /üîΩgang yang rjes 'gro rnam chad can //
analyzed: me'i spyin sreg gis mtho ris sgrub par byed pa nyid bzhin du sems can ma mthong ba dang 'brel pa nyid kyis shes so zhes zer ba la / gang yang rjes 'gro rnam chad can //
translated: Just as the fire sacrifice accomplishes heaven, so too the connection with the unseen sentient being is understood.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The opponent says:üîΩBut there is no connection with the unseen,üîΩbecause there is no connection with the unseen.

original: dpe la rjes su 'gro ba mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dpe la rjes su 'gro ba mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The example does not have the property of being connected.

original: dbang po la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba rnam par chad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba rnam par chad pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the sense faculties, etc., connected?üîΩHow can they be established?

original: ji ltar grub par bya ba yin zhes zer ba la spyis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar grub par bya ba yin zhes zer ba la spyis kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúEven by the universal.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu ni byed pa'i sgrub byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni byed pa'i sgrub byed do //
translated: The effect is the proof of the cause.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang de lta yin pa'i phyir cis rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba yin gyi mi rtag pa'i sems pa can gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i shes pa yang de lta yin pa'i phyir cis rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba yin gyi mi rtag pa'i sems pa can gyis ma yin no //
translated: because the cognition of a pot, etc. is also like that.

original: bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dpyod pa ni go bya go byed la dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dpyod pa ni go bya go byed la dpyod pa'o //
translated: The examination of the probandum and probans is the examination of the cognized and cognizer.

original: 'grel pa ni gsal lo //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni gsal lo //
translated: The commentary is clear.

original: khyad par gyi zhes bya ba ni sems par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi zhes bya ba ni sems par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù is to be supplied with the word ‚Äúmaker.‚Äù

original: khas blangs pa tshad ma'i rtsa ba can ci'i phyir yin khyad par gyi rtsa ba can yang tshad ma ma yin nam zhes zer ba la skyes bu'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khas blangs pa tshad ma'i rtsa ba can ci'i phyir yin khyad par gyi rtsa ba can yang tshad ma ma yin nam zhes zer ba la skyes bu'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why is the acceptance based on the root of valid cognition? Is the distinction based on the root of valid cognition not valid?

original: tshad ma ni khyad par can dang cig shos nyid ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma ni khyad par can dang cig shos nyid ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Valid cognition is the distinction, and the other is not valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: bsam pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyi dbang gis so //
analyzed: bsam pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni de tsam gyi dbang gis so //
translated: By the power of thought means by the power of that alone.
